2204          *     <tr><td>YouTube</td><td>youtube.leanback.v4</td><td></td></tr>
2205          *     <tr><td>Yupp TV</td><td>yupptv</td><td></td></tr>
2206          * </table>
2207          * 
2208          * @param {Object} param
2209          * <ul>
2210          *   <li>{String} param.id - application id to launch.</li>
2211          *   <li>{String} param.parameters [Optional] - parameters in JSON type string for the application to be launched.</li>
2212          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2213          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2214          *   param.onSuccess = function() 
2215          *       // No Parameter.
2216          *   }</pre>
2217          *   </li>
2218          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2219          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2220          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2221          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2222          *   }</pre>
2223          *   </li>
2224          * </ul>
2225          * 
2226          * @since 1.20.1
2227          * 
2228          * @see
2229          * <a href="hcap.application.html#.getServiceXml">hcap.application.getServiceXml()</a><br>
2230          * <a href="hcap.application.html#.getDefaultServiceXml">hcap.application.getDefaultServiceXml()</a><br>
2231          * <a href="hcap.application.html#.getApplicationList">hcap.application.getApplicationList()</a><br>
2232          * <a href="hcap.application.html#.destroyApplication">hcap.application.destroyApplication()</a><br>
2233          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a><br>
2234          *
2235          * @example
2236          * hcap.application.launchApplication({
2237          *      "id" : "com.zenith.app.gbrowser", // NK-Browser
2238          *      "parameters" : "{
2239          *          'target':'http://www.lge.com'
2240          *      }",
2241          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2242          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2243          *      },
2244          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2245          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2246          *      }
2247          * });
2248          */
2249         hcap.application.launchApplication = function (param) {
2250             hcap_command("launch_application", param);
2251         };
2252         /**
2253          * Terminates the application.<br>
2254          * This is worked only when the property "asl_mode" is "1".
2255          * 
2256          * @param {Object} param
2257          * <ul>
2258          *   <li>{String} param.id - application id to destroy.</li>
2259          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2260          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2261          *   param.onSuccess = function() 
2262          *       // No Parameter.
2263          *   }</pre>
2264          *   </li>
2265          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2266          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2267          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2268          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2269          *   }</pre>
2270          *   </li>
2271          * </ul>
2272          * 
2273          * @since 1.20.1
2274          * 
2275          * @see
2276          * <a href="hcap.application.html#.getServiceXml">hcap.application.getServiceXml()</a><br>
2277          * <a href="hcap.application.html#.getDefaultServiceXml">hcap.application.getDefaultServiceXml()</a><br>
2278          * <a href="hcap.application.html#.getApplicationList">hcap.application.getApplicationList()</a><br>
2279          * <a href="hcap.application.html#.launchApplication">hcap.application.launchApplication()</a><br>
2280          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a><br>
2281          *
2282          * @example
2283          * hcap.application.destroyApplication({
2284          *      "id" : "accuweather",
2285          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2286          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2287          *      },
2288          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2289          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2290          *      }
2291          * });
2292          */
2293         hcap.application.destroyApplication = function (param) {
2294             hcap_command("destroy_application", param);
2295         };
2296         /** 
2297          * @namespace hcap.video
2298          */
2299         hcap.video = { };
2300         /**
2301          * Gets the current video size.<br>
2302          * Position and size parameters are on the basis of the resolution of the property "display_resolution".<br>
2303          * 
2304          * @param {Object} param
2305          * <ul>
2306          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2307          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2308          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2309          *       // {Number} param.x - x position of the video
2310          *       // {Number} param.y - y position of the video
2311          *       // {Number} param.width - width of the video
2312          *       // {Number} param.height - height of the video
2313          *   }</pre>
2314          *   </li>
2315          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2316          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2317          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2318          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2319          *   }</pre>
2320          *   </li>
2321          * </ul>
2322          * 
2323          * @since 1.3.1
2324          * 
2325          * @see
2326          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.setVideoSize">hcap.video.setVideoSize()</a><br>
2327          *
2328          * @example
2329          * hcap.video.getVideoSize({
2330          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
2331          *          console.log("onSuccess : " + 
2332          *              "\n x = " + s.x +
2333          *              "\n y = " + s.y +
2334          *              "\n width = " + s.width +
2335          *              "\n height = " + s.height);
2336          *      },
2337          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2338          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2339          *      }
2340          * });
2341          */
2342         hcap.video.getVideoSize = function (param) {
2343             hcap_command("get_video_size", param);
2344         };
2345         /**
2346          * Resizes the video size.<br>
2347          * Position and size parameters are on the basis of the resolution of the property "display_resolution".<br>
2348          * Supported size values are dependent on the platform or the model.<br>
2349          *
2350          * @param {Object} param
2351          * <ul>
2352          *   <li>{Number} param.x - x position of the video.</li>
2353          *   <li>{Number} param.y - y position of the video.</li>
2354          *   <li>{Number} param.width - width of the video.</li>
2355          *   <li>{Number} param.height - height of the video.</li>
2356          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
2357          *           Setting to the same x/y/width/height as before will invoke this callback function.
2358          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2359          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2360          *       // No Parameter.
2361          *   }</pre>
2362          *   </li>
2363          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2364          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2365          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2366          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2367          *   }</pre>
2368          *   </li>
2369          * </ul>
2370          * 
2371          * @since 1.3.1
2372          * 
2373          * @see
2374          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.getVideoSize">hcap.video.getVideoSize()</a><br>
2375          *
2376          * @example
2377          * hcap.video.setVideoSize({
2378          *      "x" : 10, 
2379          *      "y" : 10,
2380          *      "width" : 400,
2381          *      "height" : 300,
2382          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2383          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2384          *      }, 
2385          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2386          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2387          *      }
2388          * });
2389          */
2390         hcap.video.setVideoSize = function (param) {
2391             hcap_command("set_video_size", param);
2392         };
2393         /**
2394          * Gets the transparency level of the OSD.<br>
2395          * 
2396          * @param {Object} param
2397          * <ul>
2398          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2399          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2400          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2401          *       // {Number} param.level - transparency level of the OSD (transparent 0 ~ 100 opaque)
2402          *   }</pre>
2403          *   </li>
2404          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2405          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2406          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2407          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2408          *   }</pre>
2409          *   </li>
2410          * </ul>
2411          * 
2412          * @since 1.3.1
2413          * 
2414          * @see
2415          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.setOsdTransparencyLevel">hcap.video.setOsdTransparencyLevel()</a><br>
2416          *
2417          * @example
2418          * hcap.video.getOsdTransparencyLevel({
2419          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
2420          *          console.log("onSuccess : level = " + s.level);
2421          *      }, 
2422          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2423          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2424          *      }
2425          * });
2426          */
2427         hcap.video.getOsdTransparencyLevel = function (param) {
2428             hcap_command("get_osd_transparency_level", param);
2429         };
2430         /**
2431          * Sets the transparency level of the OSD.<br>
2432          *
2433          * @param {Object} param
2434          * <ul>
2435          *   <li>{Number} param.level [Required] - transparency level to be set (transparent 0 ~ 100 opaque)</li>
2436          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
2437          *           Setting to same transparency level as before will invoke this callback function.
2438          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2439          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2440          *       // No Parameter.
2441          *   }</pre>
2442          *   </li>
2443          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2444          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2445          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2446          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2447          *   }</pre>
2448          *   </li>
2449          * </ul>
2450          * 
2451          * @since 1.3.1
2452          * 
2453          * @see
2454          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.getOsdTransparencyLevel">hcap.video.getOsdTransparencyLevel()</a><br>
2455          *
2456          * @example
2457          * hcap.video.setOsdTransparencyLevel({
2458          *      "level" : 30, 
2459          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2460          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2461          *      }, 
2462          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2463          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2464          *      }
2465          * });
2466          */
2467         hcap.video.setOsdTransparencyLevel = function (param) {
2468             hcap_command("set_osd_transparency_level", param);
2469         };
2470         /**
2471          * Gets whether video mute is on or off.<br>
2472          * 
2473          * @param {Object} param
2474          * <ul>
2475          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2476          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2477          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2478          *       // {Boolean} param.videoMute - true if the video mute is on. false if the video mute is off.
2479          *   }</pre>
2480          *   </li>
2481          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2482          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2483          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2484          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2485          *   }</pre>
2486          *   </li>
2487          * </ul>
2488          * 
2489          * @since 1.3.1
2490          * 
2491          * @see
2492          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.setVideoMute">hcap.video.setVideoMute()</a><br>
2493          *
2494          * @example
2495          * hcap.video.isVideoMute({
2496          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
2497          *          console.log("onSuccess : videoMute = " + s.videoMute);
2498          *      }, 
2499          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2500          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2501          *      }
2502          * });
2503          */
2504         hcap.video.isVideoMute = function (param) {
2505             hcap_command("get_video_mute", param);
2506         };
2507         /**
2508          * Turns on or off the video mute. When the channel is changed, the video mute setting is reset to off.<br>
2509          *
2510          * @param {Object} param
2511          * <ul>
2512          *   <li>{Boolean} param.videoMute [Required] - true to turn on video mute, else false.</li>
2513          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
2514          *            Setting to the same setting as before will invoke this callback function.
2515          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2516          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2517          *       // No Parameter.
2518          *   }</pre>
2519          *   </li>
2520          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2521          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2522          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2523          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2524          *   }</pre>
2525          *   </li>
2526          * </ul>
2527          * 
2528          * @since 1.3.1
2529          * 
2530          * @see
2531          * <a href="hcap.video.html#.isVideoMute">hcap.video.isVideoMute()</a><br>
2532          *
2533          * @example
2534          * hcap.video.setVideoMute({
2535          *      "videoMute" : true, 
2536          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2537          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2538          *      }, 
2539          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2540          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2541          *      }
2542          * });
2543          */
2544         hcap.video.setVideoMute = function (param) {
2545             hcap_command("set_video_mute", param);
2546         };
2547         /** 
2548          * @namespace hcap.volume
2549          */
2550         hcap.volume = { };
2551         /**
2552          * Gets the current volume level of the TV.<br>
2553          * 
2554          * @param {Object} param
2555          * <ul>
2556          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2557          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2558          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2559          *       // {Number} param.level - volume level of TV (0~100). -1 if mute
2560          *   }</pre>
2561          *   </li>
2562          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2563          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2564          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2565          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2566          *   }</pre>
2567          *   </li>
2568          * </ul>
2569          * 
2570          * @since 1.3.1
2571          * 
2572          * @see
2573          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.setVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2574          *
2575          * @example
2576          * hcap.volume.getVolumeLevel({
2577          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
2578          *          console.log("onSuccess : level = " + s.level);
2579          *      }, 
2580          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2581          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2582          *      }
2583          * });
2584          */
2585         hcap.volume.getVolumeLevel = function (param) {
2586             hcap_command("get_volume_level", param);
2587         };
2588         /**
2589          * Sets the TV volume level.<br>
2590          *
2591          * @param {Object} param
2592          * <ul>
2593          *   <li>{Number} param.level [Required] - range is 0~100 or -1 if mute.</li>
2594          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2595          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2596          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2597          *       // No Parameter.
2598          *   }</pre>
2599          *   </li>
2600          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
2601          *            Setting to the same volume level as before will invoke this callback function.<br>
2602          *            Setting to a value larger than the property "maximum_volume_level" will also invoke this callback function.
2603          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2604          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2605          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2606          *   }</pre>
2607          *   </li>
2608          * </ul>
2609          * 
2610          * @since 1.3.1
2611          * 
2612          * @see
2613          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.getVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2614          *
2615          * @example
2616          * hcap.volume.setVolumeLevel({
2617          *      "level" : 50, 
2618          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2619          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2620          *      }, 
2621          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2622          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2623          *      }
2624          * });
2625          */
2626         hcap.volume.setVolumeLevel = function (param) {
2627             hcap_command("set_volume_level", param);
2628         };
2629         /**
2630          * Gets the current volume level of the external speaker.<br>
2631          * 
2632          * @param {Object} param
2633          * <ul>
2634          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2635          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2636          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2637          *       // {Number} param.level - volume level of external speaker (0~100).
2638          *   }</pre>
2639          *   </li>
2640          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2641          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2642          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2643          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2644          *   }</pre>
2645          *   </li>
2646          * </ul>
2647          * 
2648          * @since 1.23.0
2649          * 
2650          * @see
2651          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.setExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2652          *
2653          * @example
2654          * hcap.volume.getExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel({
2655          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
2656          *          console.log("onSuccess : level = " + s.level);
2657          *      }, 
2658          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2659          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2660          *      }
2661          * });
2662          */
2663         hcap.volume.getExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel = function (param) {
2664             hcap_command("get_external_speaker_volume_level", param);
2665         };
2666         /**
2667          * Sets the external speaker volume level.<br>
2668          *
2669          * @param {Object} param
2670          * <ul>
2671          *   <li>{Number} param.level [Required] - range is 0~100.</li>
2672          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2673          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2674          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2675          *       // No Parameter.
2676          *   }</pre>
2677          *   </li>
2678          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
2679          *            Setting to the same volume level as before will invoke this callback function.<br>
2680          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2681          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2682          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2683          *   }</pre>
2684          *   </li>
2685          * </ul>
2686          * 
2687          * @since 1.23.0
2688          * 
2689          * @see
2690          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.getExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2691          *
2692          * @example
2693          * hcap.volume.setExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel({
2694          *      "level" : 50, 
2695          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2696          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2697          *      }, 
2698          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2699          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2700          *      }
2701          * });
2702          */
2703         
2704         hcap.volume.setExternalSpeakerVolumeLevel = function (param) {
2705             hcap_command("set_external_speaker_volume_level", param);
2706         };
2707         /**
2708          * Gets the current volume level of the Headphone.<br>
2709          * 
2710          * @param {Object} param
2711          * <ul>
2712          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2713          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2714          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2715          *       // {Number} param.level - volume level of Headphone (0~100).
2716          *   }</pre>
2717          *   </li>
2718          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2719          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2720          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2721          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2722          *   }</pre>
2723          *   </li>
2724          * </ul>
2725          * 
2726          * @since 1.22.0
2727          * 
2728          * @see
2729          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
2730          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
2731          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2732          *
2733          * @example
2734          * hcap.volume.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel({
2735          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
2736          *          console.log("onSuccess : level = " + s.level);
2737          *      }, 
2738          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2739          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2740          *      }
2741          * });
2742          */
2743         hcap.volume.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel = function (param) {
2744             hcap_command("get_headphone_volume_level", param);
2745         };
2746         /**
2747          * Sets the Headphone volume level.<br>
2748          * This is worked only when the healthcare headphone mode is enabled.<br>
2749          *
2750          * @param {Object} param
2751          * <ul>
2752          *   <li>{Number} param.level [Required] - range is 0~100.</li>
2753          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2754          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2755          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2756          *       // No Parameter.
2757          *   }</pre>
2758          *   </li>
2759          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
2760          *            Setting to the same volume level as before will invoke this callback function.<br>
2761          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2762          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2763          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2764          *   }</pre>
2765          *   </li>
2766          * </ul>
2767          * 
2768          * @since 1.22.0
2769          * 
2770          * @see
2771          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
2772          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
2773          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2774          *
2775          * @example
2776          * hcap.volume.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel({
2777          *      "level" : 50, 
2778          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2779          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2780          *      }, 
2781          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2782          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2783          *      }
2784          * });
2785          */
2786         
2787         hcap.volume.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel = function (param) {
2788             hcap_command("set_headphone_volume_level", param);
2789         };
2790         /**
2791          * Sets the healthcare headphone mode is enabled or disabled.<br>
2792          * 
2793          * @param {Object} param
2794          * <ul>
2795          *   <li>{Boolean} param.enable [Required] - true : enable to healthcare headphone mode, false : disable.</li>
2796          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2797          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2798          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
2799          *       // No Parameter. 
2800          *   }</pre>
2801          *   </li>
2802          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2803          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2804          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2805          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2806          *   }</pre>
2807          *   </li>
2808          * </ul>
2809          *  
2810          * @since 1.22.0
2811          * 
2812          * @see
2813          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
2814          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2815          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2816          * <a href="_global_.html#event:ui_value_changed">{Event} ui_value_changed</a><br>
2817          *
2818          * @example
2819          * hcap.volume.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode({
2820          *      "enable" : true,
2821          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
2822          *          console.log("onSuccess");
2823          *      }, 
2824          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2825          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2826          *      }
2827          * });
2828          */
2829         hcap.volume.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode = function (param) {
2830             hcap_command("set_healthcare_headphone_mode", param);
2831         };
2832         /**
2833          * Gets whether healthcare headphone mode is enabled or disabled.<br>
2834          * 
2835          * @param {Object} param
2836          * <ul>
2837          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
2838          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2839          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
2840          *       // {Boolean} param.enable - true if the healthcare headphone mode is enabled. false if the healthcare headphone mode is disabled.
2841          *   }</pre>
2842          *   </li>
2843          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
2844          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
2845          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
2846          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
2847          *   }</pre>
2848          *   </li>
2849          * </ul>
2850          *  
2851          * @since 1.22.0
2852          * 
2853          * @see
2854          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode">hcap.volume.setHealthcareHeadphoneMode()</a><br>
2855          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.getHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2856          * <a href="hcap.volume.html#.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel">hcap.volume.setHeadphoneVolumeLevel()</a><br>
2857          *
2858          * @example
2859          * hcap.volume.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode({
2860          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
2861          *          console.log("onSuccess : healthcare headphone mode = " + param.enable);
2862          *      }, 
2863          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
2864          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
2865          *      }
2866          * });
2867          */
2868         hcap.volume.getHealthcareHeadphoneMode = function (param) {
2869             hcap_command("get_healthcare_headphone_mode", param);
2870         };
2871         /**
2872          * @namespace hcap.channel
2873          */
2874         hcap.channel = {};
2875         /**
2876          * No stream PID.
2877          * @since 1.3.1
2878          * @constant
2879          */
2880         hcap.channel.NO_STREAM_PID = 0x1fff;
2881         /**
2882          * @namespace ChannelType
2883          */
2884         hcap.channel.ChannelType = {
2885             /**
2886              * Unknown channel type.
2887              * @since 1.3.1
2888              * @constant
2889              */
2890             UNKNOWN             : 0,
2891             /**
2892              * RF A/V channel type.
2893              * @since 1.3.1
2894              * @constant
2895              */
2896             RF                  : 1,
2897             /**
2898              * IP A/V channel type.
2899              * @since 1.3.1
2900              * @constant
2901              */
2902             IP                  : 2,
2903             /**
2904              * RF Data channel type.
2905              * @since 1.3.1
2906              * @constant
2907              */
2908             RF_DATA             : 3,
2909             /**
2910              * IP Data channel type.
2911              * @since 1.3.1
2912              * @constant
2913              */
2914             IP_DATA             : 4
2915         };
2916         /**

2918          */

2923              * @constant
2924              */
2925             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
2926             /**
2927              * Vertical mode.
2928              * @since 1.12.0
2929              * @constant
2930              */
2931             VERTICAL : 0x01,
2932             /**
2933              * Horizontal mode.
2934              * @since 1.12.0
2935              * @constant
2936              */
2937             HORIZONTAL : 0x02,
2938             /**
2939              * Left hand circular mode.
2940              * @since 1.12.0
2941              * @constant
2942              */

2945              * Right hand circular mode.
2946              * @since 1.12.0
2947              * @constant
2948              */
2949             RIGHT_HAND_CIRCULAR : 0x04
2950         };

2999              * @since 1.3.1
3000              * @constant
3001              */
3002             CABLE_HRC      : 0x32,
3003             /**

3005              * @since 1.3.1
3006              * @constant
3007              */
3008             CABLE_IRC      : 0x33,
3009             /**

3011              * @since 1.6.0

3013              */
3014             ANALOG_PAL_BG  : 0x40,
3015             /**

3020             ANALOG_PAL_DK  : 0x41,

3023              * @since 1.6.0
3024              * @constant
3025              */
3026             ANALOG_PAL_I   : 0x42,
3027             /**

3029              * @since 1.6.0
3030              * @constant
3031              */
3032             ANALOG_PAL_M   : 0x43,

3035              * @since 1.6.0

3037              */

3039             /**
3040              * Analog - SECAM BG.
3041              * @since 1.6.0
3042              * @constant
3043              */
3044             ANALOG_SECAM_BG : 0x45,
3045             /**
3046              * Analog - SECAM DK.
3047              * @since 1.6.0
3048              * @constant
3049              */
3050             ANALOG_SECAM_DK : 0x46,
3051             /**
3052              * Analog - SECAM L.
3053              * @since 1.6.0
3054              * @constant
3055              */
3056             ANALOG_SECAM_L : 0x47,
3057             /**
3058              * (North America) Analog television system that is used in most of North America.
3059              * @since 1.6.0
3060              * @constant
3061              */
3062             ANALOG_NTSC    : 0x48,
3063             /**
3064              * AIR ATSC 3.0 channel
3065              * @since 1.21.0
3066              * @constant
3067              */
3068             TERRESTRIAL_ATSC3	: 0x50,
3069             /**
3070              * CABLE ATSC 3.0 channel
3071              * @since 1.21.0
3072              * @constant
3073              */
3074             CABLE_ATSC3    : 0x51
3075            
3076         };

3200             ANALOG_L       : 0x103,

3217         /**
3218          * @namespace hcap.channel.InbandDataServiceType
3219          */
3220         hcap.channel.InbandDataServiceType = {
3221             /**
3222              * Unknown inband data service type.

3224              * @constant

3226             UNKNOWN : 0x00,

3228              * MHP.

3232             MHP : 0x01,

3237              */
3238             MHEG : 0x02,

3244             HBBTV : 0x03,

3250             NONE : 0x04

3252         /**
3253          * @namespace hcap.channel.ChannelStatus
3254          */
3255         hcap.channel.ChannelStatus = {
3256             /**
3257              * Unknown channel status.
3258              * @since 1.12.0
3259              * @constant
3260              */
3261             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
3262             /**
3263              * Audio and video are not blocked.
3264              * @since 1.14.0
3265              * @constant
3266              */
3267             AUDIO_VIDEO_NOT_BLOCKED : 0x10,
3268             AV_DISPLAYED : 0x10,
3269             /**
3270              * Audio and video are blocked.
3271              * @since 1.14.0
3272              * @constant
3273              */
3274             AUDIO_VIDEO_BLOCKED : 0x21,
3275             NO_SIGNAL : 0x21,
3276             /**
3277              * Only audio is blocked.
3278              * @since 1.14.0
3279              * @constant
3280              */
3281             AUDIO_ONLY_BLOCKED : 0x22,
3282             /**
3283              * Only video is blocked.
3284              * @since 1.14.0
3285              * @constant
3286              */
3287             VIDEO_ONLY_BLOCKED : 0x23
3288         };
3289         /**
3290          * Requests to change the current channel.<br>
3291          * The result for the channel change operation can be obtained by registering the 
3292          * <a href="_global_.html#event:channel_changed">{Event} channel_changed</a><br><br>
3293          * 
3294          * For channel parameters, TV will support only one channel class.<br><br>
3295          *
3296          * <div align=center>
3297          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=850>
3298          *   <thead>
3299          *     <tr><th colspan="3">Channel Class & Parameters</th></tr>
3300          *   </thead>
3301          *   <tbody>
3302          *     <tr class="odd"><th rowspan="6">AV Channel</th>
3303          *                     <th class="left">RF channel class 1 (supported in both EU model and US model)</th><td class="left">logicalNumber</td></tr>
3304          *     <tr            ><th class="left">RF channel class 2 (supported in only EU model)</th><td class="left">frequency + programNumber. (for analog channel, programNumber = 0)</td></tr>
3305          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="left">RF channel class 3 (supported in only US model)</th><td class="left">majorNumber + minorNumber. (for analog channel, minorNumber = 0)</td></tr>
3306          *     <tr            ><th class="left">RF channel class 4 (supported in only EU model)</th><td class="left">frequency + programNumber + satelliteId + polarization</td></tr>
3307          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="left">RF channel class 5 (supported in only EU model)</th><td class="left">frequency + programNumber + plpId. (rfBroadcastType = hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_2)</td></tr>
3308          *     <tr            ><th class="left">RF channel class 6 (supported in only US model)</th><td class="left">majorNumber + minorNumber + plpId. (rfBroadcastType = hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_ATSC3, hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.CABLE_ATSC3)</td></tr>
3309          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="left">IP channel class 1 (supported in both EU model and US model)</th><td class="left">logicalNumber</td></tr>
3310          *     <tr            ><th class="left">IP channel class 2 (supported in both EU model and US model)</th><td class="left">ip + port</td></tr>
3311          *     
3312          *     <tr            ><th rowspan="4">Data Channel</th>
3313          *                     <th class="left">RF channel class 1 (supported in both EU model and US model)</th><td class="left">logicalNumber (reserved)</td></tr>
3314          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="left">RF channel class 2 (supported in both EU model and US model)</th><td class="left">ip + port(required)</td></tr>
3315          *     <tr            ><th class="left">IP channel class 1 (supported in both EU model and US model)</th><td class="left">logicalNumber (reserved)</td></tr>
3316          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="left">IP channel class 2 (supported in both EU model and US model)</th><td class="left">ip + port(required)</td></tr>
3317          *     
3318          *   </tbody>
3319          * </table>
3320          * </div>
3321          * <br>
3322          * 
3323          * If a channel with more than one Channel Class is requested to change, then next priority table will be applied.<br>
3324          * RF channel class 1 is 'X' when logicalNumber is 0.<br>
3325          * RF channel class 2 is 'X' when frequency is 0.<br>
3326          * RF channel class 3 is 'X' when majorNumber is 0.<br>
3327          * RF channel class 4 is 'X' when satelliteId is 0.<br>
3328          * IP channel class 1 is 'X' when logicalNumber is 0.<br>
3329          * IP channel class 2 is 'X' when ip is "0" and port is 0.<br>
3330          * RF channel class 5 is only when the channel type is hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_2 and only frequency + programNumber + plpId take affect.<br>
3331          * RF channel class 6 is only when the channel type is hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_ATSC3 or hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.CABLE_ATSC3 and only majorNumber + minorNumber + plpId take affect.<br>
3332          * Other cases than following table will be treated as invalid channel combinations.<br>
3333          *
3334          * <div align=center>
3335          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=850>
3336          *   <thead>
3337          *     <tr>
3338          *       <th>RF channel class 1<br> (logicalNumber)</th>
3339          *       <th>RF channel class 2<br> (frequency + programNumber)</th>
3340          *       <th>RF channel class 3<br> (majorNumber + minorNumber)</th>
3341          *       <th>RF channel class 4<br> (frequency + programNumber + satelliteId + polarization)</th>
3342          *       <th>Effective Channel Class</th>
3343          *     </tr>
3344          *   </thead>
3345          *   <tbody>
3346          *     <tr class="odd"><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 1</td></tr>
3347          *     <tr            ><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 1</td></tr>
3348          *     <tr class="odd"><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 2</td></tr>
3349          *     <tr            ><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 3</td></tr>
3350          *     <tr class="odd"><td>X</td><td>-</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>RF channel class 4</td></tr>
3351          *     <tr            ><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 2</td></tr>
3352          *     <tr class="odd"><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>RF channel class 3</td></tr>
3353          *     <tr            ><td>O</td><td>-</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>RF channel class 4</td></tr>
3354          *   </tbody>
3355          *   <tfoot>
3356          *     <tr><th colspan="5">RF Channel</th></tr>
3357          *   </tfoot>
3358          * </table>
3359          * </div>
3360          * <br>
3361          *    
3362          * <div align=center>
3363          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=850>
3364          *   <thead>
3365          *     <tr>
3366          *       <th>IP channel class 1<br> (logicalNumber)</th>
3367          *       <th>IP channel class 2<br> (ip + port)</th>
3368          *       <th>Effective Channel Class</th>
3369          *     </tr>
3370          *   </thead>
3371          *   <tbody>
3372          *     <tr class="odd"><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>IP channel class 1</td></tr>
3373          *     <tr            ><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>IP channel class 1</td></tr>
3374          *     <tr class="odd"><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>IP channel class 2</td></tr>
3375          *     <tr            ><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>IP channel class 2</td></tr>
3376          *   </tbody>
3377          *   <tfoot>
3378          *     <tr><th colspan="3">IP Channel</th></tr>
3379          *   </tfoot>
3380          * </table>
3381          * </div>
3382          * <br>
3383          * 
3384          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a> gets the AV (RF/IP) channel information which 
3385          * includes supported channel class information and optional parameters, 
3386          * but unsupported channel classes are filled with 0.<br>
3387          * <br>
3388          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a> gets the DATA (RF/IP) channel information which 
3389          * includes supported channel class information, but other channel classes 
3390          * and optional parameters are filled with 0.<br>
3391          * <br>
3392          * Result objects for <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a> and <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a> 
3393          * have following information.<br>
3394          * <br>
3395          * <div align=center id=".CHANNEL_TYPE">
3396          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=850>
3397          *   <thead>
3398          *     <tr><th>Channel Type</th><th>Description</th></tr>
3399          *   </thead>
3400          *   <tbody>
3401          *     <tr class="odd">
3402          *        <th class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#.RF">hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF</a></th>
3403          *        <td class="left">Defines AV channel via RF signal.</td>
3404          *     </tr>
3405          *     <tr>
3406          *        <th class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#.IP">hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP</a></th>
3407          *        <td class="left">Defines AV channel via IP network to support IPTV.</td>
3408          *     </tr>
3409          *     <tr class="odd">
3410          *        <th class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#.RF_DATA">hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF_DATA</a></th>
3411          *        <td class="left">Defines data channel via RF signal. Applications can download some carousel data.</td>
3412          *     </tr>
3413          *     <tr>
3414          *       <th class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#.IP_DATA">hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP_DATA</a></th>
3415          *       <td class="left">Defines data channel via IP network.
3416          *       <table class="hcap_spec">
3417          *         <thead>
3418          *           <tr><th colspan=2>Data channel operation in IP address range</th></tr>
3419          *         </thead>
3420          *         <tbody>
3421          *           <tr class="odd">
3422          *             <th class="left">Unicast IP Address</th>
3423          *             <td class="left">Applications can download some data from Pro:Centric server using HTTP protocol.</td>
3424          *           </tr>
3425          *           <tr>
3426          *             <th class="left">Multicast IP Address<br>(224.0.0.0 ~<br> 239.255.255.255)</th>
3427          *             <td class="left">RF broadcast data will be sent via IP multicast [TS(Transport Stream) over IP multicast].<br>
3428          *               In this mode, carousel download operation is same as <a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#.RF_DATA">hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF_DATA</a><br>
3429          *               In this case, HCAP URL can use the special frequency# '1' for this virtual RF channel.<br>
3430          *             </td>
3431          *           </tr>
3432          *         </tbody>
3433          *       </table>
3434          *       </td>
3435          *     </tr>
3436          *   </tbody>
3437          *   <tfoot>
3438          *     <tr><th colspan="2">Channel Type</td></tr>
3439          *   </tfoot>
3440          * </table>
3441          * </div>
3442          * 
3443          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel() for IP DATA channel returns false because it has no effect.<br>
3444          * <br>
3445          * If following option fields are filled correctly in the input object, 
3446          * AV channel change performance will be improved.
3447          * 
3448          * <ul>
3449          * <li>symbolRate</li>
3450          * <li>pcrPid, videoPid</li>
3451          * <li>videoStreamType</li>
3452          * <li>audioPid</li>
3453          * <li>audioStreamType</li>
3454          * <ul>
3455          * <br>
3456          * 
3457          * <div align=center id=".CHANNEL_PROPERTY">
3458          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=850>
3459          *   <thead>
3460          *     <tr>            <th>Property Name                </th><th>Type   </th><th>Req<br>uired</th><th>RF</th><th>IP</th><th>RF<br>DATA</th><th>IP<br>DATA</th><th>Value                                                                                    </th><th>Description</th></tr>
3461          *   </thead>
3462          *   <tbody>
3463          *     <tr class="odd"><td>channelType                  </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>O         </td><td>O         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.ChannelType.html">hcap.channel.ChannelType</a><br>    </td><td class="left">Channel type indicator</td></tr>
3464          *     <tr            ><td>logicalNumber                </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Logical channel number</td></tr>
3465          *     <tr class="odd"><td>frequency                    </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^32 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Frequency (Hz, and MHz for satellite)</td></tr>
3466          *     <tr            ><td>programNumber                </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Program number (0 for analog channel)</td></tr>
3467          *     <tr class="odd"><td>programNumber                </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>X </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Specific program number in IP Stream</td></tr>
3468          *     <tr            ><td>majorNumber                  </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Major channel number</td></tr>
3469          *     <tr class="odd"><td>minorNumber                  </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Minor channel number</td></tr>
3470          *     <tr            ><td>satelliteId                  </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Satellite setting ID</td></tr>
3471          *     <tr class="odd"><td>polarization                 </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.Polarization.html">hcap.channel.Polarization</a>      </td><td class="left">Polarization mode</td></tr>
3472          *     <tr            ><td>plpId                        </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 0xFF                                                                    </td><td class="left">PLP (Physical Layer Pipe) ID</td></tr>
3473          *     <tr class="odd"><td>rfBroadcastType              </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.html">hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType</a></td><td class="left">RF broadcast type</td></tr>
3474          *     <tr            ><td>ip                           </td><td>String </td><td>O           </td><td>X </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>O         </td><td class="left">[0~255].[0~255].[0~255].[0~255]                                             </td><td class="left">IP address value</td></tr>
3475          *     <tr class="odd"><td>port                         </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>X </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>O         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^16 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Port number</td></tr>
3476          *     <tr            ><td>ipBroadcastType              </td><td>Number </td><td>O           </td><td>X </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType.html">hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType</a></td><td class="left">IP broadcast type (default is UDP)</td></tr>
3477          *     <tr class="odd"><td>symbolRate                   </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^32 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Symbol rate (Bd)</td></tr>
3478          *     <tr            ><td>pcrPid                       </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^13 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">PCR(Program Clock Reference)Packet ID</td></tr>
3479          *     <tr class="odd"><td>videoPid                     </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^13 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Video packet ID (<a href="hcap.channel.html">hcap.channel.NO_STREAM_PID</a> for audio only channel)</td></tr>
3480          *     <tr            ><td>videoStreamType              </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.VideoStreamType.html">hcap.channel.VideoStreamType</a></td><td class="left">Video stream type</td></tr>
3481          *     <tr class="odd"><td>audioPid                     </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 2^13 - 1                                                                </td><td class="left">Audio packet ID</td></tr>
3482          *     <tr            ><td>audioStreamType              </td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left"><a href="hcap.channel.AudioStreamType.html">hcap.channel.AudioStreamType</a></td><td class="left">Audio stream type</td></tr>
3483          *     <tr class="odd"><td>signalStrength<br>(read only)</td><td>Number </td><td>X           </td><td>O </td><td>X </td><td>O         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">0 ~ 255                                                                     </td><td class="left">Channel signal strength</td></tr>
3484          *     <tr            ><td>sourceAddress                </td><td>String </td><td>X           </td><td>X </td><td>O </td><td>X         </td><td>X         </td><td class="left">[0~255].[0~255].[0~255].[0~255]                                             </td><td class="left">Source IP address for IGMPv3</td></tr>
3485          *   </tbody>
3486          *   <tfoot>
3487          *     <tr><th colspan="9">Channel Property</td></tr>
3488          *   </tfoot>
3489          * </table>
3490          * </div>
3491          * 
3492          * Below are a few examples for channel change request for different channel classes
3493          * @example
3494          * // RF channel class 1 change request
3495          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3496          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF, 
3497          *      "logicalNumber" : 7, 
3498          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL, 
3499          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3500          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3501          *      }, 
3502          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3503          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3504          *      }
3505          * });
3506          *
3507          * @example
3508          * // RF channel class 2 change request
3509          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3510          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF, 
3511          *      "frequency" : 63000000, 
3512          *      "programNumber" : 1, 
3513          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL, 
3514          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3515          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3516          *      }, 
3517          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3518          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3519          *      }
3520          * });
3521          *
3522          * @example
3523          * // RF channel class 3 change request
3524          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3525          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF, 
3526          *      "majorNumber" : 9, 
3527          *      "minorNumber" : 1, 
3528          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL, 
3529          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3530          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3531          *      }, 
3532          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3533          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3534          *      }
3535          * });
3536          * 
3537          * @example
3538          * // RF channel class 4 change request
3539          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3540          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF,
3541          *      "frequency" : 63000000, 
3542          *      "programNumber" : 1, 
3543          *      "satelliteId" : 1,
3544          *      "polarization" : hcap.channel.Polarization.VERTICAL,
3545          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.SATELLITE_2, 
3546          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3547          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3548          *      }, 
3549          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3550          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3551          *      }
3552          * });
3553          *
3554          * @example
3555          * // RF channel class 5 change request
3556          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3557          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF,
3558          *      "frequency" : 63000000, 
3559          *      "programNumber" : 1, 
3560          *      "plpId" : 3,
3561          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_2, 
3562          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3563          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3564          *      }, 
3565          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3566          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3567          *      }
3568          * });
3569          *
3570          * @example
3571          * // RF channel class 6 change request
3572          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3573          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF,
3574          *      "majorNumber" : 9, 
3575          *      "minorNumber" : 1, 
3576          *      "plpId" : 3,
3577          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL_ATSC3, 
3578          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3579          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3580          *      }, 
3581          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3582          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3583          *      }
3584          * });
3585          *
3586          * @example
3587          * // IP channel class 1 change request
3588          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3589          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP, 
3590          *      "logicalNumber" : 9,
3591          *      "ipBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType.UDP, 
3592          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3593          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3594          *      }, 
3595          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3596          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3597          *      }
3598          * });
3599          * 
3600          * @example
3601          * // IP channel class 2 change request
3602          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3603          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP, 
3604          *      "ip" : "1.2.3.4",
3605          *      "port" : 3333,
3606          *      "ipBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType.UDP, 
3607          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3608          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3609          *      }, 
3610          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3611          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3612          *      }
3613          * });
3614          * 
3615          * @example
3616          * // IP channel class 2 change request with optional property
3617          * hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel({
3618          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP, 
3619          *      "ip" : "1.2.3.4",
3620          *      "port" : 3333,
3621          *      "symbolRate" : 6758,
3622          *      "prcPid" : 100,
3623          *      "videoPid" : 200,
3624          *      "videoStreamType" : hcap.channel.VideoStreamType.MPEG2,
3625          *      "audioPid" : 400,
3626          *      "audioStreamType" : hcap.channel.AudioStreamType.MPEG2,
3627          *      "ipBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.IpBroadcastType.UDP, 
3628          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3629          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3630          *      }, 
3631          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3632          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3633          *      }
3634          * });
3635          * 
3636          * @param {Object} param
3637          * <ul>
3638          *   <li><a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.html#.CHANNEL_PROPERTY">{ Channel Properties } [Required] - Channel Information</a></li>
3639          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
3640          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3641          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
3642          *       // No Parameter.
3643          *   }</pre>
3644          *   </li>
3645          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
3646          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3647          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
3648          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
3649          *   }</pre>
3650          *   </li>
3651          * </ul>
3652          * 
3653          * @since 1.3.1
3654          * 
3655          * @see
3656          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3657          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3658          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.replayCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3659          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.stopCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3660          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a><br>
3661          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getStartChannel">hcap.channel.getStartChannel()</a><br>
3662          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.setStartChannel">hcap.channel.setStartChannel()</a><br>
3663          * <a href="_global_.html#event:channel_changed">{Event} channel_changed</a><br>
3664          */
3665         hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel = function (param) {
3666             hcap_command("request_channel_change", param);
3667         };
3668         /**
3669          * Gets the current channel information.<br>
3670          * For detailed information, such as, example and related information, 
3671          * please refer to <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3672          * 
3673          * @example
3674          * hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel({
3675          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
3676          *          console.log("onSuccess :" + 
3677          *              "\n channel status    : " + s.channelStatus   +
3678          *              "\n channel type      : " + s.channelType     +
3679          *              "\n logical number    : " + s.logicalNumber   +
3680          *              "\n frequency         : " + s.frequency       +
3681          *              "\n program number    : " + s.programNumber   +
3682          *              "\n major number      : " + s.majorNumber     +
3683          *              "\n minor number      : " + s.minorNumber     +
3684          *              "\n satellite ID      : " + s.satelliteId     +
3685          *              "\n polarization      : " + s.polarization    +
3686          *              "\n rf broadcast type : " + s.rfBroadcastType +
3687          *              "\n ip                : " + s.ip              +
3688          *              "\n port              : " + s.port            +
3689          *              "\n ip broadcast type : " + s.ipBroadcastType +
3690          *              "\n symbol rate       : " + s.symbolRate      +
3691          *              "\n pcr pid           : " + s.pcrPid          +
3692          *              "\n video pid         : " + s.videoPid        +
3693          *              "\n video stream type : " + s.videoStreamType +
3694          *              "\n audio pid         : " + s.audioPid        +
3695          *              "\n audio stream type : " + s.audioStreamType +
3696          *              "\n signal strength   : " + s.signalStrength  +
3697          *              "\n source address    : " + s.sourceAddress);
3698          *      }, 
3699          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3700          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3701          *      }
3702          * });
3703          * 
3704          * @param {Object} param
3705          * <ul>
3706          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
3707          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3708          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
3709          *       // {Number} [since 1.12.0] param.channelStatus - current channel status in <a href="hcap.channel.ChannelStatus.html">hcap.channel.ChannelStatus</a>.
3710          *       // see the <a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.html#.CHANNEL_PROPERTY">{ Channel Properties }</a> in <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a>.
3711          *   }</pre>
3712          *   </li>
3713          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
3714          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3715          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
3716          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
3717          *   }</pre>
3718          *   </li>
3719          * </ul>
3720          * 
3721          * @since 1.3.1
3722          * 
3723          * @see
3724          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3725          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3726          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.replayCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3727          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.stopCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3728          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a><br>
3729          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getStartChannel">hcap.channel.getStartChannel()</a><br>
3730          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.setStartChannel">hcap.channel.setStartChannel()</a><br>
3731          * <a href="_global_.html#event:channel_changed">{Event} channel_changed</a><br>
3732          */
3733         hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel = function (param) {
3734             hcap_command("get_current_channel", param);
3735         };
3736         /**
3737          * Replays the current stopped channel.
3738          * <ul>
3739          * <li>RF channel : restart channel tuning and replays AV.</li>
3740          * <li>IP channel : join IP multicast group and replays AV.</li>
3741          * </ul>
3742          * 
3743          * @param {Object} param
3744          * <ul>
3745          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
3746          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3747          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
3748          *       // no parameter.
3749          *   }</pre>
3750          *   </li>
3751          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
3752          *            Replaying already playing channel, or for operation failure
3753          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3754          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
3755          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
3756          *   }</pre>
3757          *   </li>
3758          * </ul>
3759          * 
3760          * @since 1.3.1
3761          * 
3762          * @see
3763          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3764          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3765          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.replayCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3766          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.stopCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3767          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a><br>
3768          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getStartChannel">hcap.channel.getStartChannel()</a><br>
3769          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.setStartChannel">hcap.channel.setStartChannel()</a><br>
3770          * <a href="_global_.html#event:channel_changed">{Event} channel_changed</a><br>
3771          * 
3772          * @example
3773          * hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel({
3774          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3775          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3776          *      }, 
3777          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3778          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3779          *      }
3780          * });
3781          */
3782         hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel = function (param) {
3783             hcap_command("replay_current_channel", param);
3784         };
3785         /**
3786          * Stops AV play of the current channel.
3787          * <ul>
3788          * <li>RF channel : Stops RF tuning and stops playing AV.</li>
3789          * <li>IP channel : Leaves IP multicast group and stops playing AV.</li>
3790          * </ul>
3791          * <br>
3792          * This API has only an effect on the current channel.<br>
3793          * When the channel is changed, new channel will be played.<br>
3794          * 
3795          * To replay the current channel, use <a href="hcap.channel.html#.replayCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel()</a>.
3796          * 
3797          * @param {Object} param
3798          * <ul>
3799          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
3800          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3801          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
3802          *       // no parameter.
3803          *   }</pre>
3804          *   </li>
3805          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
3806          *            Stopping already stopped channel will invoke this callback function.
3807          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3808          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
3809          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
3810          *   }</pre>
3811          *   </li>
3812          * </ul>
3813          * 
3814          * @since 1.3.1
3815          * 
3816          * @see
3817          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3818          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3819          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.replayCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3820          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.stopCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3821          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a><br>
3822          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getStartChannel">hcap.channel.getStartChannel()</a><br>
3823          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.setStartChannel">hcap.channel.setStartChannel()</a><br>
3824          * <a href="_global_.html#event:channel_changed">{Event} channel_changed</a><br>
3825          * 
3826          * @example
3827          * hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel({
3828          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
3829          *          console.log("onSuccess");
3830          *      }, 
3831          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3832          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3833          *      }
3834          * });
3835          */
3836         hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel = function (param) {
3837             hcap_command("stop_current_channel", param);
3838         };
3839         /**
3840          * Gets information about the Pro:Centric data channel(RF Channel or IP Channel),
3841          * which is the channel used to download applications.
3842          * In case of RF Data Channel, only frequency and program number are valid in channel information.
3843          * 
3844          * @example
3845          * hcap.channel.getDataChannel({
3846          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
3847          *          if (s.channelType === hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF_DATA) {
3848          *              console.log("onSuccess :" + 
3849          *                  "\n frequency         " + s.frequency       +
3850          *                  "\n program number    " + s.programNumber);
3851          *          } else if (s.channelType === hcap.channel.ChannelType.IP_DATA) {
3852          *              console.log("onSuccess :" + 
3853          *                  "\n ip                " + s.ip              +
3854          *                  "\n port              " + s.port);
3855          *          } else {
3856          *              console.log("unknown channel type");
3857          *          }
3858          *      },
3859          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
3860          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
3861          *      }
3862          * });
3863          * 
3864          * @param {Object} param
3865          * <ul>
3866          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
3867          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3868          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
3869          *       // see the <a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.html#.CHANNEL_PROPERTY">{ Channel Properties }</a> in <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a>.
3870          *   }</pre>
3871          *   </li>
3872          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
3873          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
3874          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
3875          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
3876          *   }</pre>
3877          *   </li>
3878          * </ul>
3879          * 
3880          * @since 1.3.1
3881          * 
3882          * @see
3883          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3884          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3885          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.replayCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.replayCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3886          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.stopCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.stopCurrentChannel()</a><br>
3887          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getDataChannel">hcap.channel.getDataChannel()</a><br>
3888          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getStartChannel">hcap.channel.getStartChannel()</a><br>
3889          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.setStartChannel">hcap.channel.setStartChannel()</a><br>
3890          * <a href="_global_.html#event:channel_changed">{Event} channel_changed</a><br>
3891          */
3892         hcap.channel.getDataChannel = function (param) {
3893             hcap_command("get_data_channel", param);
3894         };
3895         /**
3896          * Gets the start channel information which is the channel displayed 
3897          * at first when TV is turned on.<br> 
3898          * This API is very similar to <a href="hcap.channel.html#.getCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.getCurrentChannel()</a>. 
3899          * For detailed information, such as example and related information, please refer to 
3900          * <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a>.
3901          * 
3902          * @example
3903          * hcap.channel.getStartChannel({
3904          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
3905          *          console.log("onSuccess :" + 
3906          *              "\n channel type      : " + s.channelType     +
3907          *              "\n logical number    : " + s.logicalNumber   +
3908          *              "\n frequency         : " + s.frequency       +
3909          *              "\n program number    : " + s.programNumber   +
3910          *              "\n major number      : " + s.majorNumber     +
3911          *              "\n minor number      : " + s.minorNumber     +
3912          *              "\n satellite ID      : " + s.satelliteId     +
3913          *              "\n polarization      : " + s.polarization    +
3914          *              "\n rf broadcast type : " + s.rfBroadcastType +
3915          *              "\n ip                : " + s.ip              +
3916          *              "\n port              : " + s.port            +
3917          *              "\n ip broadcast type : " + s.ipBroadcastType +
3918          *              "\n symbol rate       : " + s.symbolRate      +
3919          *              "\n pcr pid           : " + s.pcrPid          +
3920          *              "\n video pid         : " + s.videoPid        +
