5401          *      "day" : 31,
5402          *      "hour" : 1,
5403          *      "minute" : 0,
5404          *      "second" : 0,
5405          *      "gmtOffsetInMinute" : 180,
5406          *      "isDaylightSaving" : false, 
5407          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
5408          *          console.log("onSuccess");
5409          *      }, 
5410          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5411          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5412          *      }
5413          * });
5414          */
5415         hcap.time.setLocalTime = function (param) {
5416             hcap_command("set_tv_localtime", param);
5417         };
5418         /**
5419          * Gets the TV time.<br>
5420          * TV time is the local time which is the time after applying GMT offset for time zone and daylight saving time.<br>
5421          * In this error case, failure callback function will be invoked.
5422          *
5423          * @param {Object} param
5424          * <ul>
5425          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5426          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5427          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
5428          *       // {Number} param.year - year (2000 ~ 2029).
5429          *       // {Number} param.month - month (1 ~ 12).
5430          *       // {Number} param.day - day (1 ~ 31).
5431          *       // {Number} param.hour - hour (0 ~ 23).
5432          *       // {Number} param.minute - minute (0 ~ 59).
5433          *       // {Number} param.second - second (0 ~ 59).
5434          *       // {Number} param.gmtOffsetInMinute - GMT offset in minute for time zone (-660 ~ 720).
5435          *       // {Number} param.isDaylightSaving - false : not applying daylight saving time to local time, true : applying daylight saving time to local time.
5436          *   }</pre>
5437          *   </li>
5438          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5439          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5440          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5441          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5442          *   }</pre>
5443          *   </li>
5444          * </ul>
5445          * 
5446          * @since 1.6.0
5447          * 
5448          * @see
5449          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.setLocalTime">hcap.time.setLocalTime()</a><br>
5450          *
5451          * @example
5452          * hcap.time.getLocalTime({
5453          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
5454          *          console.log("onSuccess : \n" +
5455          *              "TV localtime = " + s.year + "-" + s.month + "-" + s.day + " " + s.hour + " : " + s.minute + " : " + s.second + "\n" +
5456          *              "GMT offset = " + s.gmtOffsetInMinute + "\n" +
5457          *              "daylight saving = " + s.isDaylightSaving);
5458          *      }, 
5459          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5460          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5461          *      }
5462          * });
5463          */
5464         hcap.time.getLocalTime = function (param) {
5465             hcap_command("get_tv_localtime", param);
5466         };
5467         /**
5468          * Gets the sleep time to power off.
5469          *
5470          * @param {Object} param
5471          * <ul>
5472          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5473          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5474          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
5475          *       // {Number} param.minute - remaining time(minutes: 0 ~ 240, -1:off) of the sleep timer.
5476          *   }</pre>
5477          *   </li>
5478          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5479          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5480          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5481          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5482          *   }</pre>
5483          *   </li>
5484          * </ul>
5485          *  
5486          * @since 1.3.1
5487          * 
5488          * @see
5489          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.setPowerOffTimer">hcap.time.setPowerOffTimer()</a>
5490          *
5491          * @example
5492          * hcap.time.getPowerOffTimer({
5493          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
5494          *          console.log("onSuccess : remaining time (min) = " + s.minute);
5495          *      }, 
5496          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5497          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5498          *      }
5499          * });
5500          */
5501         hcap.time.getPowerOffTimer = function (param) {
5502             hcap_command("get_power_off_timer_in_min", param);
5503         };
5504         /**
5505          * Sets the power-off timer of TV. 
5506          *
5507          * @param {Object} param
5508          * <ul>
5509          *   <li>{Number} param.minute [Required] - preset time(in minutes) of power-off timer. The range is 0~240 minutes(4 hours) or -1(off).</li>
5510          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
5511          *         Setting to the same minutes of sleep timer as before will invoke this callback function.
5512          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5513          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
5514          *       // No parameter.
5515          *   }</pre>
5516          *   </li>
5517          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5518          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5519          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5520          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5521          *   }</pre>
5522          *   </li>
5523          * </ul>
5524          *  
5525          * @since 1.3.1
5526          * 
5527          * @see
5528          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.getPowerOffTimer">hcap.time.getPowerOffTimer()</a>
5529          *
5530          * @example
5531          * hcap.time.setPowerOffTimer({
5532          *      "minute" : 60,
5533          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
5534          *          console.log("onSuccess");
5535          *      }, 
5536          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5537          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5538          *      }
5539          * });
5540          */
5541         hcap.time.setPowerOffTimer = function (param) {
5542             hcap_command("set_power_off_timer_in_min", param);
5543         };
5544         /**
5545          * Gets the wake-up time of TV.  This setting is applied only once at the wake-up time and will be disabled.<br>
5546          * If the setting is disabled, returns -1 for hour and -1 for minute.
5547          *
5548          * @param {Object} param
5549          * <ul>
5550          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5551          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5552          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
5553          *       // {Number} param.hour - hour of wake-up time (0~23), -1 if the setting is disabled.
5554          *       // {Number} param.minute - minute of wake-up time (0~59), -1 if the setting is disabled.
5555          *   }</pre>
5556          *   </li>
5557          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5558          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5559          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5560          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5561          *   }</pre>
5562          *   </li>
5563          * </ul>
5564          *  
5565          * @since 1.3.1
5566          * 
5567          * @see
5568          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.setPowerOnTime">hcap.time.setPowerOnTime()</a>
5569          *
5570          * @example
5571          * hcap.time.getPowerOnTime({
5572          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
5573          *          console.log("onSuccess : wake-up time = " + s.hour + " : " + s.minute);
5574          *      }, 
5575          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5576          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5577          *      }
5578          * });
5579          */
5580         hcap.time.getPowerOnTime = function (param) {
5581             hcap_command("get_power_on_time", param);
5582         };
5583         /**
5584          * Sets the wake-up time of TV. This setting is applied only once at the wake-up time and will be disabled.<br>
5585          * Set parm.hour -1 and param.minute -1 to disable the wake-up time.
5586          *
5587          * @param {Object} param
5588          * <ul>
5589          *   <li>{Number} param.hour [Required] - hour of wake-up time. The range is 0~23 or -1 if the setting is disabled.</li>
5590          *   <li>{Number} param.minute [Required] - minute of wake-up time. The range is 0~59 or -1 if the setting is disabled.</li>
5591          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
5592          *        Setting to the same hour/minute as before will invoke this callback function.
5593          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5594          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
5595          *       // No parameter.
5596          *   }</pre>
5597          *   </li>
5598          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5599          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5600          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5601          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5602          *   }</pre>
5603          *   </li>
5604          * </ul>
5605          *  
5606          * @since 1.3.1
5607          * 
5608          * @see
5609          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.getPowerOnTime">hcap.time.getPowerOnTime()</a>
5610          *
5611          * @example
5612          * hcap.time.setPowerOnTime({
5613          *      "hour" : 9,
5614          *      "minute" : 30,
5615          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
5616          *          console.log("onSuccess");
5617          *      }, 
5618          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5619          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5620          *      }
5621          * });
5622          */
5623         hcap.time.setPowerOnTime = function (param) {
5624             hcap_command("set_power_on_time", param);
5625         };
5626         /**
5627          * Gets the alarm time, alarm channel and alarm volume level of TV. These settings are applied only once at the alarm time and will be disabled.<br>
5628          * At the alarm time, if TV is off, TV will be turned on automatically with the alarm volume level and tune to the alarm channel.
5629          * And if TV is on at the alarm time, nothing will happen.
5630          * If the alarm time is disabled, param.hour = -1 and param.minute = -1 will be returned.
5631          * And if the alarm channel is disabled, param.channelType = <a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#constructor">hcap.channel.ChannelType.UNKNOWN</a> will be returned.
5632          * If the alarm volume is disabled, param.volumeLevel = -1 will be returned.
5633          *
5634          * @param {Object} param
5635          * <ul>
5636          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5637          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5638          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
5639          *       // {Number} param.hour - hour of alarm time (-1 ~ 23), -1 if the setting is disabled.
5640          *       // {Number} param.minute - minute of alarm time (-1 ~ 59), -1 if the setting is disabled.
5641          *       // {Number} param.volumeLevel - alarm volume level (-1 ~ 100) which is applied only once for the first alarm booting. -1 if setting is disabled.
5642          *       // For the alarm channel, see the <a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.html#.CHANNEL_PROPERTY">{ Channel Properties }</a> in <a href="hcap.channel.html#.requestChangeCurrentChannel">hcap.channel.requestChangeCurrentChannel()</a>. The alarm channel is applied only once for the first alarm booting.
5643          *   }</pre>
5644          *   </li>
5645          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5646          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5647          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5648          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5649          *   }</pre>
5650          *   </li>
5651          * </ul>
5652          *  
5653          * @since 1.5.0
5654          * 
5655          * @see
5656          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.setAlarmInformation">hcap.time.setAlarmInformation()</a>
5657          *
5658          * @example
5659          * hcap.time.getAlarmInformation({
5660          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
5661          *          console.log("onSuccess :" + 
5662          *              "\n alarm time = " + s.hour = " : " + s.minute +
5663          *              "\n alarm volume level = " + s.volumeLevel +
5664          *              "\n ========= alarm channel information =========" + 
5665          *              "\n channel type      : " + s.channelType     +
5666          *              "\n logical number    : " + s.logicalNumber   +
5667          *              "\n frequency         : " + s.frequency       +
5668          *              "\n program number    : " + s.programNumber   +
5669          *              "\n major number      : " + s.majorNumber     +
5670          *              "\n minor number      : " + s.minorNumber     +
5671          *              "\n satellite ID      : " + s.satelliteId     +
5672          *              "\n polarization      : " + s.polarization    +
5673          *              "\n rf broadcast type : " + s.rfBroadcastType +
5674          *              "\n ip                : " + s.ip              +
5675          *              "\n port              : " + s.port            +
5676          *              "\n ip broadcast type : " + s.ipBroadcastType +
5677          *              "\n symbol rate       : " + s.symbolRate      +
5678          *              "\n pcr pid           : " + s.pcrPid          +
5679          *              "\n video pid         : " + s.videoPid        +
5680          *              "\n video stream type : " + s.videoStreamType +
5681          *              "\n audio pid         : " + s.audioPid        +
5682          *              "\n audio stream type : " + s.audioStreamType +
5683          *              "\n signal strength   : " + s.signalStrength  +
5684          *              "\n source address    : " + s.sourceAddress);
5685          *      }, 
5686          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5687          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5688          *      }
5689          * });
5690          */
5691         hcap.time.getAlarmInformation = function (param) {
5692             hcap_command("get_alarm_information", param);
5693         };
5694         /**
5695          * Sets the alarm time, alarm channel and alarm volume level of TV. These settings are applied only once at the alarm time and will be disabled.<br>
5696          * At the alarm time, if TV is off, TV will be turned on automatically with the alarm volume level and tune to the alarm channel.
5697          * And if TV is on at the alarm time, nothing will happen.
5698          * To disable the alarm time, param.hour = -1 and param.minute = -1 should be set.
5699          * When the alarm time is disabled, the alarm channel and the alarm volume level will be disabled together.
5700          *
5701          * @param {Object} param
5702          * <ul>
5703          *   <li>{Number} param.hour [Required] - hour of alarm time. The range is -1 ~ 23.</li>
5704          *   <li>{Number} param.minute [Required] - minute of alarm time. The range is -1 ~ 59.</li>
5705          *   <li>{Number} param.volumeLevel [Required] - alarm volume level (-1 ~ 100). -1 to disable the alarm volume.</li>
5706          *   <li><a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.html#.CHANNEL_PROPERTY">{ Channel Properties } [Required] - Alarm Channel Information.</a></li>
5707          *   <br>The alarm channel is taken affect prior to the start channel. If you want to disable the alarm channel, set param.channelType to <a href="../symbols/hcap.channel.ChannelType.html#constructor">hcap.channel.ChannelType.UNKNOWN</a>.
5708          *   </li>
5709          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
5710          *        Setting to the same hour/minute/alarm channel/alarm volume level as before will invoke this callback function.
5711          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5712          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
5713          *       // No parameter.
5714          *   }</pre>
5715          *   </li>
5716          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5717          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5718          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5719          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5720          *   }</pre>
5721          *   </li>
5722          * </ul>
5723          *  
5724          * @since 1.5.0
5725          * 
5726          * @see
5727          * <a href="hcap.time.html#.getAlarmInformation">hcap.time.getAlarmInformation()</a>
5728          *
5729          * @example
5730          * hcap.time.setAlarmInformation({
5731          *      "hour" : 9,
5732          *      "minute" : 30,
5733          *      "volumeLevel" : 30,
5734          *      "channelType" : hcap.channel.ChannelType.RF, 
5735          *      "frequency" : 63000000, 
5736          *      "programNumber" : 1, 
5737          *      "rfBroadcastType" : hcap.channel.RfBroadcastType.TERRESTRIAL, 
5738          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
5739          *          console.log("onSuccess");
5740          *      }, 
5741          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5742          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5743          *      }
5744          * });
5745          */
5746         hcap.time.setAlarmInformation = function (param) {
5747             hcap_command("set_alarm_information", param);
5748         };
5749         /**
5750          * Gets the CPU time.
5751          * It means that the monotonic time after TV is turned on.<br>
5752          * 
5753          * @param {Object} param
5754          * <ul>
5755          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5756          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5757          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
5758          *       // {Number} param.cpuTime - cpu time(milliseconds) of the platform.
5759          *   }</pre>
5760          *   </li>
5761          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5762          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5763          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5764          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5765          *   }</pre>
5766          *   </li>
5767          * </ul>
5768          *  
5769          * @since 1.21.0
5770          * 
5771          * @example
5772          * hcap.time.getCpuTime({
5773          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
5774          *          console.log("onSuccess : cpu time(milliseconds) = " + param.cpuTime);
5775          *      }, 
5776          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5777          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5778          *      }
5779          * });
5780          */
5781         hcap.time.getCpuTime = function (param) {
5782             hcap_command("get_cpu_time", param);
5783         };
5784         /**
5785          * @namespace hcap.network
5786          */
5787         hcap.network = {};
5788         /**
5789          * Gets the number of network devices. 
5790          *
5791          * @param {Object} param
5792          * <ul>
5793          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5794          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5795          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
5796          *       // {Number} param.count - number of network devices connected to TV.
5797          *   }</pre>
5798          *   </li>
5799          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5800          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5801          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5802          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5803          *   }</pre>
5804          *   </li>
5805          * </ul>
5806          *  
5807          * @since 1.3.1
5808          * 
5809          * @see
5810          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getNetworkDevice">hcap.network.getNetworkDevice()</a><br>
5811          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setNetworkDevice">hcap.network.setNetworkDevice()</a><br>
5812          *
5813          * @example
5814          * hcap.network.getNumberOfNetworkDevices({
5815          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
5816          *          console.log("onSuccess : the number of network devices = " + s.count);
5817          *      }, 
5818          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5819          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5820          *      }
5821          * });
5822          */
5823         hcap.network.getNumberOfNetworkDevices = function (param) {
5824             hcap_command("get_number_of_network_devices", param);
5825         };
5826         /**
5827          * Gets the details of network device connected to TV.
5828          *
5829          * @param {Object} param
5830          * <ul>
5831          *   <li>{Number} param.index [Required] - index of device connected. Starts from 0.</li>
5832          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5833          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5834          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
5835          *       // {Number} param.networkMode - network mode (wire or wireless) of the network device. (<a href="hcap.network.NetworkMode.html">hcap.network.NetworkMode</a>)
5836          *       // {String} param.name - name of network device. ex) "eth0" 
5837          *       // {String} param.mac - MAC address of network device. ex) "ff:ee:dd:cc:bb:aa"
5838          *       // {Boolean} param.dhcp - DHCP (true : DHCP, false : not DHCP)
5839          *       // {String} param.ip - IP of network device. ex) "192.168.100.2"
5840          *       // {String} param.gateway - gateway of network device. ex) "192.168.100.1" 
5841          *       // {String} param.netmask - netmask address of network device. ex) "255.255.255.0"
5842          *       // {String} param.primaryDns - DNS (Domain Name Server) address. ex) "8.8.8.8"
5843          *       // {String} param.secondaryDns - secondary DNS address. ex) "8.8.8.8"
5844          *   }</pre>
5845          *   </li>
5846          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
5847          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5848          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5849          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5850          *   }</pre>
5851          *   </li>
5852          * </ul>
5853          *  
5854          * @since 1.3.1
5855          * 
5856          * @see
5857          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getNumberOfNetworkDevices">hcap.network.getNumberOfNetworkDevices()</a><br>
5858          * <a href="hcap.network.NetworkMode.html#.WIRE">hcap.network.NetworkMode.WIRE</a><br>
5859          * <a href="hcap.network.NetworkMode.html#.WIRELESS">hcap.network.NetworkMode.WIRELESS</a><br>
5860          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setNetworkDevice">hcap.network.setNetworkDevice()</a><br>
5861          *
5862          * @example
5863          * function print_current_mac(ip) {
5864          *     hcap.network.getNumberOfNetworkDevices({
5865          *          "onSuccess" : function(s) {
5866          *              console.log("onSuccess : the number of network devices = " + s.count);
5867          *              for (var i = 0; i < s.count; i++) {
5868          *                  (function(k) {
5869          *                      hcap.network.getNetworkDevice({
5870          *                          "index" : k,
5871          *                          "onSuccess" : function(r) {
5872          *                              console.log("onSuccess : networkMode = " + r.networkMode + 
5873          *                                  "\n name = " + r.name +
5874          *                                  "\n mac = " + r.mac +
5875          *                                  "\n dhcp = " + r.dhcp +
5876          *                                  "\n ip = " + r.ip +
5877          *                                  "\n gateway = " + r.gateway +
5878          *                                  "\n netmask = " + r.netmask +
5879          *                                  "\n primary dns = " + r.primaryDns +
5880          *                                  "\n secondary dns = " + r.secondaryDns);
5881          *                              if (ip === r.ip) {
5882          *                                  console.log("CURRENT MAC : " + r.mac);
5883          *                              }
5884          *                          }, 
5885          *                          "onFailure" : function(r) {
5886          *                              console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + r.errorMessage);
5887          *                          }
5888          *                      });
5889          *                  })(i);
5890          *              }
5891          *          }, 
5892          *          "onFailure" : function(f) {
5893          *              console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5894          *          }
5895          *     });
5896          * }
5897          * 
5898          * hcap.network.getNetworkInformation({
5899          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
5900          *          console.log("onSuccess : network_mode = " + s.network_mode + 
5901          *              "\n ssid = " + s.ssid +
5902          *              "\n eth_speed = " + s.eth_speed +
5903          *              "\n eth_duplex = " + s.eth_duplex +
5904          *              "\n local_network_available = " + s.local_network_available +
5905          *              "\n internet_available = " + s.internet_available +
5906          *              "\n wifi_mode = " + s.wifi_mode +
5907          *              "\n wireless_security_type = " + s.wireless_security_type +
5908          *              "\n wifi_pass_key = " + s.wifi_pass_key +
5909          *              "\n using_dhcp = " + s.using_dhcp +
5910          *              "\n ip_address = " + s.ip_address +
5911          *              "\n subnet_mask = " + s.subnet_mask +
5912          *              "\n gateway = " + s.gateway +
5913          *              "\n dns1_address = " + s.dns1_address +
5914          *              "\n dns2_address = " + s.dns2_address +
5915          *              "\n dns_dhcp = " + s.dns_dhcp +
5916          *              "\n ethernet_plugged = " + s.ethernet_plugged +
5917          *              "\n wifi_plugged = " + s.wifi_plugged +
5918          *              "\n dhcp_state = " + s.dhcp_state);
5919          *          print_current_mac(s.ip_address);
5920          *      }, 
5921          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5922          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5923          *      }
5924          * });
5925          */
5926         hcap.network.getNetworkDevice = function (param) {
5927             hcap_command("get_network_device", param);
5928         };
5929         /**
5930          * Sets the network configuration of the index-th (starting with 0) network device<br>
5931          *
5932          * @param {Object} param
5933          * <ul>
5934          *   <li>{Number} param.index [Required] - the index of the network device (starting with 0)</li>
5935          *   <li>{Boolean} param.dhcp [Required] - DHCP (true : DHCP, false : not DHCP)</li>
5936          *   <li>{String} param.ip [Optional] - IP of network device. When param.dhcp is false, it is required. ex) "192.168.100.2"</li>
5937          *   <li>{String} param.gateway [Optional] - gateway of network device. When param.dhcp is false, it is required. ex) "192.168.100.1"</li> 
5938          *   <li>{String} param.netmask [Optional] - netmask address of network device. When param.dhcp is false, it is required. ex) "255.255.255.0"</li>
5939          *   <li>{String} param.primaryDns [Optional] - primary DNS (Domain Name Server) address. When param.dhcp is false, it is required. ex) "8.8.8.8"</li>
5940          *   <li>{String} param.secondaryDns [Optional] - secondary DNS (Domain Name Server) address. When param.dhcp is false, it is required. ex) "8.8.8.8"</li>
5941          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5942          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5943          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
5944          *       // No parameter.
5945          *   }</pre>
5946          *   </li>
5947          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
5948          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5949          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
5950          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
5951          *   }</pre>
5952          *   </li>
5953          * </ul>
5954          *  
5955          * @since 1.19.0
5956          * 
5957          * @see
5958          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getNumberOfNetworkDevices">hcap.network.getNumberOfNetworkDevices()</a><br>
5959          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getNetworkDevice">hcap.network.getNetworkDevice()</a><br>
5960          *
5961          * @example
5962          * hcap.network.setNetworkDevice({
5963          *      "index" : 0,
5964          *      "dhcp" : true,
5965          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
5966          *          console.log("onSuccess");
5967          *      }, 
5968          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5969          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5970          *      }
5971          * });
5972          * hcap.network.setNetworkDevice({
5973          *      "index" : 0,
5974          *      "dhcp" : false,
5975          *      "ip" : "192.168.100.2",
5976          *      "gateway" : "192.168.100.1",
5977          *      "netmask" : "255.255.255.0",
5978          *      "primaryDns" : "192.168.100.1",
5979          *      "secondaryDns" : "8.8.8.8",
5980          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
5981          *          console.log("onSuccess");
5982          *      }, 
5983          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
5984          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
5985          *      }
5986          * });
5987          */
5988         hcap.network.setNetworkDevice = function (param) {
5989             hcap_command("set_network_device", param);
5990         };
5991         /**
5992          * Sends a ping command to the specified IP.
5993          *
5994          * @param {Object} param
5995          * <ul>
5996          *   <li>{String} param.ip [Required] - IP address of the ping target.</li>
5997          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
5998          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
5999          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6000          *       // {Number} param.roundTripTimeInMs - round trip time to the target in milliseconds.
6001          *   }</pre>
6002          *   </li>
6003          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
6004          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6005          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6006          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6007          *   }</pre>
6008          *   </li>
6009          * </ul>
6010          *  
6011          * @since 1.3.1
6012          * 
6013          * @example
6014          * hcap.network.ping({
6015          *      "ip" : "192.168.100.1",
6016          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6017          *          console.log("onSuccess : round trip time = " + s.roundTripTimeInMs);
6018          *      }, 
6019          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6020          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6021          *      }
6022          * });
6023          */
6024         hcap.network.ping = function (param) {
6025             hcap_command("ping", param);
6026         };
6027         /**
6028          * @namespace hcap.network.NetworkEventType
6029          */
6030         hcap.network.NetworkEventType = {
6031             /**
6032              * Unknown network event type.
6033              * @since 1.6.0
6034              * @constant
6035              */
6036             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
6037             /**
6038              * Ethernet is plugged.
6039              * @since 1.6.0
6040              * @constant
6041              */
6042             ETHERNET_PLUGGED : 0x01,
6043             /**
6044              * Ethernet is unplugged.
6045              * @since 1.6.0
6046              * @constant
6047              */
6048             ETHERNET_UNPLUGGED : 0x02,
6049             /**
6050              * Wi-Fi dongle is plugged.
6051              * @since 1.6.0
6052              * @constant
6053              */
6054             WIFI_DONGLE_PLUGGED : 0x03,
6055             /**
6056              * Wi-Fi dongle is unplugged.
6057              * @since 1.6.0
6058              * @constant
6059              */
6060             WIFI_DONGLE_UNPLUGGED : 0x04,
6061             /**
6062              * IP address conflicts.
6063              * @since 1.6.0
6064              * @constant
6065              */
6066             IP_CONFLICT : 0x05,
6067             /**
6068              * IP address does not conflict.
6069              * @since 1.6.0
6070              * @constant
6071              */
6072             IP_NOT_CONFLICT : 0x06,
6073             /**
6074              * DHCP is succeeded.
6075              * @since 1.6.0
6076              * @constant
6077              */
6078             DHCP_SUCCESS : 0x07,
6079             /**
6080              * DHCP fails.
6081              * @since 1.6.0
6082              * @constant
6083              */
6084             DHCP_FAIL : 0x08,
6085             /**
6086              * Unable to reach gateway.
6087              * @since 1.6.0
6088              * @constant
6089              */
6090             UNABLE_REACH_GATEWAY : 0x09,
6091             /**
6092              * Able to reach gateway.
6093              * @since 1.6.0
6094              * @constant
6095              */
6096             ABLE_REACH_GATEWAY : 0x0A,
6097             /**
6098              * Unable to reach DNS.
6099              * @since 1.6.0
6100              * @constant
6101              */
6102             UNABLE_REACH_DNS : 0x0B,
6103             /**
6104              * Able to reach DNS.
6105              * @since 1.6.0
6106              * @constant
6107              */
6108             ABLE_REACH_DNS : 0x0C,
6109             /**
6110              * Unable to reach internet.
6111              * @since 1.6.0
6112              * @constant
6113              */
6114             UNABLE_REACH_INTERNET : 0x0D,
6115             /**
6116              * Able to reach internet.
6117              * @since 1.6.0
6118              * @constant
6119              */
6120             ABLE_REACH_INTERNET : 0x0E,
6121             /**
6122              * Searching Wi-Fi access point is completed.
6123              * @since 1.6.0
6124              * @constant
6125              */
6126             WIFI_AP_SEARCH_COMPLETE : 0x0F,
6127             /**
6128              * Wi-Fi is connected.
6129              * @since 1.6.0
6130              * @constant
6131              */
6132             WIFI_CONNECTED : 0x10,
6133             /**
6134              * fail to connect Wi-Fi.
6135              * @since 1.6.0
6136              * @constant
6137              */
6138             WIFI_CONNECT_FAIL : 0x11,
6139             /**
6140              * Wi-Fi link is dropped.
6141              * @since 1.6.0
6142              * @constant
6143              */
6144             WIFI_LINK_DROPPED : 0x12
6145         };
6146         /**
6147          * @namespace hcap.network.NetworkMode
6148          */
6149         hcap.network.NetworkMode = {
6150             /**
6151              * Unknown network mode.
6152              * @since 1.6.0
6153              * @constant
6154              */
6155             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
6156             /**
6157              * Wired network mode.
6158              * @since 1.6.0
6159              * @constant
6160              */
6161             WIRE : 0x01,
6162             /**
6163              * Wireless network mode.
6164              * @since 1.6.0
6165              * @constant
6166              */
6167             WIRELESS : 0x02,
6168             /**
6169              * Network is not reachable.
6170              * @since 1.6.0
6171              * @constant
6172              */
6173             NOT_REACHABLE : 0x03
6174         };
6175         /**
6176          * @namespace hcap.network.WirelessMode
6177          */
6178         hcap.network.WirelessMode = {
6179             /**
6180              * Unknown wireless mode.
6181              * @since 1.6.0
6182              * @constant
6183              */
6184             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
6185             /**
6186              * Infra wireless mode.
6187              * @since 1.6.0
6188              * @constant
6189              */
6190             INFRA : 0x01,
6191             /**
6192              * Ad-hoc wireless mode.
6193              * @since 1.6.0
6194              * @constant
6195              */
6196             ADHOC : 0x02
6197         };
6198         /**
6199          * @namespace hcap.network.WifiSecurityType
6200          */
6201         hcap.network.WifiSecurityType = {
6202             /**
6203              * Unknown security type.
6204              * @since 1.6.0
6205              * @constant
6206              */
6207             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
6208             /**
6209              * Open.
6210              * @since 1.6.0
6211              * @constant
6212              */
6213             OPEN : 0x01,
6214             /**
6215              * WEP.
6216              * @since 1.6.0
6217              * @constant
6218              */
6219             WEP : 0x02,
6220             /**
6221              * WPA_PSK_TKIP.
6222              * @since 1.6.0
6223              * @constant
6224              */
6225             WPA_PSK_TKIP : 0x03,
6226             /**
6227              * WPA_PSK_AES.
6228              * @since 1.6.0
6229              * @constant
6230              */
6231             WPA_PSK_AES : 0x04,
6232             /**
6233              * WPA2_PSK_TKIP.
6234              * @since 1.6.0
6235              * @constant
6236              */
6237             WPA2_PSK_TKIP : 0x05,
6238             /**
6239              * WPA2_PSK_AES.
6240              * @since 1.6.0
6241              * @constant
6242              */
6243             WPA2_PSK_AES : 0x06,
6244             /**
6245              * WPA12_PSK_AES_TKIPAES.
6246              * @since 1.6.0
6247              * @constant
6248              */
6249             WPA12_PSK_AES_TKIPAES : 0x07
6250         };
6251         /**
6252          * @namespace hcap.network.DhcpState
6253          */
6254         hcap.network.DhcpState = {
6255             /**
6256              * Unknown DHCP state.
6257              * @since 1.6.0
6258              * @constant
6259              */
6260             UNKNOWN : 0x00,
6261             /**
6262              * Init.
6263              * @since 1.6.0
6264              * @constant
6265              */
6266             INIT : 0x01,
6267             /**
6268              * Selecting.
6269              * @since 1.6.0
6270              * @constant
6271              */
6272             SELECTING : 0x02,
6273             /**
6274              * Requesting.
6275              * @since 1.6.0
6276              * @constant
6277              */
6278             REQUESTING : 0x03,
6279             /**
6280              * Bound.
6281              * @since 1.6.0
6282              * @constant
6283              */
6284             BOUND : 0x04,
6285             /**
6286              * Renewing.
6287              * @since 1.6.0
6288              * @constant
6289              */
6290             RENEWING : 0x05,
6291             /**
6292              * Rebinding.
6293              * @since 1.6.0
6294              * @constant
6295              */
6296             REBINDING : 0x06,
6297             /**
6298              * Init Reboot.
6299              * @since 1.6.0
6300              * @constant
6301              */
6302             INIT_REBOOT : 0x07,
6303             /**
6304              * Rebooting.
6305              * @since 1.6.0
6306              * @constant
6307              */
6308             REBOOTING : 0x08
6309         };
6310         /**
6311          * Gets the network information.
6312          *
6313          * @param {Object} param
6314          * <ul>
6315          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6316          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6317          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6318          *       // {Number} param.network_mode - wire or wireless (<a href="hcap.network.NetworkMode.html">hcap.network.NetworkMode</a>)
6319          *       // {String} param.ssid - ssid for wireless AP
6320          *       // {Number} param.eth_speed - network speed (Mbps), auto-negotiation data
6321          *       // {Number} param.eth_duplex - network duplex(half : 0, full : 1, fail : -1), auto-negotiation data
6322          *       // {Boolean} param.local_network_available - if connected to gateway of AP
6323          *       // {Boolean} param.internet_available - if connected to Internet
6324          *       // {Number} param.wifi_mode - INFRA or Ad-hoc (<a href="hcap.network.WirelessMode.html">hcap.network.WirelessMode</a>)
6325          *       // {Number} param.wireless_security_type - security types (<a href="hcap.network.WifiSecurityType.html">hcap.network.WifiSecurityType</a>)  
6326          *       // {String} param.wifi_pass_key - security key string. This value is not delivered to HCAP application by LG security policy since 1.18.4.
6327          *       // {Boolean} param.using_dhcp - if using dhcp
6328          *       // {String} param.ip_address - ip address
6329          *       // {String} param.subnet_mask - subnet mask
6330          *       // {String} param.gateway - gateway adress
6331          *       // {String} param.dns1_address - main DNS address
6332          *       // {String} param.dns2_address - secondary DNS address
6333          *       // {Boolean} param.dns_dhcp - DNS dhcp flag
6334          *       // {Boolean} param.ethernet_plugged - if ethernet cable is plugged
6335          *       // {Boolean} param.wifi_plugged - if Wi-Fi dongle is plugged
6336          *       // {Number} param.dhcp_state - dhcp status (<a href="hcap.network.DhcpState.html">hcap.network.DhcpState</a>) 
6337          *   }</pre>
6338          *   </li>
6339          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
6340          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6341          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6342          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6343          *   }</pre>
6344          *   </li>
6345          * </ul>
6346          *  
6347          * @since 1.6.0
6348          * 
6349          * @see
6350          * <a href="_global_.html#event:network_event_received">{Event} network_event_received</a><br>
6351          *
6352          * @example
6353          * hcap.network.getNetworkInformation({
6354          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6355          *          console.log("onSuccess : network_mode = " + s.network_mode + 
6356          *              "\n ssid = " + s.ssid +
6357          *              "\n eth_speed = " + s.eth_speed +
6358          *              "\n eth_duplex = " + s.eth_duplex +
6359          *              "\n local_network_available = " + s.local_network_available +
6360          *              "\n internet_available = " + s.internet_available +
6361          *              "\n wifi_mode = " + s.wifi_mode +
6362          *              "\n wireless_security_type = " + s.wireless_security_type +
6363          *              "\n wifi_pass_key = " + s.wifi_pass_key +
6364          *              "\n using_dhcp = " + s.using_dhcp +
6365          *              "\n ip_address = " + s.ip_address +
6366          *              "\n subnet_mask = " + s.subnet_mask +
6367          *              "\n gateway = " + s.gateway +
6368          *              "\n dns1_address = " + s.dns1_address +
6369          *              "\n dns2_address = " + s.dns2_address +
6370          *              "\n dns_dhcp = " + s.dns_dhcp +
6371          *              "\n ethernet_plugged = " + s.ethernet_plugged +
6372          *              "\n wifi_plugged = " + s.wifi_plugged +
6373          *              "\n dhcp_state = " + s.dhcp_state);
6374          *      }, 
6375          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6376          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6377          *      }
6378          * });
6379          */
6380         hcap.network.getNetworkInformation = function (param) {
6381             hcap_command("get_network_information", param);
6382         };
6383         /**
6384          * Gets the configuration of soft AP (Access Point).<br>
6385          *
6386          * @param {Object} param
6387          * <ul>
6388          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6389          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6390          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6391          *       // {String} param.ip - IP address of soft AP ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx"). available only when property "soft_ap" is "1".
6392          *       // {String} param.mac - MAC address of soft AP ("XX:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX"). available only when property "soft_ap" is "1".
6393          *       // {Number} param.connectedDeviceNumber - the number of connected devices to soft AP. available only when property "soft_ap" is "1".
6394          *       // {Number} param.channel - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)
6395          *       // {Number} param.signalStrength - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.
6396          *       // {Number} param.vlanId - 1 ~ 4094. 0 : vlan off.
6397          *       // {String} param.vlanIp - VLAN IP address ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")
6398          *       // {String} param.vlanSubnet - VLAN subnet mask ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")
6399          *       // {String} param.vlanGateway - VLAN gateway ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")
6400          *       // {String} param.mode - mode ("xxxx")
6401          *       // {String} param.securityType - security type ("xxxxx")
6402          *       // {String} param.radiusServerIp - radius server IP address ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")
6403          *       // {String} param.radiusServerPort - radius server port ("xxxx")
6404          *       // {String} param.radiusServerKey - radius server key ("xxxxxxx")
6405          *   }</pre>
6406          *   </li>
6407          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
6408          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6409          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6410          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6411          *   }</pre>
6412          *   </li>
6413          * </ul>
6414          *  
6415          * @since 1.19.0
6416          * 
6417          * @see
6418          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setSoftAP">hcap.network.setSoftAP()</a><br>
6419          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a><br>
6420          *
6421          * @example
6422          * hcap.network.getSoftAP({
6423          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6424          *          console.log("onSuccess : ip = " + s.ip + ", mac = " + s.mac + ", connected device = " + s.connectedDeviceNumber + ", channel = " + s.channel + ", signal strength = " + s.signalStrength + ", vland id = " + s.vlanId + ", vlan subnet = " + s.vlanSubnet + ", vlan gateway = " + s.vlanGateway);
6425          *      }, 
6426          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6427          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6428          *      }
6429          * });
6430          */
6431         hcap.network.getSoftAP = function (param) {
6432             hcap_command("get_soft_ap", param);
6433         };
6434         /**
6435          * Sets the configuration of soft AP (Access Point).<br>
6436          * Setting is possible only when the property "soft_ap" is "0".<br>
6437          * New configuration will be activated in the next change of the property "soft_ap" from "0" to "1" or reboot.<br>
6438          *
6439          * @param {Object} param
6440          * <ul>
6441          *   // default
6442          *   <li>{Number} param.channel [Required] - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)</li>
6443          *   <li>{Number} param.signalStrength [Required] - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.</li>
6444          *   <li>{Number} param.vlanId [Required] - 1 ~ 4094. 0 : vlan off.</li>
6445          *   <li>{String} param.vlanIp [Required] - VLAN IP address ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6446          *   <li>{String} param.vlanSubnet [Required] - VLAN subnet mask ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6447          *   <li>{String} param.vlanGateway [Required] - VLAN gateway ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6448          *   
6449          *   // mode : nat, securityType : psk
6450          *   <li>{Number} param.channel [Required] - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)</li>
6451          *   <li>{Number} param.signalStrength [Required] - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.</li>
6452          *   <li>{Number} param.vlanId [Required] - 1 ~ 4094. 0 : vlan off.</li>
6453          *   <li>{String} param.vlanIp [Required] - VLAN IP address ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6454          *   <li>{String} param.vlanSubnet [Required] - VLAN subnet mask ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6455          *   <li>{String} param.vlanGateway [Required] - VLAN gateway ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6456          *   <li>{String} param.mode [Required] - mode ("xxxx")</li>
6457          *   <li>{String} param.securityType [Required] - security type ("xxxxx")</li>
6458          *   
6459          *   // mode : bridge, securityType : psk
6460          *   <li>{Number} param.channel [Required] - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)</li>
6461          *   <li>{Number} param.signalStrength [Required] - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.</li>
6462          *   <li>{String} param.mode [Required] - mode ("xxxx")</li>
6463          *   <li>{String} param.securityType [Required] - security type ("xxxxx")</li>
6464          *   
6465          *   // mode : bridge, securityType : open
6466          *   <li>{Number} param.channel [Required] - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)</li>
6467          *   <li>{Number} param.signalStrength [Required] - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.</li>
6468          *   <li>{String} param.mode [Required] - mode ("xxxx")</li>
6469          *   <li>{String} param.securityType [Required] - security type ("xxxxx")</li>
6470          * 
6471          *    // mode : bridge, securityType : eap
6472          *   <li>{Number} param.channel [Required] - wireless channel (0 : random default. 1 ~ 165. Supported values is dependent on TV model.)</li>
6473          *   <li>{Number} param.signalStrength [Required] - 1 ~ 5 (1 : min Tx power, 5 : max Tx power). 0 : [default] follow country setting.</li>
6474          *   <li>{String} param.mode [Required] - mode ("xxxx")</li>
6475          *   <li>{String} param.securityType [Required] - security type ("xxxxx")</li>
6476          *   <li>{String} param.radiusServerIp [Required] - radius server IP address ("xxx.xxx.xxx.xxx")</li>
6477          *   <li>{String} param.radiusServerPort [Required] - radius server port ("xxxx")</li>
6478          *   <li>{String} param.radiusServerKey [Required] - radius server key ("xxxxxxx")</li>
6479          *   
6480          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6481          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6482          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
6483          *       // No Parameter.
6484          *   }</pre>
6485          *   </li>
6486          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function. If the property "soft_ap" is "1", failure callback will be called. 
6487          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6488          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6489          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6490          *   }</pre>
6491          *   </li>
6492          * </ul>
6493          *  
6494          * @since 1.19.0
6495          * 
6496          * @see
6497          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getSoftAP">hcap.network.getSoftAP()</a><br>
6498          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a><br>
6499          *
6500          * @example
6501          * // default
6502          * hcap.network.setSoftAP({
6503          *      "channel" : 0,
6504          *      "signalStrength" : 1,
6505          *      "vlanId" : 0,
6506          *      "vlanIp" : "192.168.11.3",
6507          *      "vlanSubnet" : "255.255.255.0",
6508          *      "vlanGateway" : "192.168.11.1",
6509          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6510          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6511          *      }, 
6512          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6513          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6514          *      }
6515          * });
6516          * 
6517          * @example
6518          * // mode : nat, securityType : psk
6519          * hcap.network.setSoftAP({
6520          *      "channel" : 3,
6521          *      "signalStrength" : 4,
6522          *      "vlanId" : 0,
6523          *      "vlanIp" : "192.168.11.3",
6524          *      "vlanSubnet" : "255.255.255.0",
6525          *      "vlanGateway" : "192.168.11.1",
6526          *      "mode" : "nat",
6527          *      "securityType" : "psk",
6528          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6529          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6530          *      }, 
6531          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6532          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6533          *      }
6534          * });
6535          * 
6536          * @example
6537          * // mode : bridge, securityType : psk
6538          * hcap.network.setSoftAP({
6539          *      "channel" : 2,
6540          *      "signalStrength" : 0,
6541          *      "mode" : "bridge",
6542          *      "securityType" : "psk",
6543          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6544          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6545          *      }, 
6546          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6547          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6548          *      }
6549          * });
6550          * 
6551          * @example
6552          * // mode : bridge, securityType : open
6553          * hcap.network.setSoftAP({
6554          *      "channel" : 2,
6555          *      "signalStrength" : 0,
6556          *      "mode" : "bridge",
6557          *      "securityType" : "open",
6558          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6559          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6560          *      }, 
6561          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6562          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6563          *      }
6564          * });
6565          * 
6566          * @example
6567          * // mode : bridge, securityType : eap
6568          * hcap.network.setSoftAP({
6569          *      "channel" : 2,
6570          *      "signalStrength" : 0,
6571          *      "radiusServerIp" : "192.168.0.50",
6572          *      "radiusServerPort" : "1010",
6573          *      "radiusServerPort" : "abcdefg",
6574          *      "mode" : "bridge",
6575          *      "securityType" : "eap",
6576          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6577          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6578          *      }, 
6579          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6580          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6581          *      }
6582          * });
6583          */
6584         hcap.network.setSoftAP = function (param) {
6585             hcap_command("set_soft_ap", param);
6586         };
6587         /**
6588          * Gets the wifi diagnostic information.
6589          * 
6590          * @example
6591          * hcap.network.getWifiDiagnostics({
6592          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6593          *          console.log("onSuccess  :" + 
6594          *              "\n version                 : " + s.version +
6595          *              "\n country code revision   : " + s.countryCodeRevision +
6596          *              "\n country code            : " + s.countryCode +
6597          *              "\n channel                 : " + s.channel +
6598          *              "\n mcs                     : " + s.mcs +
6599          *              "\n mimo                    : " + s.mimo +
6600          *              "\n rate                    : " + s.rate +
6601          *              "\n rssi                    : " + s.rssi +
6602          *              "\n noise                   : " + s.noise +
6603          *              "\n transimission power     : " + s.transimissionPower +
6604          *              "\n band width              : " + s.bandWidth);
6605          *      }, 
6606          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6607          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6608          *      }
6609          * });
6610          * @param {Object} param
6611          * <ul>
6612          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6613          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6614          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6615          *       // {String} param.version - version.
6616          *       // {Number} param.countryCodeRevision - country code revision.
6617          *       // {String} param.countryCode - country code.
6618          *       // {Number} param.channel - channel.
6619          *       // {Number} param.mcs - mcs.
6620          *       // {String} param.mimo - mimo.
6621          *       // {String} param.rate - rate.
6622          *       // {String} param.rssi - rssi.
6623          *       // {String} param.noise - noise.
6624          *       // {String} param.transimissionPower - transimission power.
6625          *       // {String} param.bandWidth - band width.
6626          *   }</pre>
6627          *   </li>
6628          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6629          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6630          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6631          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6632          *   }</pre>
6633          *   </li>
6634          * </ul>
6635          * 
6636          * @since 1.19.2
6637          */
6638         hcap.network.getWifiDiagnostics = function (param) {
6639             hcap_command("get_wifi_diagnostics", param);
6640         };
6641         /**
6642          * Sends a asynchronous ping command to the specified IP.
6643          *
6644          * @param {Object} param
6645          * <ul>
6646          *   <li>{String} param.ip [Required] - IP address of the ping target.</li>
6647          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6648          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6649          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6650          *       // No Parameter
6651          *   }</pre>
6652          *   </li>
6653          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
6654          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6655          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6656          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6657          *   }</pre>
6658          *   </li>
6659          * </ul>
6660          *  
6661          * @since 1.22.0
6662          *
6663          * @see
6664          * <a href="_global_.html#event:ping_result_received">{Event} ping_result_received</a><br>
6665          *  
6666          * @example
6667          * hcap.network.asyncPing({
6668          *      "ip" : "192.168.100.1",
6669          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6670          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6671          *      }, 
6672          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6673          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6674          *      }
6675          * });
6676          */
6677         hcap.network.asyncPing = function (param) {
6678             hcap_command("async_ping", param);
6679         };
6680         /**
6681          * Sets the vlan id mode is enabled or disabled.<br>
6682          * 
6683          * @param {Object} param
6684          * <ul>
6685          *   <li>{Boolean} param.enable [Required] - true : enable to vlan id mode, false : disable.</li>
6686          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6687          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6688          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
6689          *       // No Parameter. 
6690          *   }</pre>
6691          *   </li>
6692          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6693          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6694          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6695          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6696          *   }</pre>
6697          *   </li>
6698          * </ul>
6699          *  
6700          * @since 1.22.0
6701          * 
6702          * @see
6703          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getVlanIdMode">hcap.network.getVlanIdMode()</a><br>
6704          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setLanId">hcap.network.setLanId()</a><br>
6705          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getLanId">hcap.network.getLanId()</a><br>
6706          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setAuxLanId">hcap.network.setAuxLanId()</a><br>
6707          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getAuxLanId">hcap.network.getAuxLanId()</a><br>
6708          * <a href="_global_.html#event:ui_value_changed">{Event} ui_value_changed</a><br>
6709          *
6710          * @example
6711          * hcap.network.setVlanIdMode({
6712          *      "enable" : true,
6713          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
6714          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6715          *      }, 
6716          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6717          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6718          *      }
6719          * });
6720          */
6721         hcap.network.setVlanIdMode = function (param) {
6722             hcap_command("set_vlan_id_mode", param);
6723         };
6724         /**
6725          * Gets whether vlan id mode is enabled or disabled.<br>
6726          * 
6727          * @param {Object} param
6728          * <ul>
6729          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6730          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6731          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6732          *       // {Boolean} param.enable - true if the vlan id mode is enabled. false if the vlan id mode is disabled.
6733          *   }</pre>
6734          *   </li>
6735          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6736          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6737          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6738          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6739          *   }</pre>
6740          *   </li>
6741          * </ul>
6742          *  
6743          * @since 1.22.0
6744          * 
6745          * @see
6746          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setVlanIdMode">hcap.network.setVlanIdMode()</a><br>
6747          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setLanId">hcap.network.setLanId()</a><br>
6748          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getLanId">hcap.network.getLanId()</a><br>
6749          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setAuxLanId">hcap.network.setAuxLanId()</a><br>
6750          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getAuxLanId">hcap.network.getAuxLanId()</a><br> 
6751          *
6752          * @example
6753          * hcap.network.getVlanIdMode({
6754          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
6755          *          console.log("onSuccess : vlan id mode= " + param.enable);
6756          *      }, 
6757          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6758          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6759          *      }
6760          * });
6761          */
6762         hcap.network.getVlanIdMode = function (param) {
6763             hcap_command("get_vlan_id_mode", param);
6764         };
6765         /**
6766          * Gets the current value of the lan id.<br>
6767          * 
6768          * @param {Object} param
6769          * <ul>
6770          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6771          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6772          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6773          *       // {Number} param.lanId - current value of the lan id (1~4094).
6774          *   }</pre>
6775          *   </li>
6776          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6777          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6778          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6779          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6780          *   }</pre>
6781          *   </li>
6782          * </ul>
6783          * 
6784          * @since 1.22.0
6785          * 
6786          * @see
6787          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setVlanIdMode">hcap.network.setVlanIdMode()</a><br>
6788          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getVlanIdMode">hcap.network.getVlanIdMode()</a><br>
6789          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setLanId">hcap.network.setLanId()</a><br>
6790          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setAuxLanId">hcap.network.setAuxLanId()</a><br>
6791          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getAuxLanId">hcap.network.getAuxLanId()</a><br> 
6792          *
6793          * @example
6794          * hcap.network.getLanId({
6795          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6796          *          console.log("onSuccess : lan id = " + s.lanId);
6797          *      }, 
6798          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6799          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6800          *      }
6801          * });
6802          */
6803         hcap.network.getLanId = function (param) {
6804             hcap_command("get_lan_id", param);
6805         };
6806         /**
6807          * Sets the lan id.<br>
6808          * This is worked only when the vlan id mode is enabled.<br>
6809          *
6810          * @param {Object} param
6811          * <ul>
6812          *   <li>{Number} param.lanId [Required] - range is 1~4094.</li>
6813          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6814          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6815          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
6816          *       // No Parameter.
6817          *   }</pre>
6818          *   </li>
6819          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
6820          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6821          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6822          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6823          *   }</pre>
6824          *   </li>
6825          * </ul>
6826          * 
6827          * @since 1.22.0
6828          * 
6829          * @see
6830          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setVlanIdMode">hcap.network.setVlanIdMode()</a><br>
6831          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getVlanIdMode">hcap.network.getVlanIdMode()</a><br>
6832          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getLanId">hcap.network.getLanId()</a><br>
6833          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setAuxLanId">hcap.network.setAuxLanId()</a><br>
6834          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getAuxLanId">hcap.network.getAuxLanId()</a><br> 
6835          *
6836          * @example
6837          * hcap.network.setLanId({
6838          *      "lanId" : 50, 
6839          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
6840          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6841          *      }, 
6842          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6843          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6844          *      }
6845          * });
6846          */
6847         
6848         hcap.network.setLanId = function (param) {
6849             hcap_command("set_lan_id", param);
6850         };
6851         /**
6852          * Gets the current value of the aux lan id.<br>
6853          * 
6854          * @param {Object} param
6855          * <ul>
6856          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6857          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6858          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
6859          *       // {Number} param.auxLanId - current value of the aux lan id (1~4094).
6860          *   }</pre>
6861          *   </li>
6862          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
6863          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6864          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6865          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6866          *   }</pre>
6867          *   </li>
6868          * </ul>
6869          * 
6870          * @since 1.22.0
6871          * 
6872          * @see
6873          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setVlanIdMode">hcap.network.setVlanIdMode()</a><br>
6874          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getVlanIdMode">hcap.network.getVlanIdMode()</a><br>
6875          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setLanId">hcap.network.setLanId()</a><br>
6876          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getLanId">hcap.network.getLanId()</a><br>
6877          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setAuxLanId">hcap.network.setAuxLanId()</a><br>
6878          *
6879          * @example
6880          * hcap.network.getAuxLanId({
6881          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
6882          *          console.log("onSuccess : aux lan id = " + s.auxLanId);
6883          *      }, 
6884          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6885          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6886          *      }
6887          * });
6888          */
6889         hcap.network.getAuxLanId = function (param) {
6890             hcap_command("get_aux_lan_id", param);
6891         };
6892         /**
6893          * Sets the aux lan id.<br>
6894          * This is worked only when the vlan id mode is enabled.<br>
6895          *
6896          * @param {Object} param
6897          * <ul>
6898          *   <li>{Number} param.auxLanId [Required] - range is 1~4094.</li>
6899          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
6900          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6901          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
6902          *       // No Parameter.
6903          *   }</pre>
6904          *   </li>
6905          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
6906          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
6907          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
6908          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
6909          *   }</pre>
6910          *   </li>
6911          * </ul>
6912          * 
6913          * @since 1.22.0
6914          * 
6915          * @see
6916          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setVlanIdMode">hcap.network.setVlanIdMode()</a><br>
6917          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getVlanIdMode">hcap.network.getVlanIdMode()</a><br>
6918          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.setLanId">hcap.network.setLanId()</a><br>
6919          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getLanId">hcap.network.getLanId()</a><br>
6920          * <a href="hcap.network.html#.getAuxLanId">hcap.network.getAuxLanId()</a><br>
6921          *
6922          * @example
6923          * hcap.network.setAuxLanId({
6924          *      "auxLanId" : 50, 
6925          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
6926          *          console.log("onSuccess");
6927          *      }, 
6928          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
6929          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
6930          *      }
6931          * });
6932          */
6933         hcap.network.setAuxLanId = function (param) {
6934             hcap_command("set_aux_lan_id", param);
6935         };
6936         /**
6937          * @namespace hcap.mode
6938          */
6939         hcap.mode = {};
6940         /**
6941              * HCAP mode 0
6942              * @since 1.3.1
6943              * @constant
6944              */
6945         hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_0                      = 0x101;
6946             /**
6947              * HCAP mode 1
6948              * @since 1.3.1
6949              * @constant
6950              */
6951         hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_1                      = 0x102;
6952             /**
6953              * HCAP mode 2
6954              * @since 1.3.1
6955              * @constant
6956              */
6957         hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_2                      = 0x103;
6958             /**
6959              * HCAP mode 3
6960              * @since 1.3.1
6961              * @constant
6962              */
6963         hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_3                      = 0x104;
6964             /**
6965              * HCAP mode 4
6966              * @since 1.3.1
6967              * @constant
6968              */
6969         hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_4                      = 0x105;
6970         /**
6971          * Gets the current HCAP mode.<br><br>
6972          * Hcap mode is related to the application visibility and the key control.<br><br>
6973          * Following table specifies application visibility for each HCAP mode.<br>
6974          * 
6975          * <div align=center>
6976          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=600>
6977          *   <thead>
6978          *     <tr>
6979          *     <th></th>
6980          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_0">HCAP_MODE_0</a></th>
6981          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_1">HCAP_MODE_1</a></th>
6982          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_2">HCAP_MODE_2</a></th>
6983          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_3">HCAP_MODE_3</a></th>
6984          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_4">HCAP_MODE_4</a></th>
6985          *     </tr>
6986          *   </thead>
6987          *   <tbody>
6988          *     <tr class="odd">
6989          *       <td>Application Visibility</td>
6990          *       <td>X</td>
6991          *       <td>O</td>
6992          *       <td>O</td>
6993          *       <td>O</td>
6994          *       <td>O</td>
6995          *     </tr>
6996          *   </tbody>
6997          *   <tfoot>
6998          *     <tr><th colspan="6">HCAP Mode & Application Visibility (O : visible, X : invisible)</td></tr>
6999          *   </tfoot>
7000          * </table>
7001          * </div>
7002          * <br>
7003          * Following table specifies whether key is delivered to application or not for each HCAP mode.<br>
7004          * (O : key is delivered to application, X : key is not delivered to application)
7005          * <div align=center>
7006          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=600>
7007          *   <thead>
7008          *     <tr>
7009          *     <th>Key</th>
7010          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_0">HCAP_MODE_0</a></th>
7011          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_1">HCAP_MODE_1</a></th>
7012          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_2">HCAP_MODE_2</a></th>
7013          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_3">HCAP_MODE_3</a></th>
7014          *     <th><a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_4">HCAP_MODE_4</a></th>
7015          *     </tr>
7016          *   </thead>
7017          *   <tbody>
7018          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.NUM_0">       NUM_0~NUM_9     </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td></tr>
7019          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.MINUS">       MINUS           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td></tr>
7020          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.CH_UP">       CH_UP           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>O</td></tr>
7021          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.CH_DOWN">     CH_DOWN         </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>O</td></tr>
7022          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.GUIDE">       GUIDE           </a></td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7023          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.INFO">        INFO            </a></td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
