7024          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.LEFT">        LEFT            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7025          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.UP">          UP              </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7026          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.RIGHT">       RIGHT           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7027          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.DOWN">        DOWN            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7028          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.ENTER">       ENTER           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7029          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.BACK">        BACK            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7030          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.EXIT">        EXIT            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7031          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.RED">         RED             </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7032          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.GREEN">       GREEN           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7033          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.YELLOW">      YELLOW          </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7034          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.BLUE">        BLUE            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7035          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.STOP">        STOP            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7036          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.PLAY">        PLAY            </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7037          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.PAUSE">       PAUSE           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7038          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.REWIND">      REWIND          </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7039          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.FAST_FORWARD">FAST_FORWARD    </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7040          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.LAST_CH">     LAST_CH         </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>O</td></tr>
7041          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.PORTAL">      PORTAL          </a></td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7042          *     <tr class="odd"><td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html#.ORDER">       ORDER           </a></td><td>X</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td><td>O</td></tr>
7043          *     <tr>            <td><a href="hcap.key.Code.html">              Keys not in list</a></td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td><td>X</td></tr>
7044          *   </tbody>
7045          *   <tfoot>
7046          *     <tr><th colspan="6">HCAP Mode & Key Delivery</td></tr>
7047          *   </tfoot>
7048          * </table>
7049          * </div>
7050          *
7051          * @param {Object} param
7052          * <ul>
7053          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7054          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7055          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
7056          *       // {Number} param.mode - HCAP mode.
7057          *   }</pre>
7058          *   </li>
7059          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
7060          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7061          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7062          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7063          *   }</pre>
7064          *   </li>
7065          * </ul>
7066          * 
7067          * @see
7068          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.setHcapMode">hcap.mode.setHcapMode()</a><br>
7069          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_0">HCAP_MODE_0</a><br>
7070          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_1">HCAP_MODE_1</a><br>
7071          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_2">HCAP_MODE_2</a><br>
7072          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_3">HCAP_MODE_3</a><br>
7073          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_4">HCAP_MODE_4</a>
7074          * 
7075          * @since 1.3.1
7076          * 
7077          * @example
7078          * hcap.mode.getHcapMode({
7079          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
7080          *          console.log("onSuccess : current hcap mode = " + s.mode);
7081          *      }, 
7082          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7083          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7084          *      }
7085          * });
7086          */
7087         hcap.mode.getHcapMode = function (param) {
7088             hcap_command("get_mw_mode", param);
7089         };
7090         /**
7091          * Sets the HCAP mode.<br>
7092          * Please refer to <a href="hcap.mode.html#.getHcapMode">hcap.mode.getHcapMode()</a> for the detailed information regarding the HCAP mode.
7093          *
7094          * @param {Object} param
7095          * <ul>
7096          *   <li>{Number} param.mode [Required] - HCAP mode.</li>
7097          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
7098          *         Setting to the same HCAP mode as before will invoke this callback function.
7099          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7100          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
7101          *       // No parameter.
7102          *   }</pre>
7103          *   </li>
7104          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
7105          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7106          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7107          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7108          *   }</pre>
7109          *   </li>
7110          * </ul>
7111          *  
7112          * @since 1.3.1
7113          * 
7114          * @see
7115          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.getHcapMode">hcap.mode.getHcapMode()</a><br>
7116          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_0">HCAP_MODE_0</a><br>
7117          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_1">HCAP_MODE_1</a><br>
7118          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_2">HCAP_MODE_2</a><br>
7119          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_3">HCAP_MODE_3</a><br>
7120          * <a href="hcap.mode.html#.HCAP_MODE_4">HCAP_MODE_4</a>
7121          *
7122          * @example
7123          * hcap.mode.setHcapMode({
7124          *      "mode" : hcap.mode.HCAP_MODE_2,
7125          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
7126          *          console.log("onSuccess");
7127          *      }, 
7128          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7129          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7130          *      }
7131          * });
7132          */
7133         hcap.mode.setHcapMode = function (param) {
7134             hcap_command("set_mw_mode", param);
7135         };
7136         /**
7137          * @namespace hcap.key
7138          */
7139         hcap.key = {};
7140         /**
7141          * @namespace hcap.key.Code
7142          */
7143         hcap.key.Code = {
7144             /**
7145              * Number 0 key.
7146              * @since 1.3.1
7147              * @constant
7148              */
7149             NUM_0 : 0x0030,
7150             /**
7151              * Number 1 key.
7152              * @since 1.3.1
7153              * @constant
7154              */
7155             NUM_1 : 0x0031,

7755             LG_3D : 0x02E1,

7759              * @constant
7760              */
7761             DATA : 0x02E2
7762         };
7763         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_0]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_0;                // 0x0030(48) => 0x0030(48)
7764         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_1]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_1;                // 0x0031(49) => 0x0031(49)
7765         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_2]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_2;                // 0x0032(50) => 0x0032(50)
7766         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_3]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_3;                // 0x0033(51) => 0x0033(51)
7767         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_4]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_4;                // 0x0034(52) => 0x0034(52)
7768         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_5]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_5;                // 0x0035(53) => 0x0035(53)
7769         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_6]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_6;                // 0x0036(54) => 0x0036(54)
7770         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_7]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_7;                // 0x0037(55) => 0x0037(55)
7771         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_8]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_8;                // 0x0038(56) => 0x0038(56)
7772         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NUM_9]             = hcap.key.Code.NUM_9;                // 0x0039(57) => 0x0039(57)
7773         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.CH_UP]             = hcap.key.Code.CH_UP;                // 0x01AB(427) => 0x01AB(427)
7774         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.CH_DOWN]           = hcap.key.Code.CH_DOWN;              // 0x01AC(428) => 0x01AC(428)
7775         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.GUIDE]             = hcap.key.Code.GUIDE;                // 0x01CA(458) => 0x01CA(458)
7776         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.INFO]              = hcap.key.Code.INFO;                 // 0x01C9(457) => 0x01C9(457)
7777         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.LEFT]              = hcap.key.Code.LEFT;                 // 0x0025(37) => 0x0025(37)
7778         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.UP]                = hcap.key.Code.UP;                   // 0x0026(38) => 0x0026(38)
7779         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RIGHT]             = hcap.key.Code.RIGHT;                // 0x0027(39) => 0x0027(39)
7780         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.DOWN]              = hcap.key.Code.DOWN;                 // 0x0028(40) => 0x0028(40)
7781         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.ENTER]             = 10;                                 // *0x000D(13) => 0x000A(10)
7782         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.BACK]              = 608;                                // *0x01CD(461) => 0x260(608)
7783         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.EXIT]              = 601;                                // *0x03E9(1001) => 0x0259(601)
7784         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RED]               = hcap.key.Code.RED;                  // 0x0193(403) => 0x0193(403)
7785         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.GREEN]             = hcap.key.Code.GREEN;                // 0x0194(404) => 0x0194(404)
7786         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.YELLOW]            = hcap.key.Code.YELLOW;               // 0x0195(405) => 0x0195(405)
7787         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.BLUE]              = hcap.key.Code.BLUE;                 // 0x0196(406) => 0x0196(406)
7788         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.STOP]              = hcap.key.Code.STOP;                 // 0x019D(413) => 0x019D(413)
7789         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PLAY]              = hcap.key.Code.PLAY;                 // 0x019F(415) => 0x019F(415)
7790         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PAUSE]             = hcap.key.Code.PAUSE;                // 0x0013(19) => 0x0013(19)
7791         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.REWIND]            = hcap.key.Code.REWIND;               // 0x019C(412) => 0x019C(412)
7792         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.FAST_FORWARD]      = hcap.key.Code.FAST_FORWARD;         // 0x01A1(417) => 0x01A1(417)
7793         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.LAST_CH]           = 607;                                // *0x02C7(711) => 0x025F(607)
7794         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PORTAL]            = hcap.key.Code.PORTAL;               // 0x025A(602) => 0x025A(602)
7795         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.ORDER]             = hcap.key.Code.ORDER;                // 0x026F(623) => 0x026F(623)
7796         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.MINUS]             = 45;                                 // *0x02C0(704) => 0x002D(45)
7797         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.POWER]             = hcap.key.Code.POWER;                // 0x0199(409) => 0x0199(409)
7798         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.VOL_UP]            = hcap.key.Code.VOL_UP;               // 0x01BF(447) => 0x01BF(447)
7799         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.VOL_DOWN]          = hcap.key.Code.VOL_DOWN;             // 0x01C0(448) => 0x01C0(448)
7800         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.MUTE]              = hcap.key.Code.MUTE;                 // 0x01C1(449) => 0x01C1(449)
7801         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RECORD]            = hcap.key.Code.RECORD;               // 0x01A0(416) => 0x01A0(416)
7802         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PAGE_UP]           = hcap.key.Code.PAGE_UP;              // 0x0021(33) => 0x0021(33)
7803         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PAGE_DOWN]         = hcap.key.Code.PAGE_DOWN;            // 0x0022(34) => 0x0022(34)
7804         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RF_BYPASS]         = 600;                                // *0x001D(29) => 0x0258(600)
7805         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NEXT_DAY]          = 603;                                // *0x01A9(425) => 0x025B(603)
7806         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PREV_DAY]          = 604;                                // *0x01A8(424) => 0x025C(604)
7807         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.APPS]              = 605;                                // *0x005D(93) => 0x025D(605)
7808         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.LINK]              = hcap.key.Code.LINK;                 // 0x025E(606) => 0x025E(606)
7809         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.FORWARD]           = 609;                                // *0x00A7(167) => 0x0261(609)
7810         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.ZOOM]              = 610;                                // *0x00FB(251) => 0x0262(610)
7811         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SETTINGS]          = hcap.key.Code.SETTINGS;             // 0x0263(611) => 0x0263(611)
7812         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NEXT_FAV_CH]       = 612;                                // *0x00B0(176) => 0x0264(612)
7813         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RES_1]             = 613;                                // *0x0070(112) => 0x0265(613)
7814         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RES_2]             = 614;                                // *0x0071(113) => 0x0266(614)
7815         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RES_3]             = 615;                                // *0x0072(114) => 0x0267(615)
7816         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RES_4]             = 616;                                // *0x0073(115) => 0x0268(616)
7817         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RES_5]             = 617;                                // *0x0074(116) => 0x0269(617)
7818         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RES_6]             = 618;                                // *0x0075(117) => 0x026A(618)
7819         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.LOCK]              = hcap.key.Code.LOCK;                 // 0x026B(619) => 0x026B(619)
7820         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SKIP]              = hcap.key.Code.SKIP;                 // 0x026C(620) => 0x026C(620)
7821         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.LIST]              = 621;                                // *0x03EE(1006) => 0x026D(621)
7822         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.LIVE]              = hcap.key.Code.LIVE;                 // 0x026E(622) => 0x026E(622)
7823         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.ON_DEMAND]         = hcap.key.Code.ON_DEMAND;            // 0x026F(623) => 0x026F(623)
7824         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PINP_MOVE]         = hcap.key.Code.PINP_MOVE;            // 0x0270(624) => 0x0270(624)
7825         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PINP_UP]           = hcap.key.Code.PINP_UP;              // 0x0271(625) => 0x0271(625)
7826         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PINP_DOWN]         = hcap.key.Code.PINP_DOWN;            // 0x0272(626) => 0x0272(626)
7827         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.MENU]              = 627;                                // *0x0012(18) => 0x0273(627)
7828         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.AD]                = hcap.key.Code.AD;                   // 0x02BC(700) => 0x02BC(700)
7829         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.ALARM]             = hcap.key.Code.ALARM;                // 0x02BD(701) => 0x02BD(701)
7830         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.AV_MODE]           = 702;                                // *0x001F(31) => 0x02BE(702)
7831         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SUBTITLE]          = 726;                                // *0x01CC(460) => 0x02D6(726)
7832         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.CC]                = 726;                                // *0x03F0(1008) => 0x02BF(703) // since 1.19.0, this will be ignored
7833         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.DISC_POWER_OFF]    = hcap.key.Code.DISC_POWER_OFF;       // 0x02C1(705) => 0x02C1(705)
7834         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.DISC_POWER_ON]     = hcap.key.Code.DISC_POWER_ON;        // 0x02C2(706) => 0x02C2(706)
7835         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.DVD]               = hcap.key.Code.DVD;                  // 0x02C3(707) => 0x02C3(707)
7836         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.EJECT]             = 708;                                // 0x019E(414) => 0x02C4(708)
7837         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.ENERGY_SAVING]     = hcap.key.Code.ENERGY_SAVING;        // 0x02C5(709) => 0x02C5(709)
7838         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.FAV]               = hcap.key.Code.FAV;                  // 0x02C6(710) => 0x02C6(710)
7839         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.FLASHBK]           = hcap.key.Code.FLASHBK;              // 0x02C7(711) => 0x02C7(711)
7840         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.INPUT]             = hcap.key.Code.INPUT;                // 0x02C8(712) => 0x02C8(712)
7841         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.MARK]              = hcap.key.Code.MARK;                 // 0x02C9(713) => 0x02C9(713)
7842         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.NETCAST]           = 714;                                // 0x03E8(1000) => 0x02CA(714)
7843         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PIP]               = hcap.key.Code.PIP;                  // 0x02CB(715) => 0x02CB(715)
7844         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PIP_CH_DOWN]       = hcap.key.Code.PIP_CH_DOWN;          // 0x02CC(716) => 0x02CC(716)
7845         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PIP_CH_UP]         = hcap.key.Code.PIP_CH_UP;            // 0x02CD(717) => 0x02CD(717)
7846         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PIP_INPUT]         = hcap.key.Code.PIP_INPUT;            // 0x02CE(718) => 0x02CE(718)
7847         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.PIP_SWAP]          = hcap.key.Code.PIP_SWAP;             // 0x02CF(719) => 0x02CF(719)
7848         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.Q_MENU]            = 720;                                // *0x03EA(1002) => 0x02D0(720)
7849         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.Q_VIEW]            = 721;                                // *0x03EF(1007) => 0x02D1(721)
7850         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.RATIO]             = 722;                                // *0x03ED(1005) => 0x02D2(722)
7851         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SAP]               = hcap.key.Code.SAP;                  // 0x02D3(723) => 0x02D3(723)
7852         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SIMPLINK]          = hcap.key.Code.SIMPLINK;             // 0x02D4(724) => 0x02D4(724)
7853         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.STB]               = hcap.key.Code.STB;                  // 0x02D5(725) => 0x02D5(725)
7854         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.T_OPT]             = 727;                                // *0x03EC(1004) => 0x02D7(727)
7855         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.TEXT]              = 728;                                // *0x01CB(459) => 0x02D8(728)
7856         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SLEEP_TIMER]       = hcap.key.Code.SLEEP_TIMER;          // 0x02D9(729) => 0x02D9(729)
7857         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.TV]                = hcap.key.Code.TV;                   // 0x02DA(730) => 0x02DA(730)
7858         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.TV_RAD]            = hcap.key.Code.TV_RAD;               // 0x02DB(731) => 0x02DB(731)
7859         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.VCR]               = hcap.key.Code.VCR;                  // 0x02DC(732) => 0x02DC(732)
7860         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.POWER_LOWBATTERY]  = hcap.key.Code.POWER_LOWBATTERY;     // 0x02DD(733) => 0x02DD(733)
7861         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SMART_HOME]        = hcap.key.Code.SMART_HOME;           // 0x02DE(734) => 0x02DE(734)
7862         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.SCREEN_REMOTE]     = hcap.key.Code.SCREEN_REMOTE;        // 0x02DF(735) => 0x02DF(735)
7863         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.POINTER]           = hcap.key.Code.POINTER;              // 0x02E0(736) => 0x02E0(736)
7864         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.LG_3D]             = hcap.key.Code.LG_3D;                // 0x02E1(737) => 0x02E1(737)
7865         hcap_key_table[hcap.key.Code.DATA]              = hcap.key.Code.DATA;                 // 0x02E2(738) => 0x02E2(738)
7866         /**
7867          * Add/Modify a key item in the key table.<br>
7868          * <ul>
7869          *   <li>Add : If keycode is not in the key table, the key item will be added to the key table.</li>
7870          *   <li>Modify : If keycode is in the key table, but its virtual_keycode or attribute is different, the key item in the key table will be modified.</li>
7871          * </ul>
7872          * Keycode with attribute 2 or 3 in the key table is delivered to application as its virtual_keycode, not keycode.<br>
7873          * Keycode not in the key table is delivered to application as the keycode itself.
7874          *  
7875          * @param {Object} param
7876          * <ul>
7877          *   <li>{Number} param.keycode [Required] - custom RCU raw data (4 bytes). 0x00000000 for all LG RCU reserved keycode.</li>
7878          *   <li>{Number} param.virtualKeycode [Required] - virtual keycode defined by LG in <a href="hcap.key.Code.html">hcap.key.Code</a>.</li>
7879          *   <li>{Number} param.attribute [Required] - attribute of the key item.<br>
7880          *   <div align=center>
7881          *     <table class="hcap_spec" width=600>
7882          *       <thead>
7883          *         <tr>
7884          *           <th>Attribute</th>
7885          *           <th>Action</th>
7886          *         </tr>
7887          *       </thead>
7888          *       <tbody>
7889          *         <tr class="odd"><td>0</td><td class="left">Processed by TV (LG firmware). For Portal key (hcap.key.Code.PORTAL) when its attribute is 0, TV will launch the initial HCAP page.</td></tr>
7890          *         <tr>            <td>1</td><td class="left">Processed according to HCAP Mode defined in <a href="hcap.mode.html#.getHcapMode">hcap.mode.getHcapMode()</a>.</td></tr>
7891          *         <tr class="odd"><td>2</td><td class="left">Processed by application.</td></tr>
7892          *         <tr>            <td>3</td><td class="left">Processed by browser and application on browser while browser is running. Otherwise, processed by TV (LG firmware).</td></tr>
7893          *       </tbody>
7894          *       <tfoot>
7895          *         <tr><th colspan="6">HCAP Key Attribute & Action</td></tr>
7896          *       </tfoot>
7897          *     </table>
7898          *   </div>
7899          *   </li>
7900          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
7901          *       Setting to the same setting as before will invoke this callback function.
7902          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7903          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
7904          *       // No parameter.
7905          *   }</pre>
7906          *   </li>
7907          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
7908          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7909          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7910          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7911          *   }</pre>
7912          *   </li>
7913          * </ul>
7914          *  
7915          * @since 1.3.1
7916          * 
7917          * @see
7918          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.clearKeyTable">hcap.key.clearKeyTable()</a><br>
7919          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.removeKeyItem">hcap.key.removeKeyItem()</a><br>
7920          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.sendKey">hcap.key.sendKey()</a>
7921          *
7922          * @example
7923          * // add custom keycode as MENU with attribue 2 and change the attribute of LG GUIDE key to attribute 0
7924          * hcap.key.addKeyItem({
7925          *      "keycode" : 0x12345678,
7926          *      "virtualKeycode" : hcap.key.Code.MENU,
7927          *      "attribute" : 2,
7928          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
7929          *          console.log("onSuccess");
7930          *          hcap.key.addKeyItem({
7931          *               "keycode" : 0,
7932          *               "virtualKeycode" : hcap.key.Code.GUIDE,
7933          *               "attribute" : 0,
7934          *               "onSuccess" : function() {
7935          *                   console.log("onSuccess");
7936          *               }, 
7937          *               "onFailure" : function(f) {
7938          *                   console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7939          *               }
7940          *          });
7941          *      }, 
7942          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7943          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7944          *      }
7945          * });
7946          */
7947         hcap.key.addKeyItem = function (param) {
7948             param.virtualKeycode = hcap_key_table[param.virtualKeycode];
7949             hcap_command("add_key_item", param);
7950         };
7951         /**
7952          * Remove a key item in the key table.
7953          *  
7954          * @param {Object} param
7955          * <ul>
7956          *   <li>{Number} param.keycode [Required] - custom RCU raw data (4 bytes) to remove. If the keycode is 0x00000000 (reserved keycode for LG RCU), param.onFailure is invoked.</li>
7957          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
7958          *       Remove for the keycode not in the key table will invoke this callback function.
7959          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7960          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
7961          *       // No parameter.
7962          *   }</pre>
7963          *   </li>
7964          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
7965          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
7966          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
7967          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
7968          *   }</pre>
7969          *   </li>
7970          * </ul>
7971          *  
7972          * @since 1.3.1
7973          * 
7974          * @see
7975          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.addKeyItem">hcap.key.addKeyItem()</a><br>
7976          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.clearKeyTable">hcap.key.clearKeyTable()</a><br>
7977          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.sendKey">hcap.key.sendKey()</a>
7978          *
7979          * @example
7980          * hcap.key.removeKeyItem({
7981          *      "keycode" : 0x12345678,
7982          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
7983          *          console.log("onSuccess");
7984          *      }, 
7985          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
7986          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
7987          *      }
7988          * });
7989          */
7990         hcap.key.removeKeyItem = function (param) {
7991             hcap_command("remove_key_item", param);
7992         };
7993         /**
7994          * Clear the key table and restore it to the factory default.
7995          *  
7996          * @param {Object} param
7997          * <ul>
7998          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
7999          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8000          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
8001          *       // No parameter.
8002          *   }</pre>
8003          *   </li>
8004          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
8005          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8006          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8007          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8008          *   }</pre>
8009          *   </li>
8010          * </ul>
8011          *  
8012          * @since 1.3.1
8013          * 
8014          * @see
8015          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.addKeyItem">hcap.key.addKeyItem()</a><br>
8016          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.removeKeyItem">hcap.key.removeKeyItem()</a><br>
8017          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.sendKey">hcap.key.sendKey()</a>
8018          *
8019          * @example
8020          * hcap.key.clearKeyTable({
8021          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
8022          *          console.log("onSuccess");
8023          *      }, 
8024          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8025          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8026          *      }
8027          * });
8028          */
8029         hcap.key.clearKeyTable = function (param) {
8030             hcap_command("clear_key_table", param);
8031         };
8032         /**
8033          * Deliver a virtual keycode from application to TV.<br>
8034          * virtual_keycode is defined by LG and is processed like a key from LG RCU.<br>
8035          * Therefore the delivered virtual_keycode is mapped to a key item [keycode = 0x00000000, virtual_keycode] in the key table.<br>
8036          * Application should be cautious not to come into the infinite loop because the sent key to TV can come back to the application again according to the key table setting.
8037          *  
8038          * @param {Object} param
8039          * <ul>
8040          *   <li>{Number} param.virtualKeycode [Required] - virtual keycode defined in <a href="hcap.key.Code.html">hcap.key.Code</a>.</li>
8041          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8042          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8043          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
8044          *       // No parameter.
8045          *   }</pre>
8046          *   </li>
8047          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
8048          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8049          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8050          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8051          *   }</pre>
8052          *   </li>
8053          * </ul>
8054          *  
8055          * @since 1.3.1
8056          * 
8057          * @see
8058          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.addKeyItem">hcap.key.addKeyItem()</a><br>
8059          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.clearKeyTable">hcap.key.clearKeyTable()</a><br>
8060          * <a href="hcap.key.html#.removeKeyItem">hcap.key.removeKeyItem()</a>
8061          *
8062          * @example
8063          * hcap.key.sendKey({
8064          *      "virtualKeycode" : hcap.key.Code.MENU,
8065          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
8066          *          console.log("onSuccess");
8067          *      }, 
8068          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8069          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8070          *      }
8071          * });
8072          */
8073         hcap.key.sendKey = function (param) {
8074             param.virtualKeycode = hcap_key_table[param.virtualKeycode];
8075             hcap_command("send_key", param);
8076         };
8077         /**
8078          * @namespace hcap.mouse
8079          */
8080         hcap.mouse = {};
8081         /**
8082          * Checks whether the mouse pointer is visible or not. 
8083          *  
8084          * @param {Object} param
8085          * <ul>
8086          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8087          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8088          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
8089          *       // {Boolean} param.isVisible - true if the mouse pointer is visible, else false.
8090          *   }</pre>
8091          *   </li>
8092          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
8093          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8094          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8095          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8096          *   }</pre>
8097          *   </li>
8098          * </ul>
8099          *  
8100          * @since 1.3.1
8101          * 
8102          * @see
8103          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setMouseVisible">hcap.mouse.setMouseVisible()</a>
8104          *
8105          * @example
8106          * hcap.mouse.isMouseVisible({
8107          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
8108          *          console.log("onSuccess : mouse visible = " + s.isVisible);
8109          *      }, 
8110          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8111          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8112          *      }
8113          * });
8114          */
8115         hcap.mouse.isMouseVisible = function (param) {
8116             hcap_command("get_mouse_visible", param);
8117         };
8118         /**
8119          * Sets the mouse visibility.
8120          *  
8121          * @param {Object} param
8122          * <ul>
8123          *   <li>{Boolean} param.isVisible [Required] - true for mouse to be visible, else false.</li>
8124          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8125          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8126          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
8127          *       // No Parameter.
8128          *   }</pre>
8129          *   </li>
8130          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
8131          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8132          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8133          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8134          *   }</pre>
8135          *   </li>
8136          * </ul>
8137          *  
8138          * @since 1.3.1
8139          * 
8140          * @see
8141          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.isMouseVisible">hcap.mouse.isMouseVisible()</a>
8142          *
8143          * @example
8144          * hcap.mouse.setMouseVisible({
8145          *     "isVisible" : true,
8146          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
8147          *          console.log("onSuccess");
8148          *      }, 
8149          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8150          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8151          *      }
8152          * });
8153          */
8154         hcap.mouse.setMouseVisible = function (param) {
8155             hcap_command("set_mouse_visible", param);
8156         };
8157         /**
8158          * Checks whether the pointer of pointing devices (MMR) is on or off.<br>
8159          * Mouse visibility APIs (hcap.mouse.isMouseVisible, hcap.mouse.setMouseVisible) are for virtual arrow cursor of HCAP browser handled by RCU in the environment physical pointing devices are not support.<br>
8160          * But pointer APIs (hcap.mouse.isPointerOn, hcap.mouse.setPointerOn) are for real mouse pointer of physical pointing devices.<br>
8161          * 
8162          * @param {Object} param
8163          * <ul>
8164          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8165          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8166          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
8167          *       // {Boolean} param.isOn - true if the pointer is on, else false.
8168          *   }</pre>
8169          *   </li>
8170          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
8171          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8172          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8173          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8174          *   }</pre>
8175          *   </li>
8176          * </ul>
8177          *  
8178          * @since 1.19.0
8179          * 
8180          * @see
8181          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerOn">hcap.mouse.setPointerOn()</a>
8182          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.getPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition()</a>
8183          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition()</a>
8184          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.clickPointer">hcap.mouse.clickPointer()</a>
8185          *
8186          * @example
8187          * hcap.mouse.isPointerOn({
8188          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
8189          *          console.log("onSuccess : pointer on = " + s.isOn);
8190          *      }, 
8191          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8192          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8193          *      }
8194          * });
8195          */
8196         hcap.mouse.isPointerOn = function (param) {
8197             hcap_command("is_pointer_on", param);
8198         };
8199         /**
8200          * Switches on the pointer of pointing devices (MMR) or off.
8201          * 
8202          * @param {Object} param
8203          * <ul>
8204          *   <li>{Boolean} param.isOn [Required] - true for the pointer to be on, else false.</li>
8205          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8206          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8207          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
8208          *       // No Parameter.
8209          *   }</pre>
8210          *   </li>
8211          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
8212          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8213          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8214          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8215          *   }</pre>
8216          *   </li>
8217          * </ul>
8218          *  
8219          * @since 1.19.0
8220          * 
8221          * @see
8222          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.isPointerOn">hcap.mouse.isPointerOn()</a>
8223          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.getPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition()</a>
8224          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition()</a>
8225          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.clickPointer">hcap.mouse.clickPointer()</a>
8226          *
8227          * @example
8228          * hcap.mouse.setPointerOn({
8229          *     "isOn" : true,
8230          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
8231          *          console.log("onSuccess");
8232          *      }, 
8233          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8234          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8235          *      }
8236          * });
8237          */
8238         hcap.mouse.setPointerOn = function (param) {
8239             hcap_command("set_pointer_on", param);
8240         };
8241         /**
8242          * Gets the pointer position of pointing devices (MMR).<br>
8243          * The position is the coordinate in the HCAP OSD resolution (Property "display_resolution").
8244          * 
8245          * @param {Object} param
8246          * <ul>
8247          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8248          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8249          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
8250          *       // {Number} param.x - X coordiate of the pointer.
8251          *       // {Number} param.y - Y coordiate of the pointer.
8252          *   }</pre>
8253          *   </li>
8254          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
8255          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8256          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8257          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8258          *   }</pre>
8259          *   </li>
8260          * </ul>
8261          *  
8262          * @since 1.20.0
8263          * 
8264          * @see
8265          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.isPointerOn">hcap.mouse.isPointerOn()</a>
8266          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerOn">hcap.mouse.setPointerOn()</a>
8267          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition()</a>
8268          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.clickPointer">hcap.mouse.clickPointer()</a>
8269          *
8270          * @example
8271          * hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition({
8272          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
8273          *          console.log("onSuccess : pointer position (" + s.x + "," + s.y + ")");
8274          *      }, 
8275          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8276          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8277          *      }
8278          * });
8279          */
8280         hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition = function (param) {
8281             hcap_command("get_pointer_position", param);
8282         };
8283         /**
8284          * Sets the pointer position of pointing devices (MMR).<br>
8285          * The position is the coordinate in the HCAP OSD resolution (Property "display_resolution").
8286          * 
8287          * @param {Object} param
8288          * <ul>
8289          *   <li>{Number} param.x [Required] - X coordiate of the pointer.</li>
8290          *   <li>{Number} param.y [Required] - Y coordiate of the pointer.</li>
8291          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8292          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8293          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
8294          *       // No Parameter.
8295          *   }</pre>
8296          *   </li>
8297          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
8298          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8299          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8300          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8301          *   }</pre>
8302          *   </li>
8303          * </ul>
8304          *  
8305          * @since 1.20.0
8306          * 
8307          * @see
8308          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.isPointerOn">hcap.mouse.isPointerOn()</a>
8309          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerOn">hcap.mouse.setPointerOn()</a>
8310          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.getPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition()</a>
8311          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.clickPointer">hcap.mouse.clickPointer()</a>
8312          *
8313          * @example
8314          * hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition({
8315          *      "x" : 200,
8316          *      "y" : 100,
8317          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
8318          *          console.log("onSuccess");
8319          *      }, 
8320          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8321          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8322          *      }
8323          * });
8324          */
8325         hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition = function (param) {
8326             hcap_command("set_pointer_position", param);
8327         };
8328         /**
8329          * Clicks the pointer of pointing devices (MMR) in the current position.
8330          * 
8331          * @param {Object} param
8332          * <ul>
8333          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8334          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8335          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
8336          *       // No Parameter.
8337          *   }</pre>
8338          *   </li>
8339          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
8340          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8341          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8342          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8343          *   }</pre>
8344          *   </li>
8345          * </ul>
8346          *  
8347          * @since 1.20.0
8348          * 
8349          * @see
8350          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.isPointerOn">hcap.mouse.isPointerOn()</a>
8351          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerOn">hcap.mouse.setPointerOn()</a>
8352          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.getPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.getPointerPosition()</a>
8353          * <a href="hcap.mouse.html#.setPointerPosition">hcap.mouse.setPointerPosition()</a>
8354          *
8355          * @example
8356          * hcap.mouse.clickPointer({
8357          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
8358          *          console.log("onSuccess");
8359          *      }, 
8360          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8361          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8362          *      }
8363          * });
8364          */
8365         hcap.mouse.clickPointer = function (param) {
8366             hcap_command("click_pointer", param);
8367         };
8368         /**
8369          * Sets the pointer size of pointing devices (MMR).
8370          * 
8371          * @param {Object} param
8372          * <ul>
8373          *   <li>{Number} param.size [Required] - 1 for small size, 2 for middle size and 3 for large size.</li>
8374          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8375          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8376          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
8377          *       // No Parameter.
8378          *   }</pre>
8379          *   </li>
8380          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
8381          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8382          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8383          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8384          *   }</pre>
8385          *   </li>
8386          * </ul>
8387          *  
8388          * @since 1.19.0
8389          * 
8390          * @example
8391          * hcap.mouse.setPointerSize({
8392          *     "size" : 2,
8393          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
8394          *          console.log("onSuccess");
8395          *      }, 
8396          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8397          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8398          *      }
8399          * });
8400          */
8401         hcap.mouse.setPointerSize = function (param) {
8402             hcap_command("set_pointer_size", param);
8403         };
8404         /**
8405          * @namespace hcap.property
8406          */
8407         hcap.property = {};
8408         /**
8409          * Gets the current hotel mode settings.
8410          * 
8411          * @param {Object} param
8412          * <ul>
8413          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8414          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8415          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
8416          *       // {String} param.hotelMode - current hotel mode settings in JSON type.
8417          *       // '{
8418          *       //     "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable LG Hotel Mode operation or not. Default is "off" or not.
8419          *       //                        // If "enable" is "on",
8420          *       //                        // 1) Menu - General - "Reset to Initial Settings" and "Home/Store Mode" 
8421          *       //                        //    cannot be changed.
8422          *       //                        // 2) Scheduled recording is disabled. Guide menu - "Information", 
8423          *       //                        //    "Manual Timer" and "Play Key" are disappeared and are not worked. 
8424          *       //                        //    DVR-related progress bar, REC key and Play key are not worked.
8425          *       //                        // 3) External devices connected to TV (ex. Simplink) are worked according 
8426          *       //                        //    to the settings of "Hotel Mode Operation" - "Aux Source Settings" and
8427          *       //                        //    "Input Source Change".
8428          *       //                        // 4) Web browser is started in privacy mode. (Web history is not stored)
8429          *       //                        // 5) The functionality of LG Connect Apps is terminated.
8430          *       //                        // 6) Voice Recognition (Speak to TV) and Motion Gesture are not worked.
8431          *       //                        // 7) ECO (Energy Saving), 15 Min Auto Off and 2 Hour Off (On Timer) are 
8432          *       //                        //    deactivated.
8433          *       //                        // 8) When Hote Mode is On in DC On, the settings of ECO, 15 Min Auto Off 
8434          *       //                        //    and 2 Hour Off (On Timer) are restored. Then if Hotel Mode is Off 
8435          *       //                        //    after DC Off and DC On, previous settings are removed and default 
8436          *       //                        //    values are restored.
8437          *       //                        // 9) User Guide key is not worked.  
8438          *       //         "on" // enable hotel mode.
8439          *       //         "off" // disable hotel mode.
8440          *       //     "settings":{Object} { // Setting values to be applied when "enable" is "on".
8441          *       //         "powerOnStatus":{String}, // Determine the TV status when main power (AC) is on. Default is 
8442          *       //                                   // "std".
8443          *       //             "pwr" // make TV power-on status when AC is on. To make sure TV is able to be turned on, 
8444          *       //                   // if both "irOperation" and "localKeyOperation" are "blockAll", 
8445          *       //                   // settings.powerOnStatus will be changed to "pwr" automatically. 
8446          *       //             "std" // make TV stand-by status when AC is on. If "enable" is changed to "on",
8447          *       //                   // settings.powerOnStatus will be changed to "std" automatically.
8448          *       //             "lst" // make TV last power status when AC is on. AC is off in power-on status, AC is on, 
8449          *       //                   // and then TV will go back to power-on status. AC is off in stand-by status, AC 
8450          *       //                   // is on, and then TV will be in stand-by status.
8451          *       //         "volume":{Object}, { // Volume settings.
8452          *       //             "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable volume settings such as "Start Volume", 
8453          *       //                                // "Maximum Volume" and "Minimum Volume" or not. Default is "off".
8454          *       //                 "on" // enable volume settings.
8455          *       //                 "off" // disable volume settings.
8456          *       //             "settings":{Object}, { // Setting values to be applied when settings.volume.enable is "on".
8457          *       //                 "startVolume":{Object}, { // Start volume when TV is turned on.
8458          *       //                     "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable start volume or not. Default is "off".
8459          *       //                         "on" // enable start volume.
8460          *       //                         "off" // disable start volume.
8461          *       //                     "level":{Number} // start volume level (0 <= Min <= Start <= Max <= 100). 
8462          *       //                                      // Default is 0. This is worked when 
8463          *       //                                      // settings.volume.settings.startVolume.enable is "on". If "level"
8464          *       //                                      // is smaller than "minimumVolume", "minimumVolume" will be the 
8465          *       //                                      // start volume level. If "level" is bigger than "maximumVolume", 
8466          *       //                                      // "maximumVolume" will be the start volume level. 
8467          *       //                                      // 'On Timer'-related volume level is fixed with "level" when 
8468          *       //                                      // 'Public Display Mode'/'Hotel Mode Operation' are enabled.
8469          *       //                 }
8470          *       //                 "minimumVolume":{Number}, // Minimum volume level (0 <= Min <= Start <= Max <= 100). 
8471          *       //                                           // Default is 0. Setting a volume level smaller than 
8472          *       //                                           // "minimumVolume" will be ignored. If "minimumVolume" is 
8473          *       //                                           // set to bigger than the current volume level in the mute 
8474          *       //                                           // state, mute will be disabled.
8475          *       //                 "maximumVolume":{Number} // Maximum volume level (0 <= Min <= Start <= Max <= 100). 
8476          *       //                                          // Default is 100. Setting a volume level bigger than 
8477          *       //                                          // "maximumVolume" will be ignored. If "maximumVolume" is 
8478          *       //                                          // set to smaller than the current volume level in the mute 
8479          *       //                                          // state, mute will be disabled.
8480          *       //             }
8481          *       //         }
8482          *       //         "keyManagement":{Object}, { // Settings for the management of Local/Front key and Remote 
8483          *       //                                     // Control key.
8484          *       //             "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable IR Operation and Local Key Operation, or not. 
8485          *       //                                // Default is "off".
8486          *       //                 "on" // enable the key management.
8487          *       //                 "off" // disable the key management.
8488          *       //             "settings":{Object} { // Setting values to be applied when settings.keyManagement.enable
8489          *       //                                   // is "on".
8490          *       //                 "irOperation":{String}, // IR (Remote Control) key management. Default is "normal".
8491          *       //                     "normal" // block no IR key.
8492          *       //                     "usePwrOnly" // block all IR keys except the power key and service mode keys 
8493          *       //                                  // (In-Start, In-Stop, Power-Only, ADJ, Hotel-Mode, Hotel-Mode-Ready,
8494          *       //                                  // p-Check, S-Check, In-Time, FMode-Init, FMode-Start, FMode-AV, 
8495          *       //                                  // FMode-F1). And IR key combinations to enter Installation Menu and 
8496          *       //                                  // Special Menu (In-Start, EZ-Adjust, etc) are possible in 
8497          *       //                                  // "usePwrOnly" status. 
8498          *       //                     "blockAll" // block all IR keys except service mode keys (In-Start, In-Stop, 
8499          *       //                                // Power-Only, ADJ, Hotel-Mode, Hotel-Mode-Ready, p-Check, S-Check, 
8500          *       //                                // In-Time, FMode-Init, FMode-Start, FMode-AV, FMode-F1). And IR key 
8501          *       //                                // combinations to enter Installation Menu and Special Menu (In-Start,
8502          *       //                                // EZ-Adjust, etc) are possible in "blockAll" status.
8503          *       //                 "localKeyOperation":{String} // Local/Front key management. Default is "normal".
8504          *       //                     "normal" // block no Local/Front key.
8505          *       //                     "usePwrOnly" // block all Local/Front keys except the power key. Long press (3 secs)
8506          *       //                                  // of the Local/Front cross key is worked as the power key.
8507          *       //                     "blockAll" // block all Local/Front keys.
8508          *       //             }
8509          *       //         }
8510          *       //         "limitedMode":{Object}, { // Settings to limit TV functionalities.
8511          *       //             "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable settings.limitedMode.settings items or not. Default
8512          *       //                                // is "off". If settings.limitedMode.enable is "on", Screen Remote App 
8513          *       //                                // (123/Input key in MRCU) is not worked.
8514          *       //                 "on" // enable "limitedMode"
8515          *       //                 "off" // disable "limitedMode"
8516          *       //             "settings":{Object} { // Setting values to be applied when settings.limitedMode.enable is
8517          *       //                                   // "on".
8518          *       //                 "setupMenu":{String}, // Whether to permit to enter Setup (Channel) Menu or not.
8519          *       //                                       // Default is "on".
8520          *       //                     "on" // permit to enter Setup Menu.
8521          *       //                     "off" // prohibit from entering Setup Menu. Auto Tuning is not displayed in the
8522          *       //                           // channel change when the channel map is empty.
8523          *       //                 "programmeChange":{String}, // Whether to permit to change the channel or not. Default
8524          *       //                                             // is "on".
8525          *       //                     "on" // permit to change the channel and enter the channel menu.
8526          *       //                     "off" // prohibit from changing the channel. Channel-related keys (channel up/down, 
8527          *       //                           // number, guide, etc) channel menus (Setup Menu, etc) are disabled.
8528          *       //                           // Setting values in the menu 'On Time'-'Programme' are fixed.  
8529          *       //                 "menuDisplay":{String}, // Whether to permit to enter the menu or not. Default is "on".
8530          *       //                     "on" // permit to enter the menu.
8531          *       //                     "off" // prohibit from entering the menu. But it is possible to enter Installation
8532          *       //                           // Menu with press-and-hold of Menu key longer than 5 seconds. It is not
8533          *       //                           // permitted MRCU (Magic Remote Control Unit) via Bluetooth to control TV.
8534          *       //                 "osdDisplay":{String}, // Whether to display OSDs or not. Default is "on".
8535          *       //                     "on" // display OSDs.
8536          *       //                     "off" // All OSDs except Installation Menu, In Start Menu, Adjust and Power Only OSD
8537          *       //                           // are not displayed. Although Volume OSD is not displayed in "osdDisplay"
8538          *       //                           // "off", Volume OSD can be displayed with the property "volume_ui"-"1" by HCAP.
8539          *       //                           // MRCU cannot control TV. OSD is not displayed and settings cannot be changed
8540          *       //                           // for Ratio and Energysaving Hotkey.
8541          *       //                 "systemProviderMode":{String} // Whether to enable System Provider Mode or not. Default
8542          *       //                                               // is "off".
8543          *       //                     "on" // enable System Provider Mode in which Sound (Smart Sound Mode, Sound Mode, 
8544          *       //                          // Sound Effect, Volume Mode, Sound Out, DTV Audio Setting, AV Sync Adjustment,
8545          *       //                          // Sound Optimizer, Sound Test), Picture (Smart Picture Mode, Picture Mode 
8546          *       //                          // Settings, Energy Saving, Picture Test, 3D Picture Test, HDMI Ultra HD Deep 
8547          *       //                          // Color), Accessibility (Pointer Options, Video Description, Audio Description, 
8548          *       //                          // Audio Description Volume, Audio Guidance, Enlarge Focused Image, Hard of 
8549          *       //                          // Hearing, Teletext), General (Language, Location, Time & Date, Timers/Auto
8550          *       //                          // Power Off, Alarm/Timer Power On/Off, Standby Light, Home/Store Mode, Set ID,
8551          *       //                          // SIMPLINK, Reset to Initial Settings), Programmes (Programme Tuning,
8552          *       //                          // Programme Manager, Copy Programmes, Channel Plus, My Channels) are blocked.
8553          *       //                     "off" // disable System Provider Mode.
8554          *       //             }
8555          *       //         }
8556          *       //         "dtvProgrammeUpdate":{String}, { // Whether to update DTV channels automatically or not. Default
8557          *       //                                          // is "manual".
8558          *       //             "auto" // update the channel map according to the DTV channel stream.
8559          *       //             "manual" // maintain the channel map even though DTV channel information in the channel 
8560          *       //                      // stream is changed.
8561          *       //         }
8562          *       //         "powerOnDefault":{Object}, { // Settings for power-on. 
8563          *       //             "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable settings for the input, programme and AV settings 
8564          *       //                                // when TV is turned on (DC On) from AC On or stand-by, or not. Default
8565          *       //                                // is "off". If HCAP start channel is set, settings.powerOnDefault.enable
8566          *       //                                // will be "off" automatically, and then even though
8567          *       //                                // settings.powerOnDefault.enable is set to "on" again, HCAP start
8568          *       //                                // channel has higher priority than "powerOnDefault" settings.
8569          *       //                 "on" // enable power-on settings.
8570          *       //                 "off" // disable power-on settings.
8571          *       //             "settings":{Object} { // Setting values to be applied when settings.powerOnDefault.enable
8572          *       //                                   // is "on".
8573          *       //                 "input":{String}, // Change to the specified input source in the power-on. Default
8574          *       //                                   // is "off".
8575          *       //                     "off" // "input" is disabled.
8576          *       //                     "dtv" // Digital TV
8577          *       //                     "atv" // Analog TV
8578          *       //                     "catv" // Cable TV
8579          *       //                     "cadtv" // Cable DTV
8580          *       //                     "ca-radio" // Cable Radio
8581          *       //                     "sdtv" // Satellite DTV
8582          *       //                     "s-radio" // Satellite Radio
8583          *       //                     "scart" // SCART
8584          *       //                     "av1" // AV 1
8585          *       //                     "av2" // AV 2
8586          *       //                     "av3" // AV 3
8587          *       //                     "rgb" // RGB
8588          *       //                     "comp1" // Component 1
8589          *       //                     "comp2" // Component 2
8590          *       //                     "comp3" // Component 3
8591          *       //                     "hdmi1" // HDMI 1
8592          *       //                     "hdmi2" // HDMI 2
8593          *       //                     "hdmi3" // HDMI 3
8594          *       //                     "hdmi4" // HDMI 4
8595          *       //                 "programme":{String}, // If the external input in the power-on is TV, specify the 
8596          *       //                                       // programme in the power-on.
8597          *       //                 "avSetting":{String}, // Audio/Video setting. Default is "off".
8598          *       //                     "on" // restore internal Audio/Video setting values. The internal setting 
8599          *       //                          // values are not exposed.
8600          *       //                     "off" // disable internal Audio/Video settings in the power-on.
8601          *       //                 "aspectRatio":{String} // Aspect Ratio setting. Default is "disable".
8602          *       //                     "disable" // The last aspect ratio setting.
8603          *       //                     "original" // Automatic aspect ratio.
8604          *       //                     "4:3" // 4:3 aspect ratio.
8605          *       //                     "16:9" // 16:9 aspect ratio.
8606          *       //             }
8607          *       //         }
8608          *       //         "auxSourceSetting":{Object}, { // Auxiliary source settings
8609          *       //             "enable":{String}, Whether to enable aux source settings or not. Default is "off".
8610          *       //                 "on" // enable aux source settings. Only selected aux sources are enabled.
8611          *       //                 "off" // disable aux source setting. All available aux sources are enabled.
8612          *       //             "settings":{Array} [ // Setting values to be applied when settings.auxSourceSetting.enable
8613          *       //                                  // is "on".
8614          *       //                 "av1" // AV 1
8615          *       //                 "av2" // AV 2
8616          *       //                 "av3" // AV 3
8617          *       //                 "rgb" // RGB
8618          *       //                 "comp1" // Component 1
8619          *       //                 "comp2" // Component 2
8620          *       //                 "comp3" // Component 3
8621          *       //                 "hdmi1" // HDMI 1
8622          *       //                 "hdmi2" // HDMI 2
8623          *       //                 "hdmi3" // HDMI 3
8624          *       //                 "hdmi4" // HDMI 4
8625          *       //             ]
8626          *       //         }
8627          *       //         "powerManagement":{String}, // TV is turned off if there is no key input from the local, 
8628          *       //                                     // front or remote for the designated time since the last key 
8629          *       //                                     // input. Default is "off".
8630          *       //             "off" // disable "powerManagement".
8631          *       //             "1hour" // TV is turned off after 1 hour.
8632          *       //             "2hours" // TV is turned off after 2 hours.
8633          *       //             "3hours" // TV is turned off after 3 hours.
8634          *       //             "4hours" // TV is turned off after 4 hours.
8635          *       //             "5hours" // TV is turned off after 5 hours.
8636          *       //             "6hours" // TV is turned off after 6 hours.
8637          *       //             "7hours" // TV is turned off after 7 hours.
8638          *       //         "radioVideoBlank":{Object} // Settings for the video of DVB analog radio channels.
8639          *       //             "enable":{String}, // Whether to enable settings for the mute of the radio programme video.
8640          *       //                                // Default is "off".
8641          *       //                 "on" // enable the radio video mute setting.
8642          *       //                 "off" // disable the radio video mute setting.
8643          *       //             "settings":{Object} { // Setting values to be applied when settings.radioVideoBlank.enable
8644          *       //                                   // is "on".
8645          *       //                 "startOfRadioProgramme":{Number}, // 1 ~ 199. Default is 1. Make the 
8646          *       //                                                   // "countOfRadioProgramme" radio videos blank from 
8647          *       //                                                   // the channel of "startOfProgramme".
8648          *       //                 "countOfRadioProgramme":{Number} // 0 ~ 10. Default is 1. "startOfRadioProgramme" + 
8649          *       //                                                  // "countOfRadioProgramme" <= Max of the programme 
8650          *       //                                                  // number + 1. 0 means that none of radio programmes
8651          *       //                                                  // will not be video-mute.
8652          *       //     }
8653          *       // }' 
8654          *   }</pre>
8655          *   </li>
8656          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
8657          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8658          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8659          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8660          *   }</pre>
8661          *   </li>
8662          * </ul>
8663          * 
8664          * @see
8665          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.setHotelMode">hcap.property.setHotelMode()</a><br>
8666          * 
8667          * @since 1.20.0
8668          * 
8669          * @example
8670          * hcap.property.getHotelMode({
8671          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
8672          *          console.log("onSuccess : hotel mode settings = " + s.hotelMode);
8673          *      }, 
8674          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8675          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8676          *      }
8677          * });
8678          */
8679         hcap.property.getHotelMode = function (param) {
8680             hcap_command("get_hotel_mode", param);
8681         };
8682         /**
8683          * Sets the hotel mode.<br>
8684          * If this is called while Installation Menu is being shown, Installation Menu will be destroyed automatically.<br>
8685          * Reboot is strongly recommended after this call is succeeded because some changes in hotel mode requires reboot to be applied.  
8686          * 
8687          * @param {Object} param
8688          * <ul>
8689          *   <li>{Number} param.hotelMode [Required] - hotel mode settings to set. Now that hotelMode must have all items in the success callback parameter hotelMode of <a href="hcap.property.html#.getHotelMode">hcap.property.getHotelMode()</a>, we're strongly recommend to change the setting values based on the result of <a href="hcap.property.html#.getHotelMode">hcap.property.getHotelMode()</a>. If it misses some items, it'll be failed to set the hotel mode.</li>
8690          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8691          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8692          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
8693          *       // No Parameter.
8694          *   }</pre>
8695          *   </li>
8696          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
8697          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8698          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8699          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8700          *   }</pre>
8701          *   </li>
8702          * </ul>
8703          * 
8704          * @see
8705          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getHotelMode">hcap.property.getHotelMode()</a><br>
8706          * 
8707          * @since 1.20.0
8708          * 
8709          * @example
8710          * hcap.property.setHotelMode({
8711          *      "hotelMode" : "{ \
8712          *          'enable':'off', \
8713          *          'settings':{ \
8714          *              'powerOnStatus':'std', \
8715          *              'volume':{ \
8716          *                  'enable':'off', \
8717          *                  'settings':{ \
8718          *                      'startVolume':{ \
8719          *                          'enable':'off', \
8720          *                          'level':0 \
8721          *                      }, \
8722          *                      'minimumVolume':0, \
8723          *                      'maximumVolume':100 \
8724          *                  } \
8725          *              }, \
8726          *              'keyManagement':{ \
8727          *                  'enable':'off', \
8728          *                  'settings':{ \
8729          *                      'irOperation':'normal', \
8730          *                      'localKeyOperation':'normal' \
8731          *                  } \
8732          *              }, \
8733          *              'limitedMode':{ \
8734          *                  'enable':'off', \
8735          *                  'settings':{ \
8736          *                      'setupMenu':'on', \
8737          *                      'programmeChange':'on', \
8738          *                      'menuDisplay':'on', \
8739          *                      'osdDisplay':'on', \
8740          *                      'systemProviderMode':'off' \
8741          *                  } \
8742          *              }, \
8743          *              'dtvProgrammeUpdate':'manual', \
8744          *              'powerOnDefault': { \
8745          *                  'enable':'off', \
8746          *                  'settings':{ \
8747          *                      'input':'off', \
8748          *                      'programme':'2', \
8749          *                      'avSetting':'off', \
8750          *                      'aspectRatio':'disable' \
8751          *                  } \
8752          *              }, \
8753          *              'auxSourceSetting':{ \
8754          *                  'enable':'off', \
8755          *                  'settings':[ \
8756          *                      'av1', \
8757          *                      'comp1', \
8758          *                      'hdmi1', \
8759          *                      'hdmi2' \
8760          *                  ] \
8761          *              }, \
8762          *              'powerManagement':'off', \
8763          *              'radioVideoBlank':{ \
8764          *                  'enable':'off', \
8765          *                  'startOfRadioProgramme':1, \
8766          *                  'countOfRadioProgramme':1 \
8767          *              } \
8768          *          } \
8769          *      }",
8770          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
8771          *          console.log("onSuccess");
8772          *      }, 
8773          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8774          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8775          *      }
8776          * });
8777          */
8778         hcap.property.setHotelMode = function (param) {
8779             hcap_command("set_hotel_mode", param);
8780         };
8781         /** 
8782          * @namespace hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey
8783          */
8784         hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey = {
8785             /**
8786              * Backlight (0 ~ 100)
8787              * @since 1.6.0
8788              * @constant
8789              */
8790             BACKLIGHT : 1,
8791             /**
8792              * Contrast (0 ~ 100)
8793              * @since 1.6.0
8794              * @constant
8795              */
8796             CONTRAST : 2,
8797             /**
8798              * Brightness (0 ~ 100)
8799              * @since 1.6.0
8800              * @constant
8801              */
8802             BRIGHTNESS : 3,
8803             /**
8804              * Sharpness (0 ~ 100)
8805              * @since 1.6.0
8806              * @constant
8807              */
8808             SHARPNESS : 4,
8809             /**
8810              * Color (0 ~ 100), 0 : Black
8811              * @since 1.6.0
8812              * @constant
8813              */
8814             COLOR : 5,
8815             /**
8816              * Tint (0 ~ 100), 0 : Red, 100 : Green
8817              * @since 1.6.0
8818              * @constant
8819              */
8820             TINT : 6,
8821             /**
8822              * Color Temperature (0 ~ 100), 0 : Warm, 100 : Cold
8823              * @since 1.6.0
8824              * @constant
8825              */
8826             COLOR_TEMPERATURE : 7,
8827             /**
8828              * Aspect Ratio. Supported values depend on TV model.<br>
8829              * <ul>
8830              *   <li>1 : Normal Screen (4:3), Resizes images to the previous standard 4:3.</li>
8831              *   <li>2 : Wide (16:9), Resizes images to fit the screen width.</li>
8832              *   <li>3 : Horizon (Spectacle), Full Wide,  When TV receives the wide screen signal, it will let you adjust the picture horizontally or vertically, in a linear proportion, to fill the entire screen fully. 4:3 and 14:9 video are supported in full screen without any video distortion through DTV input. In Analog/DTV/AV/Scart mode, Full Wide is available.</li>
8833              *   <li>4 : Zoom, Resizes the image to fit the screen width. The top and bottom parts of the image may be cut off.</li>
8834              *   <li>6 : Original, Auto (Set by program), When your TV receives a wide screen signal, it will automatically change to the broadcasted picture format.</li>
