8835              *   <li>7 : 14:9, You can see the picture format of 14:9 or the general TV program in the 14:9 mode. The 14:9 screen is displayed in the same way as in 4:3, but is moved up or down.</li>
8836              *   <li>9 : Just Scan, Displays video images in the original size without removing parts of the edge of the image.</li>
8837              *   <li>10 : Cinema Zoom1, Choose Cinema Zoom when you want to enlarge the picture incorrect proportion.</li>
8838              * </ul>
8839              * 
8840              * @since 1.6.0
8841              * @constant
8842              */
8843             ASPECT_RATIO : 8
8844         };
8845         /**
8846          * Gets the picture property value for the current media input source.
8847          * 
8848          * @param {Object} param
8849          * <ul>
8850          *   <li>{Number} param.key [Required] - picture property key type. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey</a>.</li>
8851          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8852          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8853          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
8854          *       // {Number} param.value - picture property value of the requested property key. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey</a>.
8855          *   }</pre>
8856          *   </li>
8857          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
8858          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8859          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8860          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8861          *   }</pre>
8862          *   </li>
8863          * </ul>
8864          * 
8865          * @see
8866          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.BACKLIGHT">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.BACKLIGHT</a><br>
8867          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.CONTRAST">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.CONTRAST</a><br>
8868          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.BRIGHTNESS">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.BRIGHTNESS</a><br>
8869          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.SHARPNESS">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.SHARPNESS</a><br>
8870          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.COLOR">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR</a><br>
8871          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.TINT">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.TINT</a><br>
8872          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.COLOR_TEMPERATURE">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR_TEMPERATURE</a><br>
8873          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.ASPECT_RATIO">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.ASPECT_RATIO</a><br>
8874          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.setPictureProperty">hcap.property.setPictureProperty()</a><br>
8875          * 
8876          * @since 1.6.0
8877          * 
8878          * @example
8879          * hcap.property.getPictureProperty({
8880          *      "key" : hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR_TEMPERATURE,
8881          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
8882          *          console.log("onSuccess : property value = " + s.value);
8883          *      }, 
8884          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8885          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8886          *      }
8887          * });
8888          */
8889         hcap.property.getPictureProperty = function (param) {
8890             hcap_command("get_picture_property", param);
8891         };
8892         /**
8893          * Sets the picture property value for the current media input source.
8894          * 
8895          * @param {Object} param
8896          * <ul>
8897          *   <li>{Number} param.key [Required] - picture property key type. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey</a>.</li>
8898          *   <li>{Number} param.value [Required] - picture property value of the requested property key. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey</a>.</li>
8899          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
8900          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8901          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
8902          *       // No Parameter.
8903          *   }</pre>
8904          *   </li>
8905          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
8906          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
8907          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
8908          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
8909          *   }</pre>
8910          *   </li>
8911          * </ul>
8912          * 
8913          * @see
8914          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.BACKLIGHT">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.BACKLIGHT</a><br>
8915          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.CONTRAST">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.CONTRAST</a><br>
8916          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.BRIGHTNESS">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.BRIGHTNESS</a><br>
8917          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.SHARPNESS">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.SHARPNESS</a><br>
8918          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.COLOR">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR</a><br>
8919          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.TINT">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.TINT</a><br>
8920          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.COLOR_TEMPERATURE">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR_TEMPERATURE</a><br>
8921          * <a href="hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.html#.ASPECT_RATIO">hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.ASPECT_RATIO</a><br>
8922          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getPictureProperty">hcap.property.getPictureProperty()</a><br>
8923          * 
8924          * @since 1.6.0
8925          * 
8926          * @example
8927          * hcap.property.setPictureProperty({
8928          *      "key" : hcap.property.PicturePropertyKey.COLOR_TEMPERATURE,
8929          *      "value" : 10,
8930          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
8931          *          console.log("onSuccess");
8932          *      }, 
8933          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
8934          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
8935          *      }
8936          * });
8937          */
8938         hcap.property.setPictureProperty = function (param) {
8939             hcap_command("set_picture_property", param);
8940         };
8941         /**
8942          * @namespace hcap.property.PictureMode
8943          */
8944         hcap.property.PictureMode = {
8945             /**
8946              * Picture Mode : Vivid
8947              * @since 1.20.0
8948              * @constant
8949              */
8950             VIVID : 1,
8951             /**
8952              * Picture Mode : Standard
8953              * @since 1.20.0
8954              * @constant
8955              */
8956             STANDARD : 2,
8957             /**
8958              * Picture Mode : Eco
8959              * @since 1.20.0
8960              * @constant
8961              */
8962             ECO : 3,
8963             /**
8964              * Picture Mode : Cinema
8965              * @since 1.20.0
8966              * @constant
8967              */
8968             CINEMA : 4,
8969             /**
8970              * Picture Mode : Sports
8971              * @since 1.20.0
8972              * @constant
8973              */
8974             SPORTS : 5,
8975             /**
8976              * Picture Mode : Game
8977              * @since 1.20.0
8978              * @constant
8979              */
8980             GAME : 6,
8981             /**
8982              * Picture Mode : Photo
8983              * @since 1.20.0
8984              * @constant
8985              */
8986             PHOTO : 7,
8987             /**
8988              * Picture Mode : Expert (Bright Room)
8989              * @since 1.20.0
8990              * @constant
8991              */
8992             EXPERT_BRIGHT_ROOM : 8,
8993             /**
8994              * Picture Mode : Expert (Dark Room)
8995              * @since 1.20.0
8996              * @constant
8997              */
8998             EXPERT_DARK_ROOM : 9
8999         };
9000         /**
9001          * Gets the current picture mode.
9002          * 
9003          * @param {Object} param
9004          * <ul>
9005          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9006          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9007          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
9008          *       // {Number} param.mode - picture mode. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html">hcap.property.PictureMode</a>.
9009          *       // {Boolean} param.isUser - false when all picture property values are default in the picture mode, otherwise true.
9010          *   }</pre>
9011          *   </li>
9012          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
9013          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9014          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9015          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9016          *   }</pre>
9017          *   </li>
9018          * </ul>
9019          * 
9020          * @see
9021          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.VIVID">hcap.property.PictureMode.VIVID</a><br>
9022          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.STANDARD">hcap.property.PictureMode.STANDARD</a><br>
9023          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.ECO">hcap.property.PictureMode.ECO</a><br>
9024          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.CINEMA">hcap.property.PictureMode.CINEMA</a><br>
9025          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.SPORTS">hcap.property.PictureMode.SPORTS</a><br>
9026          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.GAME">hcap.property.PictureMode.GAME</a><br>
9027          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.PHOTO">hcap.property.PictureMode.PHOTO</a><br>
9028          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.EXPERT_BRIGHT_ROOM">hcap.property.PictureMode.EXPERT_BRIGHT_ROOM</a><br>
9029          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.EXPERT_DARK_ROOM">hcap.property.PictureMode.EXPERT_DARK_ROOM</a><br>
9030          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.setPictureMode">hcap.property.setPictureMode()</a><br>
9031          * 
9032          * @since 1.20.0
9033          * 
9034          * @example
9035          * hcap.property.getPictureMode({
9036          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
9037          *          console.log("onSuccess : picture mode = " + s.mode + ", is user = " + s.isUser);
9038          *      }, 
9039          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9040          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9041          *      }
9042          * });
9043          */
9044         hcap.property.getPictureMode = function (param) {
9045             hcap_command("get_picture_mode", param);
9046         };
9047         /**
9048          * Sets the picture mode.
9049          * 
9050          * @param {Object} param
9051          * <ul>
9052          *   <li>{Number} param.mode [Required] - picture mode. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html">hcap.property.PictureMode</a>.</li>
9053          *   <li>{Boolean} param.reset [Required] - true to reset all picture property values to default in the picture mode, otherwise false.</li>
9054          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9055          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9056          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9057          *       // No Parameter.
9058          *   }</pre>
9059          *   </li>
9060          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
9061          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9062          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9063          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9064          *   }</pre>
9065          *   </li>
9066          * </ul>
9067          * 
9068          * @see
9069          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.VIVID">hcap.property.PictureMode.VIVID</a><br>
9070          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.STANDARD">hcap.property.PictureMode.STANDARD</a><br>
9071          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.ECO">hcap.property.PictureMode.ECO</a><br>
9072          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.CINEMA">hcap.property.PictureMode.CINEMA</a><br>
9073          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.SPORTS">hcap.property.PictureMode.SPORTS</a><br>
9074          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.GAME">hcap.property.PictureMode.GAME</a><br>
9075          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.PHOTO">hcap.property.PictureMode.PHOTO</a><br>
9076          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.EXPERT_BRIGHT_ROOM">hcap.property.PictureMode.EXPERT_BRIGHT_ROOM</a><br>
9077          * <a href="hcap.property.PictureMode.html#.EXPERT_DARK_ROOM">hcap.property.PictureMode.EXPERT_DARK_ROOM</a><br>
9078          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getPictureMode">hcap.property.getPictureMode()</a><br>
9079          * 
9080          * @since 1.20.0
9081          * 
9082          * @example
9083          * hcap.property.setPictureMode({
9084          *      "mode" : hcap.property.PictureMode.VIVID,
9085          *      "reset" : true,
9086          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9087          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9088          *      }, 
9089          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9090          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9091          *      }
9092          * });
9093          */
9094         hcap.property.setPictureMode = function (param) {
9095             hcap_command("set_picture_mode", param);
9096         };
9097         /**
9098          * Gets the value of platform property. The property can be the TV specification values or user setting values. 
9099          *  
9100          * @param {Object} param
9101          * <ul>
9102          *   <li>{String} param.key [Required] - property key string.<br>
9103          *   <div>
9104          *     <table class="hcap_spec">
9105          *       <thead>
9106          *         <tr>
9107          *           <th>Key</th>
9108          *           <th>Description</th>
9109          *           <th>Read/Write</th>
9110          *           <th>Value Format</th>
9111          *           <th>Value example (default value for the predefined value set)</th>
9112          *         </tr>
9113          *       </thead>
9114          *       <tbody>
9115          *         <tr class="odd">
9116          *           <td>hcap_js_extension_version</td>
9117          *           <td class="left">Hcap js extension version of middleware</td>
9118          *           <td>Read</td>
9119          *           <td class="left">[version string]<br>free format string</td>
9120          *           <td>1.2.4.5</td>
9121          *         </tr>
9122          *         <tr>
9123          *           <td>hcap_middleware_version</td>
9124          *           <td class="left">Version of middleware</td>
9125          *           <td>Read</td>

9413          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9414          *           <td class="left">[string] free format string. Max length is 21. (Factory initial value is '[TV]serial_number'.)</td>
9415          *           <td>[TV]204</td>
9416          *         </tr>
9417          *         <tr class="odd">
9418          *           <td>instant_power</td>
9419          *           <td class="left">[since 1.6.0] specify the mode of instant power on.</td>
9420          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9421          *           <td class="left">[0|10|1|2] <br>0 : disable TV instant power on.
9422          *                                    <br>    At power off by <a href="hcap.power.html#.powerOff">hcap.power.powerOff()</a> and power key in RCU[Remote Control Unit] : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY.
9423          *                                    <br>    At power on by power key in RCU : STANDBY -> NORMAL.
9424          *                                    <br>    At reboot by <a href="hcap.power.html#.reboot">hcap.power.reboot()</a> : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> NORMAL.
9425          *                                    <br>    Power mode change NORMAL->WARM(WAIT) by <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a> is not supported.
9426          *                                    <br>    Power mode change WARM(WAIT)->NORMAL by <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a> is supported.
9427          *                                    <br>[since 1.19.0] 10 : keep TV turned on while AC power is applied.
9428          *                                    <br>    At power off by <a href="hcap.power.html#.powerOff">hcap.power.powerOff()</a> : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> NORMAL.
9429          *                                    <br>    At power off by power key in RCU : No effect.
9430          *                                    <br>    At power on by power key in RCU : No effect.
9431          *                                    <br>    [since 1.18.4] At reboot by <a href="hcap.power.html#.reboot">hcap.power.reboot()</a> : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> NORMAL.
9432          *                                    <br>    Power mode change NORMAL<->WARM(WAIT) by <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a> is not supported.
9433          *                                    <br>1 : enable TV instant power on.
9434          *                                    <br>    At power off by <a href="hcap.power.html#.powerOff">hcap.power.powerOff()</a> and power key in RCU : [NORMAL|WARM(WAIT)] -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> WARM(WAIT).
9435          *                                    <br>    At power on by power key in RCU : WARM(WAIT) -> NORMAL.
9436          *                                    <br>    [since 1.18.4] At reboot by <a href="hcap.power.html#.reboot">hcap.power.reboot()</a> : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> NORMAL. WARM(WAIT) -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> WARM(WAIT).
9437          *                                    <br>    Power mode change NORMAL<->WARM(WAIT) by <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a> is supported.
9438          *                                    <br>[since 1.9.0] 2 : enable TV instant power on.
9439          *                                    <br>    At power off by <a href="hcap.power.html#.powerOff">hcap.power.powerOff()</a> : [NORMAL|WARM(WAIT)] -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> WARM(WAIT).
9440          *                                    <br>    At power off by power key in RCU : NORMAL -> WARM(WAIT).
9441          *                                    <br>    At power on by power key in RCU : WARM(WAIT) -> NORMAL.
9442          *                                    <br>    [since 1.18.4] At reboot by <a href="hcap.power.html#.reboot">hcap.power.reboot()</a> : NORMAL -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> NORMAL. WARM(WAIT) -> WARM(UPDATE) -> STANDBY -> WARM(WAIT).
9443          *                                    <br>    Power mode change NORMAL<->WARM(WAIT) by <a href="hcap.power.html#.setPowerMode">hcap.power.setPowerMode()</a> is supported.
9444          *           </td>
9445          *           <td>0</td>
9446          *         </tr>
9447          *         <tr>
9448          *           <td>wol_w</td>
9449          *           <td class="left">[since 1.5.1] specifies TV power status when turning TV on from standby state by Wakeup Frame. Whether to support "wol_w" or not depends on TV models.</td>

9512          *           <td class="left">[since 1.10.0] determine whether to enable QR code and broadcast SSID, or not.</td>
9513          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9514          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : disable QR code and hide SSID.<br>1 : enable QR code and broadcast SSID.</td>
9515          *           <td>0</td>
9516          *         </tr>
9517          *         <tr>
9518          *           <td>dmr</td>
9519          *           <td class="left">[since 1.10.0] determine whether to enable DMR (Digital Media Renderer), or not.</td>
9520          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9521          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : disable DMR.<br>1 : enable DMR.</td>
9522          *           <td>0</td>
9523          *         </tr>
9524          *         <tr class="odd">
9525          *           <td>single_decoding</td>
9526          *           <td class="left">[since 1.13.0] determine whether the system is able to decode MPEG streams simultaneously, or not.</td>
9527          *           <td>Read</td>
9528          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : decode MPEG streams simultaneously.<br>1 : decode only one MPEG stream at a time.</td>
9529          *           <td>0</td>
9530          *         </tr>
9531          *         <tr>
9532          *           <td>browser_network_error_handling</td>
9533          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] deprecate the behavior of "1". TV doesn't support "1" anymore.<br>[since 1.14.0] determine whether the browser handles network error, or not.</td>
9534          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9535          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : when network error is occurred, notify network status change to the application and the browser has no action.<br>1 : when network error is occurred, the browser loads an error page for a while and tries to load the previous page. If the previous page can be loaded in off-line, the page will be loaded, or the browser will be destroyed. When pressing PORTAL key in the browser termination, TV tries to load initial page designated in xait.xml.</td>
9536          *           <td>1</td>
9537          *         </tr>
9538          *         <tr class="odd">
9539          *           <td>browser_https_security_level</td>
9540          *           <td class="left">[since 1.14.0] determine the https security level in browser.</td>
9541          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9542          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : use server authentication and session data encryption.<br>1 : only use session data encryption.</td>
9543          *           <td>1</td>
9544          *         </tr>
9545          *         <tr>
9546          *           <td>full_browser_start_page_url</td>
9547          *           <td class="left">[since 1.15.0] set the start page for the full browser.</td>
9548          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9549          *           <td class="left">[url string] <br>page url.</td>
9550          *           <td>http://lge.com/index.html</td>
9551          *         </tr>
9552          *         <tr class="odd">
9553          *           <td>maximum_volume_level</td>
9554          *           <td class="left">[since 1.15.0] set the maximum volume level. EU model only.</td>
9555          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9556          *           <td class="left">[number string] <br>0 ~ 100.</td>
9557          *           <td>100</td>
9558          *         </tr>
9559          *         <tr>
9560          *           <td>pcr_recovery</td>
9561          *           <td class="left">[since 1.15.0] determine whether to enable PCR recovery or not.</td>
9562          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9563          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : disable PCR recovery.<br>1 : enable PCR recovery.</td>
9564          *           <td>1</td>
9565          *         </tr>
9566          *         <tr class="odd">
9567          *           <td>mute_on_tv_input</td>
9568          *           <td class="left">[since 1.15.0] determine whether TV AV is mute or not, when selecting TV from another external input source.</td>
9569          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9570          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : TV AV is played.<br>1 : TV AV is mute.</td>
9571          *           <td>0</td>
9572          *         </tr>
9573          *         <tr>
9574          *           <td>soft_ap_ui</td>
9575          *           <td class="left">[since 1.16.0] determine whether to enable soft access point or not. "soft_ap" is working only when "soft_ap_ui" is enabled. "soft_ap" is reset to "0" whenever TV is rebooted or the power mode is changed from non-normal mode to normal mode if instant_power is enabled (1 or 2).</td>
9576          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9577          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : disable soft AP UI.<br>1 : enable soft AP UI.</td>
9578          *           <td>0</td>
9579          *         </tr>
9580          *         <tr class="odd">
9581          *           <td>soft_ap</td>
9582          *           <td class="left">[since 1.16.0] determine whether to enable soft access point or not. "soft_ap" is working only when "soft_ap_ui" is enabled. "soft_ap" is reset to "0" in the power off sequence (NORMAL -> WARM -> OFF). Soft AP configuration is stored even for "soft_ap" "0", and when "soft_ap" is "1", soft AP and VLAN is initialized with the stored configuration.</td>
9583          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9584          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : disable soft AP.<br>1 : enable soft AP.</td>
9585          *           <td>0</td>
9586          *         </tr>
9587          *         <tr>
9588          *           <td>soft_ap_password</td>
9589          *           <td class="left">[since 1.16.0] set the password of soft access point. Max length is 64.</td>
9590          *           <td>Write</td>
9591          *           <td class="left">[password string]<br>password.</td>
9592          *           <td>lge12345</td>
9593          *         </tr>
9594          *         <tr class="odd">
9595          *           <td>rs232c</td>
9596          *           <td class="left">[since 1.18.4] determine whether to enable RS232C (serial) communication by HCAP or not. Only when "rs232c" is "1", hcap.rs232c commands will be worked.</td>
9597          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9598          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : disable RS232C by HCAP.<br>1 : enable RS232C by HCAP.</td>
9599          *           <td>0</td>
9600          *         </tr>
9601          *         <tr>
9602          *           <td>https_xait_xml</td>
9603          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] determine whether to get remote xait.xml and remote zone.conf via http or https.</td>
9604          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9605          *           <td class="left">[0|1] <br>0 : access to http://[P:C Server IP]:[P:C Server Port]/procentric/application/xait.xml<br>1 : access to https://[P:C Server IP]:[P:C Server Port]/procentric/application/xait.xml</td>
9606          *           <td>0</td>
9607          *         </tr>
9608          *         <tr class="odd">
9609          *           <td>alternative_lg_service_xml</td>
9610          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] specify LGService.xml dynamically in EZ Installation.<br>
9611          *              If "alternative_lg_service_xml" doesn't exist or is empty string, download http://[Pro:Centric Server IP]:[Pro:Centric Server Port]/procentric/system/LGService.xml as it was.<br>
9612          *              If "alternative_lg_service_xml" exists and it starts with "http://" or "https://", download the value of "alternative_lg_service_xml".<br>
9613          *              If "alternative_lg_service_xml" exists and it doesn't start with "http://" and "https://", download http://[Pro:Centric Server IP]:[Pro:Centric Server Port]/procentric/system/["alternative_lg_service_xml" value].</td>
9614          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9615          *           <td class="left">[string]<br>file name or URL.</td>
9616          *           <td>""(empty string)</td>
9617          *         </tr>
9618          *         <tr>
9619          *           <td>alternative_url</td>
9620          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] specify an alternative url for HCAP HTML application.<br>
9621          *              If "alternative_url" doesn't exist or is empty string, HCAP HTML application designated in XAIT.xml will be launched.<br>
9622          *              Otherwise, HCAP HTML application specified in "alternative_url" will be launched.</td>
9623          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9624          *           <td class="left">[url string]<br>URL for HCAP HTML application.</td>
9625          *           <td>""(empty string)</td>
9626          *         </tr>
9627          *         <tr class="odd">
9628          *           <td>block_external_input</td>
9629          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] determine whether to block the external input port or not.</td>
9630          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9631          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : allow all external input port.<br>1 : block all external input port.</td>
9632          *           <td>0</td>
9633          *         </tr>
9634          *         <tr>
9635          *           <td>block_ir</td>
9636          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] determine whether to block the IR key (except exclusive factory RCU keys) input or not. If "block_local_key" is "2", setting "block_ir" to "2" will be failed. That is, at least one of IR power key or local power key should be worked.</td>
9637          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9638          *           <td class="left">[0|1|2]<br>0 : allow all IR input.<br>1 : block all IR input except Power key.<br>2 : block all IR input.</td>

9640          *         </tr>
9641          *         <tr class="odd">

9644          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9645          *           <td class="left">[0|1|2]<br>0 : allow all local keys.<br>1 : block all local keys except power key.<br>2 : block all local keys.</td>
9646          *           <td>0</td>
9647          *         </tr>
9648          *         <tr>
9649          *           <td>block_usb</td>

9660          *           <td>1234</td>
9661          *         </tr>

9672          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9673          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : allow the launcher.<br>1 : block the launcher.</td>
9674          *           <td>0</td>
9675          *         </tr>

9678          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] determine whether to make PORTAL/GUIDE/INFO keys hot keys in webOS TV or not. If they are hot keys, HCAP application will always get focused automatically by TV and hot keys will be delivered to HCAP application. If they are not hot keys, focus will not be changed and the keys will be delivered to HCAP application.</td>
9679          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9680          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : PORTAL/GUIDE/INFO keys are hot keys.<br>1 : PORTAL/GUIDE/INFO keys are not hot keys.</td>
9681          *           <td>0</td>
9682          *         </tr>

9685          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] determine whether to display the external clock or not.</td>

9687          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : the external clock is not displayed.<br>1 : the external clock is displayed.</td>
9688          *           <td>1</td>
9689          *         </tr>

9697          *         <tr class="odd">

9700          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9701          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : TV permits pairing with MMR anytime as before.<br>1 : TV permits pairing with MMR only when installation menu is focused.</td>
9702          *           <td>0</td>

9705          *           <td>dial</td>
9706          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] determine whether to enable DIAL or not.</td>
9707          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9708          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : disable DIAL.<br>1 : enable DIAL.</td>
9709          *           <td>0</td>
9710          *         </tr>
9711          *         <tr class="odd">
9712          *           <td>alljoyn</td>
9713          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] determine whether to enable AllJoyn or not.</td>
9714          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9715          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : disable AllJoyn.<br>1 : enable AllJoyn.</td>
9716          *           <td>0</td>
9717          *         </tr>
9718          *         <tr>
9719          *           <td>clock_source</td>
9720          *           <td class="left">[since 1.19.0] set the clock source.</td>
9721          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9722          *           <td class="left">[off|pro:centric|tv|ntp|admin]<br>off : update the clock time for all clock sources.
9723          *                                                          <br>pro:centric : update the clock time only for the Pro:Centric data channel time.
9724          *                                                          <br>tv : update the clock time only for the TV channel time.
9725          *                                                          <br>ntp : update the clock time only for the NTP (Network Time Protocol) server time.
9726          *                                                          <br>admin : update the clock time only for the time requested by <a href="hcap.time.html#.setLocalTime">hcap.time.setLocalTime()</a>. If <a href="hcap.time.html#.setLocalTime">hcap.time.setLocalTime()</a> is called in the other clock source than "admin", "clock_source" will be changed to "admin" automatically.</td>
9727          *           <td>off : when Pro:Centric is OFF.<br>
9728          *               pro:centric : when Pro:Centric is enabled.</td>
9729          *         </tr>
9730          *         <tr class="odd">
9731          *           <td>xait_version</td>
9732          *           <td class="left">[since 1.20.0] xait version in the local xait.xml</td>
9733          *           <td>Read</td>
9734          *           <td class="left">[number string] <br>number format string</td>
9735          *           <td></td>
9736          *         </tr>
9737          *         <tr>
9738          *           <td>asl_mode</td>
9739          *           <td class="left">[since 1.20.1] Whether ASL(Application Side Loading) mode is supported, or not.</td>
9740          *           <td>Read</td>
9741          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : ASL mode is disabled.<br>1 : ASL mode is enabled.</td>
9742          *           <td>0</td>
9743          *         </tr>
9744          *         <tr class="odd">
9745          *           <td>screensaver_control</td>
9746          *           <td class="left">[since 1.20.1] Indicates who is in charge of handling the screensaver.</td>
9747          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9748          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : The Pro:Centric platform is in charge of starting and ending a screensaver.<br>1 : HCAP Application is in charge of starting and ending a screensaver. <a href="_global_.html#event:screensaver_event_received">screensaver_event_received()</a> is provided for implementing screensaver by HCAP Application.</td>
9749          *           <td>0</td>
9750          *         </tr>
9751          *         <tr>
9752          *           <td>rms_trusted_ip</td>

9761          *           <td>Read</td>
9762          *           <td class="left">[number string] <br>number format string</td>
9763          *           <td></td>
9764          *         </tr>
9765          *         <tr>
9766          *           <td>input_splash_image</td>
9767          *           <td class="left">[since 1.23.0] determine whether to enable splash image or not.</td>
9768          *           <td>Read/Write</td>
9769          *           <td class="left">[0|1]<br>0 : disable splash image.<br>1 : enable splash image.</td>
9770          *           <td>1</td>
9771          *         </tr>
9772          *       </tbody>
9773          *       <tfoot>
9774          *         <tr><th colspan="5">HCAP Property</td></tr>
9775          *       </tfoot>
9776          *     </table>
9777          *   </div>
9778          *   </li>
9779          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
9780          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9781          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
9782          *       // {String} param.value - property value.
9783          *   }</pre>
9784          *   </li>
9785          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9786          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9787          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9788          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9789          *   }</pre>
9790          *   </li>
9791          * </ul>
9792          *  
9793          * @since 1.3.1
9794          * 
9795          * @see
9796          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.setProperty">hcap.property.setProperty()</a><br>
9797          * <a href="_global_.html#event:property_changed">{Event} property_changed</a>
9798          *
9799          * @example
9800          * hcap.property.getProperty({
9801          *      "key" : "model_name",
9802          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
9803          *          console.log("onSuccess : property value = " + s.value);
9804          *      }, 
9805          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9806          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9807          *      }
9808          * });
9809          */
9810         hcap.property.getProperty = function (param) {
9811             hcap_command("get_property", param);
9812         };
9813         /**
9814          * Sets a platform property.
9815          * Please refer to writable property key and value in <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a>.
9816          *
9817          * @param {Object} param
9818          * <ul>
9819          *   <li>{String} param.key [Required] - property key to be set.</li>
9820          *   <li>{String} param.value [Required] - property value to be set.</li>
9821          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.<br>
9822          *       Setting to the same value for the key as before will invoke this callback function.
9823          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9824          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
9825          *       // No parameter.
9826          *   }</pre>
9827          *   </li>
9828          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
9829          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
9830          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
9831          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
9832          *   }</pre>
9833          *   </li>
9834          * </ul>
9835          *  
9836          * @since 1.3.1
9837          * 
9838          * @see
9839          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getProperty">hcap.property.getProperty()</a><br>
9840          * <a href="_global_.html#event:property_changed">{Event} property_changed</a>
9841          *
9842          * @example
9843          * hcap.property.setProperty({
9844          *      "key" : "tv_volume_ui", 
9845          *      "value" : "0", 
9846          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
9847          *          console.log("onSuccess");
9848          *      }, 
9849          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
9850          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
9851          *      }
9852          * });
9853          */
9854         hcap.property.setProperty = function (param) {
9855             hcap_command("set_property", param);
9856         };
9857         /** 
9858          * @namespace hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem
9859          */
9860         hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem = {
9861             /**
9862              * Password type of installer menu enterance. (0 ~ 3)
9863              * @since 1.22.0
9864              * @constant
9865              */
9866             INSTALLER_SEQ : 0,
9867             /**
9868              * Sets number of hours of no activity before automatic shut off. (0 ~ 7)
9869              * @since 1.22.0
9870              * @constant
9871              */
9872             POWER_MANAGE : 1,
9873             /**
9874              * Set to 1 to enable Auto Turn ON when AC power is applied. (0 ~ 3)
9875              * @since 1.22.0
9876              * @constant
9877              */
9878             AC_ON : 2,
9879             /**
9880              * Selects Tuning Band: 0=Broadcast, 1=CATV, 2=HRC, 3=IRC. (0 ~ 3)
9881              * @since 1.22.0
9882              * @constant
9883              */
9884             BAND : 3,
9885             /**
9886              * Channel tuned when TV is turned ON. (Set to 255 to tune to channel tuned before TV turned OFF.) (0 ~ 127, 253, 255)
9887              * @since 1.22.0
9888              * @constant
9889              */
9890             STRT_CHANNEL : 4,
9891             /**
9892              * If set to 1, cannot tune from current channel. (0 / 1)
9893              * @since 1.22.0
9894              * @constant
9895              */
9896             CHAN_LOCK : 5,
9897             /**
9898              * Volume level when TV is turned ON. (Set to 255 to use volume level before TV turned OFF.) (0 ~ 63, 255)
9899              * @since 1.22.0
9900              * @constant
9901              */
9902             STRT_VOLUME : 7,
9903             /**
9904              * Sets minimum allowable volume setting. (0 ~ 63)
9905              * @since 1.22.0
9906              * @constant
9907              */
9908             MIN_VOLUME : 8,
9909             /**
9910              * Sets maximum allowable volume setting. (0 ~ 63)
9911              * @since 1.22.0
9912              * @constant
9913              */
9914             MAX_VOLUME : 9,
9915             /**
9916              * Set to 1 to disable Mute Function. (0 / 1)
9917              * @since 1.22.0
9918              * @constant
9919              */
9920             MUTE_DISABLE : 10,
9921             /**
9922              * Set to 1 to disable menu navigation keys on display panel. (0 / 1)
9923              * @since 1.22.0
9924              * @constant
9925              */
9926             KEY_DEFEAT : 11,
9927             /**
9928              * Set to 1 to enable bank descrete IR dode. (0 / 1)
9929              * @since 1.22.0
9930              * @constant
9931              */
9932             IR_BANKS_ENABLE : 12,
9933             /**
9934              * Set to 1 to enable TV ON when channel up/down key is pressed. (0 / 1)
9935              * @since 1.22.0
9936              * @constant
9937              */
9938             SCAN_MODE : 13,
9939             /**
9940              * Set to 1 to use start channel for channnel map pivot point at Scan Mode. (0 / 1)
9941              * @since 1.22.0
9942              * @constant
9943              */
9944             STRT_CH_IN_SM : 14,
9945             /**
9946              * Set to 1 to enable Sleep Timer. (0 / 1)
9947              * @since 1.22.0
9948              * @constant
9949              */
9950             SLEEP_TIMER : 15,
9951             /**
9952              * Set to 1 to enable On/Off Timers. (0 / 1)
9953              * @since 1.22.0
9954              * @constant
9955              */
9956             EN_TIMER : 16,
9957             /**
9958              * Set to 1 to enable Alarm. (0 / 1)
9959              * @since 1.22.0
9960              * @constant
9961              */
9962             ALARM : 17,
9963             /**
9964              * Determines an additional IR code scheme to which the TV will respond. (0, 16 ~ 24, 64 ~ 65)
9965              * @since 1.22.0
9966              * @constant
9967              */
9968             FEATURE_LEVEL : 20,
9969             /**
9970              * Set to 1 to enable V-Chip (Parental Control) functions. (0 / 1)
9971              * @since 1.22.0
9972              * @constant
9973              */
9974             V_CHIP : 21,
9975             /**
9976              * Sets number of V-Chip blocking hours. (0 ~ 99)
9977              * @since 1.22.0
9978              * @constant
9979              */
9980             MAX_BLK_HRS : 22,
9981             /**
9982              * Set to 1 to retain caption setting set before TV turned OFF. (0 / 1)
9983              * @since 1.22.0
9984              * @constant
9985              */
9986             CAPTION_LOCK : 23,

9989              * @since 1.22.0
9990              * @constant
9991              */
9992             FUNCTION_PRE : 25,
9993             /**
9994              * Pillow speaker selection menu. (0 ~162, 254)
9995              * @since 1.22.0
9996              * @constant
9997              */
9998             HOSPITAL_MODE : 27,
9999             /**
10000              * If set to 0, limits direct access to favorite channels. (0 / 1)

10002              * @constant

10004             CH_OVERIDE : 28,
10005             /**
10006              * Set to 1 to remap the PTC's direct tune channels for Aux inputs from 13xto 9x. (0 / 1)

10010             REMAP_AUX_INPS : 29,

10028             TIMING_PULSE : 32,
10029             /**
10030              *

10034             COMPORT_EN : 34,

10038              * @constant
10039              */
10040             HDMI1_ENABLE : 35,

10104              * @constant
10105              */
10106             CH_NOT_AVBLE : 73,

10113             /**
10114              * Quick shutoff. (0 ~ 17)
10115              * @since 1.22.0
10116              * @constant
10117              */
10118             QUICK_SHUTOFF : 77,
10119             /**
10120              * User programmable number, most significant byte. (0 ~ 255)

10122              * @constant
10123              */
10124             UPN_MSB : 78,

10126              * User programmable number, most significant byte - 1. (0 ~ 255)

10130             UPN_MSB_1 : 79,

10134              * @constant
10135              */
10136             UPN_MSB_2 : 80,
10137             /**
10138              * User programmable number, least significant byte. (0 ~ 255)

10140              * @constant
10141              */
10142             UPN_LSB : 81,
10143             /**

10145              * @since 1.22.0
10146              * @constant
10147              */
10148             CHKSUM_ERROR : 82,

10152              * @constant

10154             HANDSHK_TIME : 83,

10172             REAR_RGB_EN : 87,

10178             EN_NOISE_MUTE : 88,

10181              * @since 1.22.0
10182              * @constant

10184             KEY_LOCK : 90,

10200              * @constant
10201              */
10202             RJP_AVAILABLE : 93,
10203             /**

10207              */
10208             SAP_MENU_EN : 94,
10209             /**

10226             PROCENTRIC : 98,

10267              */
10268             VID_OUT_FORMAT : 105,

10350              * @constant

10352             DATA_CHANNEL : 119,

10355              * @since 1.22.0
10356              * @constant
10357              */
10358             UPDATE_TIME_HR : 121,
10359             /**
10360              * Sets the minute for Wake On RF. (0 ~ 59, 255)
10361              * @since 1.22.0
10362              * @constant
10363              */
10364             UPDATE_TIME_MN : 122
10365         };
10366         /**
10367          * Gets the current value of installer menu item.
10368          * 
10369          * @param {Object} param
10370          * <ul>
10371          *   <li>{Number} param.key [Required] - installer menu item type. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem.html">hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem</a>.</li>
10372          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
10373          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10374          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
10375          *       // {Number} param.value - installer menu item value of the requested type. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem.html">hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem</a>.
10376          *   }</pre>
10377          *   </li>
10378          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10379          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10380          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10381          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10382          *   }</pre>
10383          *   </li>
10384          * </ul>
10385          * 
10386          * @see
10387          * <a href="hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem.html">hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem</a><br>
10388          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.setInstallerMenuItem">hcap.property.setInstallerMenuItem()</a><br>
10389          * 
10390          * @since 1.22.0
10391          * 
10392          * @example
10393          * hcap.property.getInstallerMenuItem({
10394          *      "key" : hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem.INSTALLER_SEQ,
10395          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
10396          *          console.log("onSuccess : property value = " + s.value);
10397          *      }, 
10398          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10399          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10400          *      }
10401          * });
10402          */
10403         hcap.property.getInstallerMenuItem = function (param) {
10404             hcap_command("get_installer_menu_item", param);
10405         };
10406         /**
10407          * Sets the installer menu item value.
10408          * 
10409          * @param {Object} param
10410          * <ul>
10411          *   <li>{Number} param.key [Required] - installer menu item type. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem.html">hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem</a>.</li>
10412          *   <li>{Number} param.value [Required] - picture property value of the requested type. Please refer to <a href="hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem.html">hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem</a>.</li>
10413          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
10414          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10415          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
10416          *       // No Parameter.
10417          *   }</pre>
10418          *   </li>
10419          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10420          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10421          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10422          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10423          *   }</pre>
10424          *   </li>
10425          * </ul>
10426          * 
10427          * @see
10428          * <a href="hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem.html">hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem</a><br>
10429          * <a href="hcap.property.html#.getInstallerMenuItem">hcap.property.getInstallerMenuItem()</a><br>
10430          * 
10431          * @since 1.22.0
10432          * 
10433          * @example
10434          * hcap.property.setInstallerMenuItem({
10435          *      "key" : hcap.property.InstallerMenuItem.INSTALLER_SEQ,
10436          *      "value" : 1,
10437          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
10438          *          console.log("onSuccess");
10439          *      }, 
10440          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10441          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10442          *      }
10443          * });
10444          */
10445         hcap.property.setInstallerMenuItem = function (param) {
10446             hcap_command("set_installer_menu_item", param);
10447         };
10448         /**
10449          * @namespace hcap.Media
10450          */
10451         /**
10452          * Interface for displaying and controlling the playback of media on the TV.
10453          * This class is not to be constructed directly (by user code).
10454          * hcap.Media has a change of status as follows.
10455          * <br><image src="./image/media_status.jpg">
10456          * @class
10457          * @see
10458          * <a href="hcap.html#.createMedia">hcap.Media.createMedia()</a><br>
10459          */
10460         hcap.Media = function () {};
10461         /**
10462          * Starts up media channel which is one of input source on TV. So you should call this method before making hcap.Media object.
10463          * And you should call hcap.Media.shutDown() after invoking hcap.Media.destroy() for finalizing media channel.
10464          * 
10465          * @param {Object} param 
10466          * <ul>
10467          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function. <br>
10468          *   If a media channel starts up, this callback function will be invoked.
10469          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10470          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
10471          *       // No parameter.
10472          *   }</pre>
10473          *   </li>
10474          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10475          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10476          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10477          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10478          *   }</pre>
10479          *   </li>
10480          * </ul>
10481          *
10482          *
10483          *
10484          * @since 1.8
10485          *
10486          * @see
10487          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#.shutDown">hcap.Media.shutDown()</a><br>
10488          * 
10489          * @example
10490          * hcap.Media.startUp({
10491          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
10492          *          console.log("onSuccess");
10493          *      }, 
10494          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10495          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10496          *      }
10497          * });
10498          */
10499         hcap.Media.startUp = function (param) {
10500             hcap_command("media_startup", param);
10501         };
10502         /**
10503          * Shuts down media channel. 
10504          * You should call hcap.Media.shutDown() after invoking hcap.Media.destroy() if there is no more need to use media player. 
10505          * After this method is invoked, TV input will be changed to last configuration without any notification.
10506          * 
10507          * @param {Object} param 
10508          * <ul>
10509          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function. <br>
10510          *   If a media channel shuts down, this callback function will be invoked.
10511          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10512          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
10513          *       // No parameter.
10514          *   }</pre>
10515          *   </li>
10516          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10517          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10518          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10519          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10520          *   }</pre>
10521          *   </li>
10522          * </ul>
10523          *
10524          *
10525          * @since 1.8
10526          *
10527          * @see
10528          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#.startUp">hcap.Media.startUp()</a><br>
10529          * 
10530          * @example
10531          * hcap.Media.startUp({
10532          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
10533          *          console.log("onSuccess");
10534          *          var media = hcap.Media.createMedia({
10535          *              "url" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.avi", 
10536          *              "mimeType" : "video/mp4"
10537          *          });
10538          *          media.play({
10539          *              "onSuccess" : function() {
10540          *                  console.log("onSuccess");
10541          *                  media.stop({
10542          *                      "onSuccess" : function() {
10543          *                          console.log("onSuccess");
10544          *                          media.destroy({
10545          *                              "onSuccess" : function() {
10546          *                                  console.log("onSuccess");
10547          *                                  hcap.Media.shutDown({
10548          *                                      "onSuccess" : function() {
10549          *                                          console.log("onSuccess");
10550          *                                      }, 
10551          *                                      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10552          *                                          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10553          *                                      }
10554          *                                  });
10555          *                              }, 
10556          *                              "onFailure" : function(f) {
10557          *                                  console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10558          *                              }
10559          *                          });
10560          *                      },
10561          *                      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10562          *                          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10563          *                      }
10564          *                  });
10565          *              }, 
10566          *              "onFailure" : function(f) {
10567          *                  console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10568          *              }
10569          *          });
10570          *      },
10571          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10572          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10573          *      }
10574          * });
10575          */
10576         hcap.Media.shutDown = function (param) {
10577             hcap_command("media_shutdown", param);
10578         };
10579         /**
10580          * Create Media object.
10581          * The Media object provides the ability to play back video files and stream on a device.
10582          * <br/>
10583          * If an object is passed to the settings parameter, the function should try to initialize the internal
10584          * media player with the provided settings. If successful, the function should return an instance of
10585          * hcap.Media with a standardized interface for the internal media player. If the functions fails
10586          * to instantiate the internal media player to a playable state for any reason (such as media not found 
10587          * or supported, or only one media player supported at a time), then the function should return null.<br/>
10588          * <br/>
10589          * If no object is passed to the settings parameter, then the function should return the last
10590          * non-destroyed hcap.Media instance, or null if there are no active media players.<br/>
10591          *
10592          * @param {Object} param 
10593          * <ul>
10594          *   <li>{String} param.url [Required] - media url. As of API, the following protocols should be accepted.</li>
10595          * <div align=center>
10596          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=400>
10597          *   <thead><tr><th>url</th></tr></thead>
10598          *   <tbody>
10599          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="odd">RTSP - (rtsp://1.2.3.4:554/video.mp4)</th></tr>
10600          *     <tr><th>HTTP - (http://lge.com/movie.mp4)</th></tr>
10601          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="odd">FILE - (file:///tmp/usb/usb1/example.mp4)</th></tr>
10602          *   </tbody>
10603          * </table>
10604          * </div>
10605          *   <li>{String} param.mimeType [Required] - video mime type. please refer to table below.</li>
10606          * <div align=center>
10607          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=400>
10608          *   <thead><tr><th>mimeType</th></tr></thead>
10609          *   <tbody>
10610          *       <tr class="odd"><th>'audio/x-ms-wma'</th></tr>
10611          *       <tr><th>'audio/mpeg'</th></tr>
10612          *       <tr class="odd"><th>'audio/mp3'</th></tr>
10613          *       <tr><th>'video/mp4'</th></tr>
10614          *       <tr class="odd"><th>'video/mpeg4'</th></tr>
10615          *       <tr><th>'video/x-m4v'</th></tr>
10616          *       <tr class="odd"><th>'video/mpeg'</th></tr>
10617          *       <tr><th>'video/x-ms-wmv'</th></tr>
10618          *       <tr class="odd"><th>'video/x-ms-asf'</th></tr>
10619          *       <tr><th>'video/x-msvideo'</th></tr>
10620          *       <tr class="odd"><th>'video/x-flv'</th></tr>
10621          *       <tr><th>'application/x-mpegURL' (HTTP supports only)</th></tr>
10622          *   </tbody>
10623          * </table>
10624          * </div>
10625          * <li>{String} param.subtitleUrl [Optional] - subtitle url. As of API, the following protocols should be accepted.</li>
10626          * <div align=center>
10627          * <table class="hcap_spec" width=400>
10628          *   <thead><tr><th>subtitleUrl</th></tr></thead>
10629          *   <tbody>
10630          *     <tr class="odd"><th class="odd">HTTP - (http://lge.com/movie.smi)</th></tr>
10631          *   </tbody>
10632          * </table>
10633          * </div>
10634          * </ul>
10635          *
10636          * @return {Object} hcap.Media
10637          *
10638          * @since 1.3.1
10639          *
10640          * @see
10641          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#play">hcap.Media.play()</a><br>
10642          * 
10643          * @example
10644          * hcap.Media.startUp({
10645          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
10646          *          console.log("onSuccess");
10647          *          var media = hcap.Media.createMedia({
10648          *              "url" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.avi", 
10649          *              "mimeType" : "video/mp4",
10650          *              "subtitleUrl" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.smi"
10651          *          });
10652          *      },
10653          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10654          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10655          *      }
10656          * });
10657          */
10658         hcap.Media.createMedia = function (param) {
10659             if (param === null) {
10660                 return media_object;
10661             }
10662             if (media_object === null && param.url !== null && param.mimeType !== null) {
10663                 media_object = new hcap.Media();
10664                 hcap_command("media_create_media", param);
10665                 return media_object;
10666             }
10667             return null;
10668         };
10669         /**
10670          * Starts playing a media file or stream.
10671          * If the media file starts to play, then 'play_start' event will be invoked.
10672          * @param {Object} param 
10673          * <ul>
10674          *   <li>{Number} param.repeatCount [Optional] - repeat count. Default setting value is 1. If you want to play a media stream in infinite loop, set 0. </li>
10675          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function. <br>
10676          *   If a media is played already, this callback function will be invoked.
10677          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10678          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
10679          *       // No parameter.
10680          *   }</pre>
10681          *   </li>
10682          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10683          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10684          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10685          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10686          *   }</pre>
10687          *   </li>
10688          * </ul>
10689          *
10690          * @since 1.3.1
10691          * @since 1.8 repeatCount
10692          *
10693          * @see
10694          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#stop">hcap.Media.stop()</a><br>
10695          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#pause">hcap.Media.pause()</a><br>
10696          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#resume">hcap.Media.resume()</a><br>     
10697          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#destroy">hcap.Media.destroy()</a><br>        
10698          *  <a href="_global_.html#event:media_event_received">media_event_received</a><br>
10699          * @example
10700          * hcap.Media.startUp({
10701          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
10702          *          console.log("onSuccess");
10703          *          var media = hcap.Media.createMedia({
10704          *              "url" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.avi", 
10705          *              "mimeType" : "video/mp4", 
10706          *              "subtitleUrl" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.smi"
10707          *          });
10708          *          media.play({
10709          *              "repeatCount" : 2,
10710          *              "onSuccess" : function() {
10711          *                  console.log("onSuccess");
10712          *              }, 
10713          *              "onFailure" : function(f) {
10714          *                  console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10715          *              }
10716          *          });
10717          *      },
10718          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10719          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10720          *      }
10721          * });
10722          */
10723         hcap.Media.prototype.play = function (param) {
10724             if (media_object === null) {
10725                 param.onFailure({"errorMessage" : "already destroyed."});
10726                 return;
10727             }
10728             hcap_command("media_play", param);
10729         };
10730         /**
10731          * Pause the media playback.
10732          *
10733          * @param {Object} param 
10734          * <ul>
10735          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function. <br>
10736          *   If a media is paused already, this callback function will be invoked.
10737          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10738          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
10739          *       // No parameter.
10740          *   }</pre>
10741          *   </li>
10742          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10743          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10744          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10745          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10746          *   }</pre>
10747          *   </li>
10748          * </ul>
10749          *
10750          * @since 1.3.1
10751          *
10752          * @see
10753          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#play">hcap.Media.play()</a><br>
10754          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#resume">hcap.Media.resume()</a><br> 
10755          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#stop">hcap.Media.stop()</a><br>    
10756          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#destroy">hcap.Media.destroy()</a><br>        
10757          * 
10758          * @example
10759          * hcap.Media.startUp({
10760          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
10761          *          console.log("onSuccess");
10762          *          var media = hcap.Media.createMedia({
10763          *              "url" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.avi", 
10764          *              "mimeType" : "video/mp4", 
10765          *              "subtitleUrl" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.smi"
10766          *          });
10767          *          media.play({
10768          *              "repeatCount" : 2,
10769          *              "onSuccess" : function() {
10770          *                  console.log("onSuccess");
10771          *                  media.pause({
10772          *                      "onSuccess" : function() {
10773          *                          console.log("onSuccess");
10774          *                      },
10775          *                      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10776          *                          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10777          *                      }
10778          *                  });
10779          *              }, 
10780          *              "onFailure" : function(f) {
10781          *                  console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10782          *              }
10783          *          });
10784          *      },
10785          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10786          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10787          *      }
10788          * });
10789          */
10790         hcap.Media.prototype.pause = function (param) {
10791             if (media_object === null) {
10792                 param.onFailure({"errorMessage" : "already destroyed."});
10793                 return;
10794             }
10795             hcap_command("media_pause", param);
10796         };
10797         /**
10798          * Resume the media playback.
10799          *
10800          * @param {Object} param 
10801          * <ul>
10802          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function. <br>
10803          *   If a media is resumed already, this callback function will be invoked.
10804          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10805          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
10806          *       // No parameter.
10807          *   }</pre>
10808          *   </li>
10809          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10810          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10811          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10812          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10813          *   }</pre>
10814          *   </li>
10815          * </ul>
10816          *
10817          * @since 1.3.1
10818          *
10819          * @see
10820          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#play">hcap.Media.play()</a><br>
10821          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#stop">hcap.Media.stop()</a><br>
10822          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#pause">hcap.Media.pause()</a><br>
10823          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#destroy">hcap.Media.destroy()</a><br>        
10824          * 
10825          * @example
10826          * hcap.Media.startUp({
10827          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
10828          *          console.log("onSuccess");
10829          *          var media = hcap.Media.createMedia({
10830          *              "url" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.avi", 
10831          *              "mimeType" : "video/mp4", 
10832          *              "subtitleUrl" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.smi"
10833          *          });
10834          *          media.play({
10835          *              "repeatCount" : 2,
10836          *              "onSuccess" : function() {
10837          *                  console.log("onSuccess");
10838          *                  media.pause({
10839          *                      "onSuccess" : function() {
10840          *                          console.log("onSuccess");
10841          *                          media.resume({
10842          *                              "onSuccess" : function() {
10843          *                                  console.log("onSuccess");
10844          *                              },
10845          *                              "onFailure" : function(f) {
10846          *                                  console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10847          *                              }
10848          *                          });
10849          *                      },
10850          *                      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10851          *                          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10852          *                      }
10853          *                  });
10854          *              }, 
10855          *              "onFailure" : function(f) {
10856          *                  console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10857          *              }
10858          *          });
10859          *      },
10860          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10861          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10862          *      }
10863          * });
10864          */
10865         hcap.Media.prototype.resume = function (param) {
10866             if (media_object === null) {
10867                 param.onFailure({"errorMessage" : "already destroyed."});
10868                 return;
10869             }
10870             hcap_command("media_resume", param);
10871         };
10872         /**
10873          * Stops the media playback.
10874          *
10875          * @param {Object} param 
10876          * <ul>
10877          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function. <br>
10878          *   If a media is stopped already, this callback function will be invoked.
10879          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10880          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
10881          *       // No parameter.
10882          *   }</pre>
10883          *   </li>
10884          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10885          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10886          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10887          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10888          *   }</pre>
10889          *   </li>
10890          * </ul>
10891          *
10892          * @since 1.3.1
10893          *
10894          * @see
10895          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#play">hcap.Media.play()</a><br>
10896          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#pause">hcap.Media.pause()</a><br>
10897          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#resume">hcap.Media.resume()</a><br>     
10898          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#destroy">hcap.Media.destroy()</a><br>    
10899          * 
10900          * @example
10901          * hcap.Media.startUp({
10902          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
10903          *          console.log("onSuccess");
10904          *          var media = hcap.Media.createMedia({
10905          *              "url" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.avi", 
10906          *              "mimeType" : "video/mp4", 
10907          *              "subtitleUrl" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.smi"
10908          *          });
10909          *          media.play({
10910          *              "onSuccess" : function() {
10911          *                  console.log("onSuccess");
10912          *                  media.stop({
10913          *                      "onSuccess" : function() {
10914          *                          console.log("onSuccess");
10915          *                      },
10916          *                      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10917          *                          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10918          *                      }
10919          *                  });
10920          *              }, 
10921          *              "onFailure" : function(f) {
10922          *                  console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10923          *              }
10924          *          });
10925          *      },
10926          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
10927          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
10928          *      }
10929          * });
10930          */
10931         hcap.Media.prototype.stop = function (param) {
10932             if (media_object === null) {
10933                 param.onFailure({"errorMessage" : "already destroyed."});
10934                 return;
10935             }
10936             hcap_command("media_stop", param);
10937         };
10938         /**
10939          * Destroy the media playback. If you want to request channel change during playback then you should destroy media object.
10940          * Before destorying the media, please check the current media status is the stop.
10941          * If the media status is not the stop, please call hcap.Media.stop() and then call hcap.Media.destroy().
10942          *
10943          * @param {Object} param 
10944          * <ul>
10945          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function. <br>
10946          *   If a media is destroyed already, this callback function will be invoked.
10947          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10948          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
10949          *       // No parameter.
10950          *   }</pre>
10951          *   </li>
10952          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
10953          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
10954          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
10955          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
10956          *   }</pre>
10957          *   </li>
10958          * </ul>
10959          *
10960          * @since 1.3.1
10961          *
10962          * @see
10963          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#play">hcap.Media.play()</a><br>
10964          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#pause">hcap.Media.pause()</a><br>
10965          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#resume">hcap.Media.resume()</a><br>     
10966          *  <a href="hcap.Media.html#stop">hcap.Media.stop()</a><br>    
10967          * 
10968          * @example
10969          * hcap.Media.startUp({
10970          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
10971          *          console.log("onSuccess");
10972          *          var media = hcap.Media.createMedia({
10973          *              "url" : "http://media_server_url/media_file.avi", 
10974          *              "mimeType" : "video/mp4"
10975          *          });
10976          *          media.play({
10977          *              "onSuccess" : function() {
10978          *                  console.log("onSuccess");
10979          *                  media.stop({
10980          *                      "onSuccess" : function() {
10981          *                          console.log("onSuccess");
10982          *                          media.destroy({
10983          *                              "onSuccess" : function() {
10984          *                                  console.log("onSuccess");
10985          *                                  hcap.Media.shutDown({
10986          *                                      "onSuccess" : function() {
