14229          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14230          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14231          *      }
14232          * });
14233          */
14234         hcap.system.setProxyServer = function (param) {
14235             hcap_command("set_proxy_server", param);
14236         };
14237         /**
14238          * Expires the current configuration of proxy server.<br>
14239          * 
14240          * @param {Object} param
14241          * <ul>
14242          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14243          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14244          *   param.onSuccess = function()
14245          *       // No Parameter.
14246          *   }</pre>
14247          *   </li>
14248          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14249          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14250          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14251          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14252          *   }</pre>
14253          *   </li>
14254          * </ul>
14255          * 
14256          * @since 1.21.0
14257          * 
14258          * @see
14259          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.getProxyServer">hcap.system.getProxyServer()</a><br>
14260          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.getProxyServer">hcap.system.setProxyServer()</a><br>
14261          *
14262          * @example
14263          * hcap.system.expireProxyServer({
14264          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14265          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14266          *      },
14267          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14268          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14269          *      }
14270          * });
14271          */
14272         hcap.system.expireProxyServer = function (param) {
14273             hcap_command("expire_proxy_server", param);
14274         };
14275         /**
14276          * Gets the current remote object inspector mode of the HCAP browser.<br>
14277          * 
14278          * @param {Object} param
14279          * <ul>
14280          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14281          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14282          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14283          *       // {Boolean} param.debugMode - true if the debug mode of HCAP browser is on. false if the debug mode of HCAP browser is off.
14284          *   }</pre>
14285          *   </li>
14286          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14287          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14288          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14289          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14290          *   }</pre>
14291          *   </li>
14292          * </ul>
14293          * 
14294          * @since 1.21.0
14295          * 
14296          * @see
14297          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.setBrowserDebugMode">hcap.system.setBrowserDebugMode()</a><br>
14298          *
14299          * @example
14300          * hcap.system.getBrowserDebugMode({
14301          *      "onSuccess" : function(p) {
14302          *          console.log("onSuccess : debugMode = " + p.debugMode);
14303          *      },
14304          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14305          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14306          *      }
14307          * });
14308          */
14309         hcap.system.getBrowserDebugMode = function (param) {
14310             hcap_command("get_browser_debug_mode", param);
14311         };
14312         /**
14313          * Turns on or off the remote object inspector of the HCAP browser.<br>
14314          * Changed setting will take affect after a reboot.<br>
14315          * After a reboot, open the http://TV_IP:2345 on TV remote client (Chrome on PC).<br>
14316          * 
14317          * @param {Object} param
14318          * <ul>
14319          *   <li>{Boolean} param.debugMode [Required] - true to turn on debug mode, else false.</li>
14320          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14321          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14322          *   param.onSuccess = function()
14323          *       // No Parameter.
14324          *   }</pre>
14325          *   </li>
14326          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14327          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14328          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14329          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14330          *   }</pre>
14331          *   </li>
14332          * </ul>
14333          * 
14334          * @since 1.21.0
14335          * 
14336          * @see
14337          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.getBrowserDebugMode">hcap.system.getBrowserDebugMode()</a><br>
14338          *
14339          * @example
14340          * hcap.system.setBrowserDebugMode({
14341          *      "debugMode" : true,
14342          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14343          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14344          *      },
14345          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14346          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14347          *      }
14348          * });
14349          */
14350         hcap.system.setBrowserDebugMode = function (param) {
14351             hcap_command("set_browser_debug_mode", param);
14352         };
14353         /**
14354          * Gets the current configuration of no signal image.<br>
14355          * 
14356          * @param {Object} param
14357          * <ul>
14358          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14359          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14360          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14361          *       // {Boolean} param.noSignalImage - true if no signal image is on. false if no signal image is off.
14362          *   }</pre>
14363          *   </li>
14364          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14365          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14366          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14367          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14368          *   }</pre>
14369          *   </li>
14370          * </ul>
14371          * 
14372          * @since 1.21.0
14373          * 
14374          * @see
14375          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.setNoSignalImage">hcap.system.setNoSignalImage()</a><br>
14376          *
14377          * @example
14378          * hcap.system.getNoSignalImage({
14379          *      "onSuccess" : function(p) {
14380          *          console.log("onSuccess : noSignalImage = " + p.noSignalImage);
14381          *      },
14382          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14383          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14384          *      }
14385          * });
14386          */
14387         hcap.system.getNoSignalImage = function (param) {
14388             hcap_command("get_no_signal_image", param);
14389         };
14390         /**
14391          * Turns on or off no signal image.<br>
14392          * 
14393          * @param {Object} param
14394          * <ul>
14395          *   <li>{Boolean} param.noSignalImage [Required] - true to turn on no signal image, else false.</li>
14396          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14397          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14398          *   param.onSuccess = function()
14399          *       // No Parameter.
14400          *   }</pre>
14401          *   </li>
14402          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14403          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14404          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14405          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14406          *   }</pre>
14407          *   </li>
14408          * </ul>
14409          * 
14410          * @since 1.21.0
14411          * 
14412          * @see
14413          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.getNoSignalImage">hcap.system.getNoSignalImage()</a><br>
14414          *
14415          * @example
14416          * hcap.system.setNoSignalImage({
14417          *      "noSignalImage" : true,
14418          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14419          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14420          *      },
14421          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14422          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14423          *      }
14424          * });
14425          */
14426         hcap.system.setNoSignalImage = function (param) {
14427             hcap_command("set_no_signal_image", param);
14428         };
14429         /**
14430          * Gets the list of supported screen keyboard languages.<br>
14431          * Screen keyboard language list is composed of language codes and delimiter comma(',').<br>
14432          * 
14433          * @param {Object} param
14434          * <ul>
14435          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14436          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14437          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14438          *       // {String} param.list - screen keyboard language list string. 
14439          *       //     which is composed of language codes separated by delimiter comma(',').
14440          *   }</pre>
14441          *   </li>
14442          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14443          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14444          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14445          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14446          *   }</pre>
14447          *   </li>
14448          * </ul>
14449          * 
14450          * @since 1.22.0
14451          * 
14452          * @see
14453          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.setScreenKeyboardLanguage">hcap.system.setScreenKeyboardLanguage()</a><br>
14454          *
14455          * @example
14456          * hcap.system.getScreenKeyboardLanguageList({
14457          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
14458          *          console.log("onSuccess : list = " + s.list);
14459          *      }, 
14460          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14461          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14462          *      }
14463          * });
14464          */
14465         hcap.system.getScreenKeyboardLanguageList = function (param) {
14466             hcap_command("get_screen_keyboard_language_list", param);
14467         };
14468         /**
14469          * Sets the screen keyboard language.<br>
14470          * 
14471          * @param {Object} param
14472          * <ul>
14473          *   <li>{String} param.keyboardLanguage [Required] - screen keyboard language to be set.</li>
14474          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14475          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14476          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14477          *       // No Parameter.
14478          *   }</pre>
14479          *   </li>
14480          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
14481          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14482          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14483          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14484          *   }</pre>
14485          *   </li>
14486          * </ul>
14487          * 
14488          * @since 1.22.0
14489          * 
14490          * @see
14491          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.getScreenKeyboardLanguageList">hcap.system.getScreenKeyboardLanguageList()</a><br>
14492          *
14493          * @example
14494          * hcap.system.setScreenKeyboardLanguage({
14495          *      "keyboardLanguage" : "en", 
14496          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14497          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14498          *      }, 
14499          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14500          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14501          *      }
14502          * });
14503          */
14504         hcap.system.setScreenKeyboardLanguage = function (param) {
14505             hcap_command("set_screen_keyboard_language", param);
14506         };
14507         /**
14508          * Gets the status of usb power control.<br>
14509          * 
14510          * @param {Object} param
14511          * <ul>
14512          *   <li>{Number} param.portNumber [Required] - port number to be get the status of usb power control.</li>
14513          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14514          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14515          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14516          *       // {Boolean} param.status - the status of usb power control.
14517          *   }</pre>
14518          *   </li>
14519          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14520          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14521          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14522          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14523          *   }</pre>
14524          *   </li>
14525          * </ul>
14526          * 
14527          * @since 1.23.0
14528          * 
14529          * @see
14530          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.setUsbPowerControl">hcap.system.setUsbPowerControl()</a><br>
14531          *
14532          * @example
14533          * hcap.system.getUsbPowerControl({
14534          *      "portNumber" : 2,
14535          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
14536          *          console.log("onSuccess : status = " + s.status);
14537          *      }, 
14538          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14539          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14540          *      }
14541          * });
14542          */
14543         hcap.system.getUsbPowerControl = function (param) {
14544             hcap_command("get_usb_power_control", param);
14545         };
14546         /**
14547          * Sets the status of usb power control.<br>
14548          * 
14549          * @param {Object} param
14550          * <ul>
14551          *   <li>{Number} param.portNumber [Required] - port number to be set the status of usb power control.</li>
14552          *   <li>{Boolean} param.status [Required] - the status of usb power control.</li>
14553          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14554          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14555          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14556          *       // No Parameter.
14557          *   }</pre>
14558          *   </li>
14559          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.<br>
14560          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14561          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14562          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14563          *   }</pre>
14564          *   </li>
14565          * </ul>
14566          * 
14567          * @since 1.23.0
14568          * 
14569          * @see
14570          * <a href="hcap.system.html#.getUsbPowerControl">hcap.system.getUsbPowerControl()</a><br>
14571          *
14572          * @example
14573          * hcap.system.setUsbPowerControl({
14574          *      "portNumber" : 2,
14575          *      "status" : true,
14576          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14577          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14578          *      }, 
14579          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14580          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14581          *      }
14582          * });
14583          */
14584         hcap.system.setUsbPowerControl = function (param) {
14585             hcap_command("set_usb_power_control", param);
14586         };
14587         /** 
14588          * @namespace hcap.checkout
14589          */
14590         hcap.checkout = { };
14591         /**
14592          * Restores checkout snapshot items and clear system-dependent cache and history.<br>
14593          * Rebooting system is strongly recommended after checking out is done.<br>
14594          * 
14595          * @param {Object} param
14596          * <ul>
14597          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14598          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14599          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14600          *       // No Parameter.
14601          *   }</pre>
14602          *   </li>
14603          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14604          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14605          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14606          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14607          *   }</pre>
14608          *   </li>
14609          * </ul>
14610          *  
14611          * @since 1.19.0
14612          * 
14613          * @see
14614          * <a href="hcap.checkout.html#.takeCheckoutSnapshot">hcap.checkout.takeCheckoutSnapshot()</a><br>
14615          *
14616          * @example
14617          * hcap.checkout.requestCheckout({
14618          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14619          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14620          *      }, 
14621          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14622          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14623          *      }
14624          * });
14625          */
14626         hcap.checkout.requestCheckout = function (param) {
14627             hcap_command("request_checkout", param);
14628         };
14629         /**
14630          * Stores checkout snapshot items. The checkout snapshot items are system(or TV model)-dependent.<br>
14631          * 
14632          * @param {Object} param
14633          * <ul>
14634          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14635          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14636          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14637          *       // No Parameter.
14638          *   }</pre>
14639          *   </li>
14640          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14641          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14642          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14643          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14644          *   }</pre>
14645          *   </li>
14646          * </ul>
14647          *  
14648          * @since 1.19.0
14649          * 
14650          * @see
14651          * <a href="hcap.checkout.html#.requestCheckout">hcap.checkout.requestCheckout()</a><br>
14652          *
14653          * @example
14654          * hcap.checkout.takeCheckoutSnapshot({
14655          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14656          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14657          *      }, 
14658          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14659          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14660          *      }
14661          * });
14662          */
14663         hcap.checkout.takeCheckoutSnapshot = function (param) {
14664             hcap_command("take_checkout_snapshot", param);
14665         };
14666         /**
14667          * @namespace hcap.beacon
14668          */
14669         hcap.beacon = {};
14670         /**
14671          * Sets the beacon mode is enabled or disabled.<br>
14672          * 
14673          * @param {Object} param
14674          * <ul>
14675          *   <li>{Boolean} param.enable [Required] - true : enable to beacon mode, false : disable.</li>
14676          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14677          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14678          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14679          *       // No Parameter. 
14680          *   }</pre>
14681          *   </li>
14682          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14683          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14684          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14685          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14686          *   }</pre>
14687          *   </li>
14688          * </ul>
14689          *  
14690          * @since 1.22.0
14691          * 
14692          * @see
14693          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestiBeacon">hcap.beacon.requestiBeacon()</a><br>
14694          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestEddystoneUid">hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUid()</a><br>
14695          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestEddystoneUrl">hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUrl()</a><br>
14696          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.getBeaconInformation">hcap.beacon.getBeaconInformation()</a><br>
14697          * <a href="_global_.html#event:ui_value_changed">{Event} ui_value_changed</a><br>
14698          *
14699          * @example
14700          * hcap.beacon.setBeaconMode({
14701          *      "enable" : true,
14702          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14703          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14704          *      }, 
14705          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14706          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14707          *      }
14708          * });
14709          */
14710         hcap.beacon.setBeaconMode = function (param) {
14711             hcap_command("set_beacon_mode", param);
14712         };
14713         /**
14714          * Request the iBeacon.<br>
14715          * This is worked only when the beacon mode is enabled.<br>
14716          * 
14717          * @param {Object} param
14718          * <ul>
14719          *   <li>{String} param.uuid [Required] - uuid. the range is 0~F(field1: 8 digits string, field2: 4 digits string, field3: 4 digits string, field4: 4 digits string, field5: 8 digits string)</li>
14720          *   <li>{Number} param.major [Required] - the value of major (0 ~ 65535)</li>
14721          *   <li>{Number} param.minor [Required] - the value of minor (0 ~ 65535)</li>
14722          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14723          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14724          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14725          *       // No Parameter. 
14726          *   }</pre>
14727          *   </li>
14728          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14729          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14730          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14731          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14732          *   }</pre>
14733          *   </li>
14734          * </ul>
14735          *  
14736          * @since 1.22.0
14737          * 
14738          * @see
14739          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.setBeaconMode">hcap.beacon.setBeaconMode()</a><br>
14740          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestEddystoneUid">hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUid()</a><br>
14741          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestEddystoneUrl">hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUrl()</a><br>
14742          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.getBeaconInformation">hcap.beacon.getBeaconInformation()</a><br>
14743          *
14744          * @example
14745          * hcap.beacon.requestiBeacon({
14746          *      "uuid" : "AAAAAAAABBBBCCCCDDDDEEEEEEEE",
14747          *      "major" : 65535,
14748          *      "minor" : 65535,
14749          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14750          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14751          *      }, 
14752          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14753          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14754          *      }
14755          * });
14756          */
14757         hcap.beacon.requestiBeacon = function (param) {
14758             hcap_command("request_iBeacon", param);
14759         };
14760         /**
14761          * Request the Eddystone Uid.<br>
14762          * This is worked only when the beacon mode is enabled.<br>
14763          * 
14764          * @param {Object} param
14765          * <ul>
14766          *   <li>{String} param.uuid [Required] - uuid. the range is 0~F(field1: 20 digits string, field2: 8 digits string)</li>
14767          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14768          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14769          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14770          *       // No Parameter. 
14771          *   }</pre>
14772          *   </li>
14773          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14774          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14775          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14776          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14777          *   }</pre>
14778          *   </li>
14779          * </ul>
14780          *  
14781          * @since 1.22.0
14782          * 
14783          * @see
14784          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.setBeaconMode">hcap.beacon.setBeaconMode()</a><br>
14785          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestiBeacon">hcap.beacon.requestiBeacon()</a><br>
14786          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestEddystoneUrl">hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUrl()</a><br>
14787          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.getBeaconInformation">hcap.beacon.getBeaconInformation()</a><br>
14788          *
14789          * @example
14790          * hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUid({
14791          *      "uuid" : "AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAABBBBBBBB",
14792          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14793          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14794          *      }, 
14795          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14796          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14797          *      }
14798          * });
14799          */
14800         hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUid = function (param) {
14801             hcap_command("request_eddystone_uid", param);
14802         };
14803         /**
14804          * Request the Eddystone Url.<br>
14805          * This is worked only when the beacon mode is enabled.<br>
14806          * 
14807          * @param {Object} param
14808          * <ul>
14809          *   <li>{String} param.prefix [Required] - url prefix ("http", "httpEx", "https", "httpsEx")</li>
14810          *   <li>{String} param.excode [Required] - url excode ("noneValue", "comEx", "orgEx", eduEx", "netEx", "infoEx", "bizEx", "govEx", "com", "org", "edu", "nex", "info", "biz", "gov")</li>
14811          *   <li>{String} param.url [Required] - url. max length is 17. but max length is 15 when prefix is "httpsEx" or excode is "infoEx".</li>
14812          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14813          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14814          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14815          *       // No Parameter. 
14816          *   }</pre>
14817          *   </li>
14818          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14819          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14820          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14821          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14822          *   }</pre>
14823          *   </li>
14824          * </ul>
14825          *  
14826          * @since 1.22.0
14827          * 
14828          * @see
14829          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.setBeaconMode">hcap.beacon.setBeaconMode()</a><br>
14830          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestiBeacon">hcap.beacon.requestiBeacon()</a><br>
14831          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestEddystoneUid">hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUid()</a><br>
14832          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.getBeaconInformation">hcap.beacon.getBeaconInformation()</a><br>
14833          *
14834          * @example
14835          * hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUrl({
14836          *      "prefix" : "httpEx",
14837          *      "excode" : "eduEx",
14838          *      "url" : "abcdefghijklmnopq",
14839          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14840          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14841          *      }, 
14842          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14843          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14844          *      }
14845          * });
14846          */
14847         hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUrl = function (param) {
14848         	hcap_command("request_eddystone_url", param);
14849         };
14850         /**
14851          * Gets the configuration of beacon.<br>
14852          *
14853          * @param {Object} param
14854          * <ul>
14855          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14856          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14857          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
14858          *       // {Boolean} param.beaconMode - true : enable to beacon mode, false : disable
14859          *       // {String} param.beaconType - beacon type(iBeacon, eddystone)
14860          *       // {String} param.iBeaconUuid - uuid of iBeacon.
14861          *       // {Number} param.iBeaconMajor - major of iBeacon.
14862          *       // {Number} param.iBeaconMinor - minor of iBeacon.
14863          *       // {String} param.eddyStoneUuid - uuid of eddystone.
14864          *       // {String} param.eddyStoneFrame - frame of eddystone.
14865          *       // {String} param.eddyStoneUrlPrefix - url prefix of eddystone.
14866          *       // {String} param.eddyStoneUrlExCode - url ex code of eddystone.
14867          *       // {String} param.eddyStoneUrl - url of eddystone.
14868          *   }</pre>
14869          *   </li>
14870          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
14871          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14872          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14873          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14874          *   }</pre>
14875          *   </li>
14876          * </ul>
14877          *  
14878          * @since 1.22.0
14879          * 
14880          * @see
14881          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.setBeaconMode">hcap.beacon.setBeaconMode()</a><br>
14882          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestiBeacon">hcap.beacon.requestiBeacon()</a><br>
14883          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestEddystoneUid">hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUid()</a><br>
14884          * <a href="hcap.beacon.html#.requestEddystoneUrl">hcap.beacon.requestEddystoneUrl()</a><br>
14885          *
14886          * @example
14887          * hcap.beacon.getBeaconInformation({
14888          *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
14889          *          console.log("onSuccess          : " + 
14890          *              "\n beacon mode             : " + s.beaconMode +
14891          *              "\n beacon type             : " + s.beaconType +
14892          *              "\n iBeacon uuid            : " + s.iBeaconUuid +
14893          *              "\n iBeacon major           : " + s.iBeaconMajor +
14894          *              "\n iBeacon minor           : " + s.iBeaconMinor +
14895          *              "\n eddystone uuid          : " + s.eddyStoneUuid +
14896          *              "\n eddystone frame         : " + s.eddyStoneFrame +
14897          *              "\n eddystone url prefix    : " + s.eddyStoneUrlPrefix +
14898          *              "\n eddystone url ex code   : " + s.eddyStoneUrlExCode +
14899          *              "\n eddystone url           : " + s.eddyStoneUrl);
14900          *      }, 
14901          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14902          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14903          *      }
14904          * });
14905          */
14906         hcap.beacon.getBeaconInformation = function (param) {
14907             hcap_command("get_beacon_information", param);
14908         };
14909         /** 
14910          * @namespace hcap.bluetooth
14911          */
14912         hcap.bluetooth = { };
14913         /**
14914          * Sets the scan configuration such as visibility and connectability of the local device as a bluetooth device.<br>
14915          * We highly recommend not to change the connectability.<br>
14916          * 
14917          * @param {Object} param
14918          * <ul>
14919          *   <li>{Boolean} param.visible [Required] - true : visible to other bluetooth devices, false : invisible.</li>
14920          *   <li>{Boolean} param.connectable [Required] - true : connectable to other bluetooth devices, false : unconnectable.</li>
14921          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14922          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14923          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14924          *       // No Parameter. 
14925          *   }</pre>
14926          *   </li>
14927          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14928          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14929          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14930          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14931          *   }</pre>
14932          *   </li>
14933          * </ul>
14934          *  
14935          * @since 1.19.0
14936          * 
14937          * @see
14938          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
14939          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.html#.disconnect">hcap.bluetooth.disconnect()</a><br>
14940          *
14941          * @example
14942          * hcap.bluetooth.setScanState({
14943          *      "visible" : true,
14944          *      "connectable" : true,
14945          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14946          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14947          *      }, 
14948          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14949          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14950          *      }
14951          * });
14952          */
14953         hcap.bluetooth.setScanState = function (param) {
14954             hcap_command("bt_gap_set_scan_state", param);
14955         };
14956         /**
14957          * Disconnects the device paired with the given bluetooth service profile.<br>
14958          * 
14959          * @param {Object} param
14960          * <ul>
14961          *   <li>{String} param.service [Required] - service profile ("hid" : HID profile / "audio" : audio src(A2DP) profile / "opc" : OPC profile / "audio_sink" : audio sink(A2DP) profile)
14962          *   <li>{String} param.address [Required] - BD (Bluetooth Device) address
14963          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
14964          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14965          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
14966          *       // No Parameter. 
14967          *   }</pre>
14968          *   </li>
14969          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
14970          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
14971          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
14972          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
14973          *   }</pre>
14974          *   </li>
14975          * </ul>
14976          *  
14977          * @since 1.19.0
14978          * 
14979          * @see
14980          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
14981          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.html#.setScanState">hcap.bluetooth.setScanState()</a><br>
14982          *
14983          * @example
14984          * hcap.bluetooth.disconnect({
14985          *      "service" : "audio_sink",
14986          *      "address" : "00:1f:47:e2:04:3f",
14987          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
14988          *          console.log("onSuccess");
14989          *      }, 
14990          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
14991          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
14992          *      }
14993          * });
14994          */
14995         hcap.bluetooth.disconnect = function (param) {
14996             hcap_command("bt_service_disconnect", param);
14997         };
14998         /**
14999          * Sets the bluetooth sound sync application is enabled or disabled.<br>
15000          * 
15001          * @param {Object} param
15002          * <ul>
15003          *   <li>{Boolean} param.enable [Required] - true : enable to bluetooth sound sync application, false : disable.</li>
15004          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15005          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15006          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15007          *       // No Parameter. 
15008          *   }</pre>
15009          *   </li>
15010          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15011          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15012          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15013          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15014          *   }</pre>
15015          *   </li>
15016          * </ul>
15017          *  
15018          * @since 1.20.1
15019          * 
15020          * @see
15021          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.html#.getBluetoothSoundSync">hcap.bluetooth.getBluetoothSoundSync()</a><br>
15022          * <a href="_global_.html#event:ui_value_changed">{Event} ui_value_changed</a><br>
15023          *
15024          * @example
15025          * hcap.bluetooth.setBluetoothSoundSync({
15026          *      "enable" : true,
15027          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
15028          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15029          *      }, 
15030          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15031          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15032          *      }
15033          * });
15034          */
15035         hcap.bluetooth.setBluetoothSoundSync = function (param) {
15036             hcap_command("set_bt_sound_sync", param);
15037         };
15038         /**
15039          * Gets whether bluetooth sound sync application is enabled or disabled.<br>
15040          * 
15041          * @param {Object} param
15042          * <ul>
15043          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15044          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15045          *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
15046          *       // {Boolean} param.enable - true if the bluetooth sound sync application is enabled. false if the bluetooth sound sync application is disabled.
15047          *   }</pre>
15048          *   </li>
15049          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15050          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15051          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15052          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15053          *   }</pre>
15054          *   </li>
15055          * </ul>
15056          *  
15057          * @since 1.20.1
15058          * 
15059          * @see
15060          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.html#.setBluetoothSoundSync">hcap.bluetooth.setBluetoothSoundSync()</a><br>
15061          *
15062          * @example
15063          * hcap.bluetooth.getBluetoothSoundSync({
15064          *      "onSuccess" : function (param) {
15065          *          console.log("onSuccess : bluetooth sound sync = " + param.enable);
15066          *      }, 
15067          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15068          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15069          *      }
15070          * });
15071          */
15072         hcap.bluetooth.getBluetoothSoundSync = function (param) {
15073             hcap_command("get_bt_sound_sync", param);
15074         };
15075         /**
15076          * @namespace hcap.bluetooth.audio
15077          */
15078         hcap.bluetooth.audio = { };
15079         /**
15080          * Plays the bluetooth audio streaming.<br>
15081          * Precondition : Bluetooth audio device is connected.<br>
15082          * 
15083          * @param {Object} param
15084          * <ul>
15085          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15086          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15087          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15088          *       // No Parameter.
15089          *   }</pre>
15090          *   </li>
15091          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15092          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15093          *   param.onFailure = function(param) {
15094          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15095          *   }</pre>
15096          *   </li>
15097          * </ul>
15098          *  
15099          * @since 1.20.0
15100          * 
15101          * @see
15102          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
15103          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.stop">hcap.bluetooth.audio.stop()</a><br>
15104          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.pause">hcap.bluetooth.audio.pause()</a><br>
15105          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.forward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.forward()</a><br>
15106          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.backward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.backward()</a><br>
15107          *
15108          * @example
15109          * hcap.bluetooth.audio.play({
15110          *      "onSuccess":function() {
15111          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15112          *      }, 
15113          *      "onFailure":function(f) {
15114          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15115          *      }
15116          * });
15117          */
15118         hcap.bluetooth.audio.play = function (param) {
15119             hcap_command("bt_audio_play", param);
15120         };
15121         /**
15122          * Stops the bluetooth audio streaming.<br>
15123          * Precondition : Bluetooth audio device is connected.<br>
15124          * 
15125          * @param {Object} param
15126          * <ul>
15127          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15128          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15129          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15130          *       // No Parameter.
15131          *   }</pre>
15132          *   </li>
15133          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15134          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15135          *   param.onFailure = function(param) {
15136          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15137          *   }</pre>
15138          *   </li>
15139          * </ul>
15140          *

15142          * 
15143          * @see

15145          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.play">hcap.bluetooth.audio.play()</a><br>
15146          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.pause">hcap.bluetooth.audio.pause()</a><br>
15147          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.forward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.forward()</a><br>
15148          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.backward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.backward()</a><br>
15149          *

15151          * hcap.bluetooth.audio.stop({
15152          *      "onSuccess":function() {
15153          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15154          *      }, 
15155          *      "onFailure":function(f) {
15156          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15157          *      }
15158          * });
15159          */

15161             hcap_command("bt_audio_stop", param);
15162         };
15163         /**
15164          * Pauses the bluetooth audio streaming.<br>
15165          * Precondition : Bluetooth audio device is connected.<br>
15166          * 
15167          * @param {Object} param
15168          * <ul>
15169          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15170          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15171          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15172          *       // No Parameter.
15173          *   }</pre>
15174          *   </li>
15175          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15176          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15177          *   param.onFailure = function(param) {
15178          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15179          *   }</pre>
15180          *   </li>
15181          * </ul>
15182          *  
15183          * @since 1.20.0
15184          * 
15185          * @see
15186          * <a href="_global_.html#event:bluetooth_event_received">{Event} bluetooth_event_received</a><br>
15187          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.play">hcap.bluetooth.audio.play()</a><br>
15188          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.stop">hcap.bluetooth.audio.stop()</a><br>
15189          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.forward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.forward()</a><br>
15190          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.backward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.backward()</a><br>
15191          *
15192          * @example
15193          * hcap.bluetooth.audio.pause({
15194          *      "onSuccess":function() {
15195          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15196          *      }, 
15197          *      "onFailure":function(f) {
15198          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15199          *      }
15200          * });
15201          */
15202         hcap.bluetooth.audio.pause = function (param) {
15203             hcap_command("bt_audio_pause", param);
15204         };
15205         /**
15206          * Plays the bluetooth audio streaming of the next track.<br>
15207          * Precondition : Bluetooth audio device is connected.<br>
15208          * 
15209          * @param {Object} param
15210          * <ul>
15211          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15212          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15213          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15214          *       // No Parameter.
15215          *   }</pre>
15216          *   </li>
15217          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15218          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15219          *   param.onFailure = function(param) {
15220          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15221          *   }</pre>
15222          *   </li>
15223          * </ul>
15224          *

15226          * 
15227          * @see

15229          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.play">hcap.bluetooth.audio.play()</a><br>
15230          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.stop">hcap.bluetooth.audio.stop()</a><br>
15231          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.pause">hcap.bluetooth.audio.pause()</a><br>
15232          * <a href="hcap.bluetooth.audio.html#.backward">hcap.bluetooth.audio.backward()</a><br>
15233          *
15234          * @example
15235          * hcap.bluetooth.audio.forward({
15236          *      "onSuccess":function() {
15237          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15238          *      }, 
15239          *      "onFailure":function(f) {
15240          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15241          *      }
15242          * });

15244         hcap.bluetooth.audio.forward = function (param) {

15246         };

15254          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15255          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15256          *       // No Parameter.
15257          *   }</pre>
15258          *   </li>
15259          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15260          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15261          *   param.onFailure = function(param) {
15262          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.

15275          *
