15288         };
15289         /** 
15290          * @namespace hcap.webrtc
15291          */
15292         hcap.webrtc = { };
15293         /**
15294          * Plays the video stream from local video. This is for checking local video works well or not.<br>
15295          * 
15296          * @param {Object} param
15297          * <ul>
15298          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15299          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15300          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15301          *       // No Parameter.
15302          *   }</pre>
15303          *   </li>
15304          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15305          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15306          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15307          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15308          *   }</pre>
15309          *   </li>
15310          * </ul>
15311          *  
15312          * @since 1.19.1
15313          * 
15314          * @see 
15315          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
15316          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
15317          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15318          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
15319          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
15320          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
15321          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
15322          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
15323          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
15324          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
15325          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
15326          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
15327          *
15328          * @example
15329          * hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo({
15330          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
15331          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15332          *      }, 
15333          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15334          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15335          *      }
15336          * });
15337          */
15338         hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo = function (param) {
15339             hcap_command("webrtc_start_preview_video", param);
15340         };
15341         /**
15342          * Stops playing local video.<br>
15343          * 
15344          * @param {Object} param
15345          * <ul>
15346          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15347          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15348          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15349          *       // No Parameter.
15350          *   }</pre>
15351          *   </li>
15352          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15353          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15354          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15355          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15356          *   }</pre>
15357          *   </li>
15358          * </ul>
15359          *  
15360          * @since 1.19.1
15361          * 
15362          * @see 
15363          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
15364          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
15365          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15366          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
15367          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
15368          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
15369          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
15370          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
15371          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
15372          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
15373          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
15374          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
15375          *
15376          * @example
15377          * hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo({
15378          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
15379          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15380          *      }, 
15381          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15382          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15383          *      }
15384          * });
15385          */
15386         hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo = function (param) {
15387             hcap_command("webrtc_stop_preview_video", param);
15388         };
15389         /**
15390          * Receives an incoming call. This API should be included the information of peer's SDP(Session Description Protocol).<br>
15391          * 
15392          * @param {Object} param
15393          * <ul>
15394          *   <li>{Number} param.localId [Required] - local(my) ID 
15395          *   <li>{Number} param.remoteId [Required] - peer(who makes a call to me) ID 
15396          *   <li>{String} param.remoteSDP[Required] - peer SDP
15397          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15398          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15399          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15400          *       // No Parameter. 
15401          *   }</pre>
15402          *   </li>
15403          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15404          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15405          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15406          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15407          *   }</pre>
15408          *   </li>
15409          * </ul>
15410          *  
15411          * @since 1.19.1
15412          * 
15413          * @see 
15414          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
15415          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
15416          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15417          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15418          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
15419          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
15420          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
15421          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
15422          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
15423          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
15424          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
15425          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
15426          *
15427          * @example
15428          * hcap.webrtc.incomingCall({
15429          *      "localId" : 1,
15430          *      "remoteId" : 2,
15431          *      "remoteSDP" : "{"sdp" : "v=0\r\no=- 3454157150814283647 2 IN IP4 127.0.0.1\r\ns=-\r\nt=0 0\r\na=group:BUNDLE audio video\r\..."}",
15432          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
15433          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15434          *      }, 
15435          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15436          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15437          *      }
15438          * });
15439          */
15440         hcap.webrtc.incomingCall = function (param) {
15441             hcap_command("webrtc_incoming_call", param);
15442         };
15443         /**
15444          * Makes an outgoing call. This API lead to create WebRTC object and local SDP. 
15445          * The local SDP will be passed to HCAP by an event <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a>.<br>
15446          * 
15447          * @param {Object} param
15448          * <ul>
15449          *   <li>{Number} param.localId [Required] - local(my) ID 
15450          *   <li>{Number} param.remoteId [Required] - peer(who I want to call) ID 
15451          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15452          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15453          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15454          *       // No Parameter. 
15455          *   }</pre>
15456          *   </li>
15457          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15458          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15459          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15460          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15461          *   }</pre>
15462          *   </li>
15463          * </ul>
15464          *  
15465          * @since 1.19.1
15466          * 
15467          * @see 
15468          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
15469          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
15470          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15471          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15472          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
15473          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
15474          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
15475          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
15476          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
15477          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
15478          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
15479          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
15480          *
15481          * @example
15482          * hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall({
15483          *      "localId" : 1,
15484          *      "remoteId" : 2,
15485          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
15486          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15487          *      }, 
15488          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15489          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15490          *      }
15491          * });
15492          */
15493         hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall = function (param) {
15494             hcap_command("webrtc_outgoing_call", param);
15495         };
15496         /**
15497          * Ends a call.<br>
15498          * 
15499          * @param {Object} param
15500          * <ul>
15501          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15502          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15503          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15504          *       // No Parameter.
15505          *   }</pre>
15506          *   </li>
15507          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15508          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15509          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15510          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15511          *   }</pre>
15512          *   </li>
15513          * </ul>
15514          *  
15515          * @since 1.19.1
15516          * 
15517          * @see 
15518          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
15519          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
15520          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15521          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15522          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
15523          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
15524          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
15525          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
15526          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
15527          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
15528          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
15529          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
15530          *
15531          * @example
15532          * hcap.webrtc.endCall({
15533          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
15534          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15535          *      }, 
15536          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15537          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15538          *      }
15539          * });
15540          */
15541         hcap.webrtc.endCall = function (param) {
15542             hcap_command("webrtc_end_call", param);
15543         };
15544         /**
15545          * Sends a message to webrtc service. Predefined types of message can be passed to webrtc service. 
15546          * <br>
15547          * 
15548          * @param {Object} param
15549          * <ul>
15550          *   <li>{Number} param.remoteId [Required] - peer ID 
15551          *   <li>{String} param.rtcMsg [Required] - message which be sent to webrtc service, such as SDP, ICE configuration, and so on. 
15552          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15553          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15554          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15555          *       // No Parameter. 
15556          *   }</pre>
15557          *   </li>
15558          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15559          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15560          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15561          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15562          *   }</pre>
15563          *   </li>
15564          * </ul>
15565          *  
15566          * @since 1.19.1
15567          * 
15568          * @see 
15569          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
15570          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
15571          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15572          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15573          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
15574          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
15575          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
15576          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
15577          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
15578          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
15579          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
15580          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
15581          *
15582          * @example
15583          * hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage({
15584          *      "remoteId" : 2,
15585          *      "rtcMsg" : "{"type":"answer","sdp":"v=0\r\no=- 4474142502554476113 2 IN IP4 127.0.0.1\r\ns=-\r\nt=0 0\r\na=group:BUNDLE audio video..."}",
15586          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
15587          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15588          *      }, 
15589          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15590          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15591          *      }
15592          * });
15593          */
15594         hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage = function (param) {
15595             hcap_command("webrtc_accept_message", param);
15596         };
15597         /**
15598          * Checks local audio. This API can test the local sound by 2-step.<br>
15599          * step1: Set the param.type as a 'microphone' to test input works well or not. It record the sound only from microphone. 
15600          * step2: Set the param.type as a 'speaker' to test the output works well or not. It plays the recorded sound from 'microphone' test.
15601          * Each step will be done by <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a>. 
15602          *  
15603          * @param {Object} param
15604          * <ul>
15605          *   <li>{String} param.type [Required] - microphone | speaker
15606          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15607          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15608          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15609          *       // No Parameter.
15610          *   }</pre>
15611          *   </li>
15612          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15613          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15614          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15615          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15616          *   }</pre>
15617          *   </li>
15618          * </ul>
15619          *  
15620          * @since 1.19.1
15621          * 
15622          * @see 
15623          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
15624          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
15625          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15626          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15627          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
15628          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
15629          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
15630          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
15631          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
15632          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
15633          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
15634          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
15635          *
15636          * @example
15637          * hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio({
15638          *      "type" : "microphone",
15639          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
15640          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15641          *      }, 
15642          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15643          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15644          *      }
15645          * });
15646          */
15647         hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio = function (param) {
15648             hcap_command("webrtc_start_check_audio", param);
15649         };
15650         /**
15651          * Stops <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a>.<br>
15652          * 
15653          * @param {Object} param
15654          * <ul>
15655          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15656          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15657          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15658          *       // No Parameter.
15659          *   }</pre>
15660          *   </li>
15661          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15662          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15663          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15664          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15665          *   }</pre>
15666          *   </li>
15667          * </ul>
15668          *  
15669          * @since 1.19.1
15670          * 
15671          * @see 
15672          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
15673          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
15674          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15675          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15676          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
15677          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
15678          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
15679          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
15680          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
15681          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
15682          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
15683          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
15684          *
15685          * @example
15686          * hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio({
15687          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
15688          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15689          *      }, 
15690          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15691          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15692          *      }
15693          * });
15694          */
15695         hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio = function (param) {
15696             hcap_command("webrtc_stop_check_audio", param);
15697         };
15698         /**
15699          * Sets WebRTC configuration.<br>
15700          * 
15701          * @param {Object} param
15702          * <ul>
15703          *   <li>{String} param.key [Required] - configuration key to be set.
15704          *   <li>{String} param.value [Required] - configuration value to be set.<br>
15705          *   <div>
15706          *     <table class="hcap_spec">
15707          *       <thead>
15708          *         <tr>
15709          *           <th>Key</th>
15710          *           <th>Description</th>
15711          *           <th>Read/Write</th>
15712          *           <th>Value Format</th>
15713          *           <th>Value example (default value for the predefined value set)</th>
15714          *         </tr>
15715          *       </thead>
15716          *       <tbody>
15717          *       <tr class="odd">
15718          *         <td>ice_cfg</td>
15719          *         <td class="left">STUN/TURN server infomation</td>
15720          *         <td>Read/Write</td>
15721          *         <td class="left">[version string]<br>';' '|' ':'</td>
15722          *         <td>stun:stun.l.google.com:19302;turn:89.108.113.194:3478|webrtc|webrtc</td>
15723          *       </tr>
15724          *       <tr>
15725          *         <td>peer_server_name</td>
15726          *         <td class="left">IP address of peer connection server</td>
15727          *         <td>Read/Write</td>
15728          *         <td class="left">[version string]<br>ip address</td>
15729          *         <td>192.168.0.2</td>
15730          *       </tr>
15731          *       <tr class="odd">
15732          *         <td>peer_server_port</td>
15733          *         <td class="left">Port number of peer connection server</td>
15734          *         <td>Read/Write</td>
15735          *         <td class="left">[version string]<br>integer</td>
15736          *         <td>8888</td>
15737          *       </tr>
15738          *       <tr>
15739          *         <td>user_name</td>
15740          *         <td class="left">User name to log-in</td>
15741          *         <td>Read/Write</td>
15742          *         <td class="left">[version string]<br>free format string</td>
15743          *         <td>Andy</td>
15744          *       </tr>
15745          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15746          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15747          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15748          *       // No Parameter. 
15749          *   }</pre>
15750          *   </li>
15751          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15752          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15753          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15754          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15755          *   }</pre>
15756          *   </li>
15757          * </ul>
15758          *  
15759          * @since 1.19.1
15760          * 
15761          * @see 
15762          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
15763          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
15764          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15765          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15766          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
15767          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
15768          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
15769          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
15770          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
15771          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
15772          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
15773          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
15774          *
15775          * @example
15776          * hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration({
15777          *      "key" : "max_height",
15778          *      "value" : "480",
15779          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
15780          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15781          *      }, 
15782          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15783          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15784          *      }
15785          * });
15786          */
15787         hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration = function (param) {
15788             hcap_command("webrtc_set_configuration", param);
15789         };
15790         /**
15791         * Gets WebRTC configurations. This return the list of configrations.<br>
15792         *
15793         * @param {Object} param
15794         * <ul>
15795         *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15796         *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15797         *   param.onSuccess = function (param) {
15798         *       // {String} param.configurations - configurations string.
15799         *   }</pre>
15800         *   </li>
15801         *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional]  - failure callback function.
15802         *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15803         *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15804         *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15805         *   }</pre>
15806         *   </li>
15807         * </ul>
15808         *  
15809         * @since 1.19.1
15810         * 
15811         * @see 
15812         * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
15813         * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
15814         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15815         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15816         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
15817         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
15818         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
15819         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
15820         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
15821         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
15822         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
15823         * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.showDiagnostics">hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics()</a><br>
15824         *
15825         * @example
15826         * hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration({
15827         *      "onSuccess" : function(s) {
15828         *          console.log("onSuccess : configurations = " + s.configurations);
15829         *      }, 
15830         *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15831         *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15832         *      }
15833         * });
15834         */
15835         hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration = function (param) {
15836             hcap_command("webrtc_get_configuration", param);
15837         };
15838         /**
15839          * Shows diagnostics.<br>
15840          * 
15841          * @param {Object} param
15842          * <ul>
15843          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
15844          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15845          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
15846          *       // No Parameter.
15847          *   }</pre>
15848          *   </li>
15849          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
15850          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
15851          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
15852          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
15853          *   }</pre>
15854          *   </li>
15855          * </ul>
15856          *  
15857          * @since 1.19.1
15858          * 
15859          * @see 
15860          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_message_received">{Event} webrtc_message_received</a><br>
15861          * <a href="_global_.html#event:webrtc_event_received">{Event} webrtc_event_received</a><br>
15862          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.startPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15863          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopPreviewVideo">hcap.webrtc.stopPreviewVideo()</a><br>
15864          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.incomingCall">hcap.webrtc.incomingCall()</a><br>
15865          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.outgoingCall">hcap.webrtc.outgoingCall()</a><br>
15866          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.endCall">hcap.webrtc.endCall()</a><br>
15867          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.acceptMessage">hcap.webrtc.acceptMessage()</a><br>
15868          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.startCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.startCheckAudio()</a><br>
15869          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.stopCheckAudio">hcap.webrtc.stopCheckAudio()</a><br>
15870          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.setConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.setConfiguration()</a><br>
15871          * <a href="hcap.webrtc.html#.getConfiguration">hcap.webrtc.getConfiguration()</a><br>
15872          *
15873          * @example
15874          * hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics({
15875          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
15876          *          console.log("onSuccess");
15877          *      }, 
15878          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
15879          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
15880          *      }
15881          * });
15882          */
15883         hcap.webrtc.showDiagnostics = function (param) {
15884             hcap_command("webrtc_show_diagnostics", param);
15885         };
15886          /** 
15887          * @namespace hcap.security
15888          */
15889         hcap.security = { };
15890         /**
15891          * Registers a server certificate to validate the keys from the HCAP server as part of a PKI (Public Key Infrastructure).<br>
15892          * If you want to register a server certificate, the property "browser_https_security_level" should be replaced from "1" to "0".<br>
15893          * After registration, reboot is needed.<br>
15894          * Handling (Register/Unregister) server/client certificates must be done very carefully under the control of installer or hotelier because it is done in insecure environment.<br>
15895          * If a server certificate is registered, TV will validate the public key from the HCAP server when TV requests resources to the HCAP server in the modules like HCAP MW, Ez-i and HCAP browser in charge of downloads or loads of HCAP applications.<br>
15896          * The server certificate to register can be a self-signed certificate or a CA (Certificate Authority) certificate.<br>
15897          * Only 1 server certificate is permitted in TV. Therefore to register a server certificate when another server certificate was registered, revoke(unregister) the registered server certificate first, and register the new server certificate. Or the registration for the new server certificate will be failed.<br><br>
15898          * This feature was tested with following settings in Ubuntu 12.04 LTS and the apache server as the HTTPS HCAP server.<br>
15899          * Reference : <a href="http://theheat.dk/blog/?p=1023">Create a CA, issue server/client certificates and test them via Apache</a><br>
15900          * <pre style="background-color: lightgray">
15901 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate$ mkdir demoCA
15902 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate$ cd demoCA
15903 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ mkdir certs
15904 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ mkdir csr
15905 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ mkdir newcerts
15906 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ mkdir private
15907 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ cp ../openssl.cnf .
15908 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ echo 00 > serial
15909 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ echo 00 > crlnumber
15910 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ touch index.txt
15911 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ pwd
15912 /home/user/certificate/demoCA
15913 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ vi openssl.cnf
15914 
15915 >>> Change dir in CA_default
15916 [ CA_default ]
15917 
15918 dir             = ./demoCA         # Where everything is kept
15919 >>>>
15920 dir             = /home/user/certificate/demoCA         # Where everything is kept
15921 
15922 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl genrsa -des3 -passout pass:passcode -out  private/rootCA.key 2048
15923 Generating RSA private key, 2048 bit long modulus
15924 ...........................................................+++
15925 ......................................................+++
15926 e is 65537 (0x10001)
15927 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl rsa -passin pass:passcode -in private/rootCA.key -out private/rootCA.key
15928 writing RSA key
15929 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl req -config openssl.cnf -new -x509 -subj '/C=KR/L=LGE/O=CTO CA/CN=ROOT CA' -days 3650 -key private/rootCA.key -out certs/rootCA.crt
15930 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl genrsa -des3 -passout pass:passcode -out private/jkcloud.key 2048
15931 Generating RSA private key, 2048 bit long modulus
15932 ................+++
15933 .................................................+++
15934 e is 65537 (0x10001)
15935 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl rsa -passin pass:passcode -in private/jkcloud.key -out private/jkcloud.key
15936 writing RSA key
15937 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl req -config openssl.cnf -new -subj '/C=KR/L=LGE/O=CTO/CN=jkcloud.lge.com' -key private/jkcloud.key -out csr/jkcloud.csr
15938 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl ca -batch -config openssl.cnf -days 3650 -in csr/jkcloud.csr -out certs/jkcloud.crt -keyfile private/rootCA.key -cert certs/rootCA.crt -policy policy_anything
15939 Using configuration from openssl.cnf
15940 Check that the request matches the signature
15941 Signature ok
15942 Certificate Details:
15943         Serial Number: 0 (0x0)
15944         Validity
15945             Not Before: Mar 21 06:52:38 2016 GMT
15946             Not After : Mar 19 06:52:38 2026 GMT
15947         Subject:
15948             countryName               = KR
15949             localityName              = LGE
15950             organizationName          = CTO
15951             commonName                = jkcloud.lge.com
15952         X509v3 extensions:
15953             X509v3 Basic Constraints: 
15954                 CA:FALSE
15955             Netscape Comment: 
15956                 OpenSSL Generated Certificate
15957             X509v3 Subject Key Identifier: 
15958                 3F:87:5F:F8:76:65:12:96:AF:D6:4B:BC:AA:FA:1E:36:76:5F:8A:FE
15959             X509v3 Authority Key Identifier: 
15960                 keyid:85:20:EF:03:87:EA:73:32:10:5D:B2:3B:92:42:4F:3C:66:65:6A:E0
15961 
15962 Certificate is to be certified until Mar 19 06:52:38 2026 GMT (3650 days)
15963 
15964 Write out database with 1 new entries
15965 Data Base Updated
15966 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl genrsa -des3 -passout pass:passcode -out private/client_x86Emul.key 2048
15967 Generating RSA private key, 2048 bit long modulus
15968 ...................................................................................................................................................................................................................................+++
15969 ...................................................................................................................+++
15970 e is 65537 (0x10001)
15971 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl rsa -passin pass:passcode -in private/client_x86Emul.key -out private/client_x86Emul.key
15972 writing RSA key
15973 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl req -config openssl.cnf -new -subj '/C=KR/L=LGE/O=CTO/CN=x86Emul' -key private/client_x86Emul.key -out csr/client_x86Emul.csr
15974 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ openssl ca -batch -config openssl.cnf -days 3650 -in csr/client_x86Emul.csr -out certs/client_x86Emul.crt -keyfile private/rootCA.key -cert certs/rootCA.crt -policy policy_anything
15975 Using configuration from openssl.cnf
15976 Check that the request matches the signature
15977 Signature ok
15978 Certificate Details:
15979         Serial Number: 1 (0x1)
15980         Validity
15981             Not Before: Mar 21 06:53:26 2016 GMT
15982             Not After : Mar 19 06:53:26 2026 GMT
15983         Subject:
15984             countryName               = KR
15985             localityName              = LGE
15986             organizationName          = CTO
15987             commonName                = x86Emul
15988         X509v3 extensions:
15989             X509v3 Basic Constraints: 
15990                 CA:FALSE
15991             Netscape Comment: 
15992                 OpenSSL Generated Certificate
15993             X509v3 Subject Key Identifier: 
15994                 EE:1A:6C:59:3B:13:FA:32:A7:61:60:2A:6C:56:66:82:AB:21:CD:05
15995             X509v3 Authority Key Identifier: 
15996                 keyid:85:20:EF:03:87:EA:73:32:10:5D:B2:3B:92:42:4F:3C:66:65:6A:E0
15997 
15998 Certificate is to be certified until Mar 19 06:53:26 2026 GMT (3650 days)
15999 
16000 Write out database with 1 new entries
16001 Data Base Updated
16002 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ find
16003 .
16004 ./serial.old
16005 ./newcerts
16006 ./newcerts/00.pem
16007 ./newcerts/01.pem
16008 ./serial
16009 ./index.txt.attr
16010 ./openssl.cnf
16011 ./certs
16012 ./certs/rootCA.crt
16013 ./certs/client_x86Emul.crt
16014 ./certs/jkcloud.crt
16015 ./crlnumber
16016 ./index.txt.attr.old
16017 ./csr
16018 ./csr/jkcloud.csr
16019 ./csr/client_x86Emul.csr
16020 ./private
16021 ./private/client_x86Emul.key
16022 ./private/jkcloud.key
16023 ./private/rootCA.key
16024 ./index.txt.old
16025 ./index.txt
16026 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$
16027 
16028 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ sudo vi /etc/apache2/sites-available/default-ssl
16029 [sudo] password for user: 
16030 >>> Change as following
16031         SSLEngine on # enable for server/client certificate
16032 
16033         SSLCertificateFile    /home/user/certificate/demoCA/certs/jkcloud.crt # for server certificate
16034         SSLCertificateKeyFile /home/user/certificate/demoCA/private/jkcloud.key # for server certificate
16035 
16036         SSLCACertificateFile /home/user/certificate/demoCA/certs/rootCA.crt # for client certificate
16037 
16038         SSLVerifyClient require # for client certificate
16039         SSLVerifyDepth  10 # for client certificate
16040 
16041 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ sudo a2enmod ssl
16042 Module ssl already enabled
16043 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ sudo a2ensite default-ssl
16044 Site default-ssl already enabled
16045 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$ sudo service apache2 restart
16046  * Restarting web server apache2                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         ... waiting                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     [ OK ]
16047 user@lgesccicbld28v:~/certificate/demoCA$
16048          * </pre><br>
16049          * In above example, register rootCA.crt to TV as the server certificate with <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerServerCertificate">hcap.security.registerServerCertificate()</a>.<br>
16050          * And in the server, register jkcloud.crt and jkcloud.key to SSLCertificateFile and SSLCertificateKeyFile respectively if the server is the apache server.<br> 
16051          * 
16052          * @param {Object} param
16053          * <ul>
16054          *   <li>{String} param.nickname [Required] - nickname for this server certificate as 4 to 10-character string chosen from the set [a-zA-Z0-9].<br>
16055          *   <li>{String} param.certificate [Required] - certificate string of the full contents in the server certificate file (public root CA of the server certificate file) in the form of PEM (rootCA.crt in above example).<br>
16056          *   <li>{Boolean} param.enableVerifyHost [Required] - true for verifying the server to connect to has the same hostname in the certificate (if the verification is failed, the connection will be failed), otherwise false.<br>
16057          *   <li>{Boolean} param.isSelfSigned [Required] - true if the server certificate is self-signed, otherwise false.<br>
16058          *   <li>{String} param.accessCode [Required] - password as 4 to 10-character string chosen from the set [a-zA-Z0-9] to get whether this certificate is registered or not, or revoke this certificate in the future.<br>
16059          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16060          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16061          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16062          *       // No Parameter. 
16063          *   }</pre>
16064          *   </li>
16065          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16066          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16067          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
16068          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16069          *   }</pre>
16070          *   </li>
16071          * </ul>
16072          *  
16073          * @since 1.20.0
16074          * 
16075          * @see 
16076          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerClientCertificate">hcap.security.registerClientCertificate()</a><br>
16077          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterServerCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterServerCertificate()</a><br>
16078          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterClientCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterClientCertificate()</a><br>
16079          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existServerCertificate">hcap.security.existServerCertificate()</a><br>
16080          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existClientCertificate">hcap.security.existClientCertificate()</a><br>
16081          *
16082          * @example
16083          * hcap.security.registerServerCertificate({
16084          *      "nickname" : "testserver",
16085          *      "certificate" : "\
16086          *-----BEGIN CERTIFICATE-----\n\
16087          *MIIDXzCCAkegAwIBAgIJALispfP+z4ZZMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAMEYxCzAJBgNV\n\
16088          *BAYTAktSMQwwCgYDVQQHDANMR0UxDzANBgNVBAoMBkNUTyBDQTEYMBYGA1UEAwwP\n\
16089          *amtjbG91ZC5sZ2UuY29tMB4XDTE2MDMxNzAzMDUzMFoXDTI2MDMxNTAzMDUzMFow\n\
16090          *RjELMAkGA1UEBhMCS1IxDDAKBgNVBAcMA0xHRTEPMA0GA1UECgwGQ1RPIENBMRgw\n\
16091          *FgYDVQQDDA9qa2Nsb3VkLmxnZS5jb20wggEiMA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBAQUAA4IBDwAw\n\
16092          *ggEKAoIBAQCwdor7TwwIIuTI8HvOBx//cBlu+xE1L/9ZAWaIRivK/O/1Bv+jTxpx\n\
16093          *5RN9RttmJle9QS8Tx6/Wf40REt9Lnc1fUCdVILSkTrcHY4Wcc5cqvt0Uz17kcaTJ\n\
16094          *Q6Ch2wiyq2ZSj2vTQAhQfV0cpvwJTYKwXCSeL8M10KZqeU/41PITp/67MzCZF+BT\n\
16095          *gTm60UTfrc/Owe8q2yn3di7wKiuEwP5WROGa/HkOrWJfkx0DjAlO79tZoUmyd4RH\n\
16096          *C6R3ST8lbCMtttDd8JGHlCSVRf9NIQc71M88vgYY7Dh9POfCfhxkVA9/ws5h7aHt\n\
16097          *t0vAqmRN6vgFhBPhmTUp+eoUl+3nf0aVAgMBAAGjUDBOMB0GA1UdDgQWBBQkXPyq\n\
16098          *koD+LlrJgYRvkiqg5KDJJTAfBgNVHSMEGDAWgBQkXPyqkoD+LlrJgYRvkiqg5KDJ\n\
16099          *JTAMBgNVHRMEBTADAQH/MA0GCSqGSIb3DQEBBQUAA4IBAQCcK/JXi0aaQ1RiToTK\n\
16100          *stYpMZjTtmiDqgpdHkhsU0H2EwVW46j4xaALzLoSWx4neREJS1KPJ4Wh6PT9554S\n\
16101          *wI/9yIjiqJlsHmU3h3FxjO5NRO9Qu+o9MeLAGAJs9M49NS0TiJYo1V7beyI5ju99\n\
16102          *xs887ac5F/Axg3Pb4sX1Wo5xTB2Bw+bKMHj0Rk+9uDrGqsrPpX39R8CL0W/1ISU5\n\
16103          *ioOvHBHeyw2PzqO4KbIXrvj0dihDBWc/SltS/4htXs4JL76rA7+Byj9AUVxrm2QK\n\
16104          *gmsignOklllYUkLdIjLPyJy8tDUFTcR4oElWN+mGME4zl0x8mCaTaPf8niBw9hfI\n\
16105          *Cymj\n\
16106          *-----END CERTIFICATE-----\n",
16107          *      "enableVerifyHost" : true,
16108          *      "isSelfSigned" : true,
16109          *      "accessCode" : "passCode1",
16110          *      "onSuccess" : function() {
16111          *          console.log("onSuccess");
16112          *      }, 
16113          *      "onFailure" : function(f) {
16114          *          console.log("onFailure : errorMessage = " + f.errorMessage);
16115          *      }
16116          * });
16117          */
16118         hcap.security.registerServerCertificate = function (param) {
16119             hcap_command("register_server_certificate", param);
16120         };
16121         /**
16122          * Registers a client certificate and its private key for TLS and SSL client authentication.<br>
16123          * After registration, reboot is needed.<br>
16124          * If a client certificate is registered, TV will try to authenticate to the HCAP server with the client certificate in the modules like HCAP middleware, Ez-i and HCAP browser in charge of downloads or loads of HCAP applications.<br>
16125          * The client certificate to register can be a self-signed certificate or a trusted CA (Certificate Authority) certificate.<br>
16126          * Only 1 client certificate is permitted in TV. Therefore to register a client certificate when another client certificate was registered, revoke(unregister) the registered client certificate first, and register the new client certificate. Or the registration for the new client certificate will be failed.<br>
16127          * Please refer to the example code to create server/client self-signed certificates in <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerServerCertificate">hcap.security.registerServerCertificate()</a>
16128          * And register client_x86Emul.crt, client_x86Emul.key and rootCA.crt to TV as the client certificate, the client private key and the CA certificate repectively in the example code and its server environment.<br>
16129          * urlPattern and issuerCN are needed to match the HCAP app url and its client certificate automatically in HCAP browser.<br>
16130          * 
16131          * @param {Object} param
16132          * <ul>
16133          *   <li>{String} param.nickname [Required] - nickname for this client certificate as 4 to 10-character string chosen from the set [a-zA-Z0-9].<br>
16134          *   <li>{String} param.certificate [Required] - certificate string of the full contents in the client certificate file in the form of PEM (client_x86Emul.crt in above example).<br>
16135          *   <li>{String} param.key [Required] - certificate string of the full contents in the client private key file in the form of PEM (client_x86Emul.key in above example).<br>
16136          *   <li>{String} param.keyPassword [Required] - password string of the client private key ("passcode" in above example).<br>
16137          *   <li>{String} param.cacert [Required] - certificate string of the full contents in the CA certificate file of the client certificate in the form of PEM (rootCA.crt in above example).<br>
16138          *   <li>{String} param.urlPattern [Required] - url pattern string to specify sites for which HCAP browser automatically selects a client certificate if the site requests a certificate (ex. "https://jkcloud.lge.com").<br>
16139          *   <li>{String} param.issuerCN [Required] - CommonName string of the issuer of the client certificate ("ROOT CA" in above example).<br>
16140          *   <li>{Boolean} param.isSelfSigned [Required] - true if the client certificate is self-signed, otherwise false.<br>
16141          *   <li>{String} param.accessCode [Required] - password as 4 to 10-character string chosen from the set [a-zA-Z0-9] to get whether this certificate is registered or not, or revoke this certificate in the future.<br>
16142          *   <li>{Function} param.onSuccess [Optional] - success callback function.
16143          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16144          *   param.onSuccess = function() {
16145          *       // No Parameter. 
16146          *   }</pre>
16147          *   </li>
16148          *   <li>{Function} param.onFailure [Optional] - failure callback function.
16149          *   <pre class="code prettyprint">
16150          *   param.onFailure = function (param) {
16151          *       // {String} param.errorMessage - in case of failure, this message provides the details.
16152          *   }</pre>
16153          *   </li>
16154          * </ul>
16155          *  
16156          * @since 1.20.0
16157          * 
16158          * @see 
16159          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.registerServerCertificate">hcap.security.registerServerCertificate()</a><br>
16160          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterServerCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterServerCertificate()</a><br>
16161          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.unregisterClientCertificate">hcap.security.unregisterClientCertificate()</a><br>
16162          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existServerCertificate">hcap.security.existServerCertificate()</a><br>
16163          * <a href="hcap.security.html#.existClientCertificate">hcap.security.existClientCertificate()</a><br>
16164          *
16165          * @example
16166          * hcap.security.registerClientCertificate({
16167          *      "nickname" : "testclient",
16168          *      "certificate" : "\
16169          *Certificate:\n\
16170          *    Data:\n\
16171          *        Version: 3 (0x2)\n\
16172          *        Serial Number: 1 (0x1)\n\
16173          *    Signature Algorithm: sha1WithRSAEncryption\n\
16174          *        Issuer: C=KR, L=LGE, O=CTO CA, CN=ROOT CA\n\
16175          *        Validity\n\
16176          *            Not Before: Mar 21 06:53:26 2016 GMT\n\
16177          *            Not After : Mar 19 06:53:26 2026 GMT\n\
16178          *        Subject: C=KR, L=LGE, O=CTO, CN=x86Emul\n\
16179          *        Subject Public Key Info:\n\
16180          *            Public Key Algorithm: rsaEncryption\n\
16181          *                Public-Key: (2048 bit)\n\
16182          *                Modulus:\n\
16183          *                    00:a2:e3:4d:39:47:6f:9c:bb:7e:fb:90:43:8a:29:\n\
16184          *                    7f:3a:b2:4e:32:83:bd:1f:16:c1:0b:d2:cd:e7:22:\n\
16185          *                    33:f3:19:41:ea:db:ec:0a:3d:e9:4c:00:8c:e2:8d:\n\
16186          *                    57:d8:b0:12:af:50:66:df:6f:f5:65:d8:91:c0:a8:\n\
16187          *                    f6:87:b7:fa:ed:7c:32:bf:25:d3:18:a3:bc:3b:f8:\n\
16188          *                    0c:d5:bc:03:99:7d:c6:fd:72:d6:19:c7:3f:4c:7b:\n\
16189          *                    8f:1a:d8:c3:b6:15:01:82:99:a8:2d:b0:79:36:86:\n\
16190          *                    2a:cb:dc:43:a5:30:ab:fd:31:70:76:e4:01:67:73:\n\
16191          *                    d9:bd:7a:20:d9:49:f4:11:61:de:b9:6b:80:d5:83:\n\
16192          *                    5f:1b:e0:34:fa:af:3c:b9:26:84:1b:ca:16:a5:02:\n\
16193          *                    be:f9:fa:bc:19:f1:84:a9:13:7b:32:04:68:ba:c3:\n\
16194          *                    66:69:8a:b8:84:19:bf:15:72:df:37:68:83:cb:e5:\n\
16195          *                    4b:e2:59:8c:4e:e0:42:3b:ea:a6:39:85:1e:ae:41:\n\
16196          *                    c4:a6:17:06:a2:02:d6:c4:cb:53:0d:f7:2e:e7:28:\n\
16197          *                    20:35:a7:3e:02:9c:38:68:1c:d6:18:c0:39:24:1d:\n\
16198          *                    f2:96:c5:81:f1:c2:de:22:e0:d4:f0:02:72:9c:e8:\n\
16199          *                    c1:d0:28:46:60:1e:6d:52:78:f4:48:94:80:9b:01:\n\
16200          *                    dc:eb\n\
16201          *                Exponent: 65537 (0x10001)\n\
16202          *        X509v3 extensions:\n\
16203          *            X509v3 Basic Constraints: \n\
16204          *                CA:FALSE\n\
16205          *            Netscape Comment: \n\
16206          *                OpenSSL Generated Certificate\n\
16207          *            X509v3 Subject Key Identifier: \n\
16208          *                EE:1A:6C:59:3B:13:FA:32:A7:61:60:2A:6C:56:66:82:AB:21:CD:05\n\
16209          *            X509v3 Authority Key Identifier: \n\
16210          *                keyid:85:20:EF:03:87:EA:73:32:10:5D:B2:3B:92:42:4F:3C:66:65:6A:E0\n\
16211          *\n\
16212          *    Signature Algorithm: sha1WithRSAEncryption\n\
16213          *         92:a7:bd:83:65:de:c9:bd:cb:57:c0:46:c0:16:e7:7e:0a:e6:\n\
16214          *         67:96:ab:45:38:91:2a:6e:b8:5c:07:8a:58:0d:56:0b:79:e6:\n\
16215          *         00:c4:0e:ce:86:ae:07:cb:69:bf:24:d9:69:fe:59:b6:31:b9:\n\
16216          *         82:79:75:1a:64:41:45:2d:d9:83:c2:5b:f9:5c:80:1b:ea:1a:\n\
16217          *         14:c7:5e:9e:f9:1e:7e:1c:fc:a3:55:1b:9a:df:cd:38:f7:e9:\n\
16218          *         24:ac:ce:b0:91:93:a6:a8:45:99:c3:77:c8:e4:86:4c:8a:11:\n\

16220          *         96:dd:80:0f:99:24:0f:40:b1:65:d0:7f:87:4d:d3:36:b1:da:\n\
